loans.name: Isidro Eradio

texts.es:
El señor Isidro P. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario se dedica a laborar con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

La razón por la que el señor Esidro ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de la compara de sus productos para comercializarlos en su localidad y así continuar mejorando su condición en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidro P.'s business is to sell electrical appliances on a daily basis, with much effort, at the market "Central" of the town of Chinandega. It is his goal to improve his living conditions.

The reason why Mr. Isidra has approached Ceprodel is because he needs to buy products to be sold in his town and thus continue to improve the condition of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa T., 42, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $140).

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, weed killer, knives and sacks of  fertilizer

loans.name: Simativa

texts.en: Simativa A. is 43 years old and married with six children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business, and sells to the public seven days per week. Simativa has no previous loans with Kiva partner, SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 WST. SPBD loans are Simativa’s only access to capital because she has never qualified for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, a cooler, and fishing equipment such as goggles, a spear and a torch

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Fatima R. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee ella misma en su establecimiento con el propósito de salir adelante en su vida.

Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y así suplir sus estantes para atender a sus clientes en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Chinandega, Mrs. Fatima R. owns a local store as her goal is to get ahead in life.

Presently she needs to invest in her business and for that reason she has approached Ceprodel to benefit from a loan in order to buy products for her local store and thus supply the shelves so she can serve her clients properly in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime P., 41, is married with six children. She has two years of experience in the general-store business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. This is her first loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $250).

SPBD loans are Menime’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase frozen foods, snacks, beverages, tinned foods, sugar, flour, salt, rice, onions, diapers, toilet paper and soap

loans.name: Francisca Diojana

texts.es:
La señora Francisca A. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de queso teniendo su establecimiento en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde se dedica a comercializarlo.

El motivo por el cual la señora A. ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra del queso ya que lo requiere con mucha urgencia y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca A. works arduously in her business selling cheese. Her establishment is located at the market "Central" of Chinandega.

The reason why Mrs. A. has approached Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan in order to buy cheese urgently so she can get ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese.

loans.name: Pucarita Chica Group

texts.es: Este grupo esta conformado por personas D. distintas actividades económicas y tmabién clases sociales y culturales. Las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades como ser: venta D. carne y verduras, tienda, compra y venta D. celulares, compra y venta D. llantas usadas, peluquería. Existe competencia con otras instituciones, pero prefieren Agrocapital porque existe la devolución D. ahorros D. inmediato. Generalmente el crédito destina para aumento D. capital D. trabajo. Las señoras anteriormente trabajaron en otras financieras o sea que las socias conocen la metodología D. banca comunal.
texts.en:
This group is maD. up of individuals from different economic activities as well as from different social and cultural levels. The partners have different activities such as sale of meat and vegetables, store, buying and selling cell phones, buying and selling used tires, hairdressing. There is competition with other institutions but they prefer Agrocapital as the devolution of savings is immediate. Generally the loan will be used to increase work capital. The ladies have previously worked with other financiers so the partner are acquainted with the methodology of communal banking.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jessica Ketty

texts.es:
JESSICA KETTY V. D. L. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Sucre N°  1014 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 24 años D. edad.

ElL. se dedica a administrar su propio negocio D. venta D. bebidas gaseosas y golosinas pero además venD. ropa, sabanas, zapatos, etc.; D. acuerdo a L. temporada.  Su primer préstamo fue hace 03 años y el monto fue D. S/. 300 nuevos soles con lo cual empezó su pequeña empresa.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en L. compra D. ropa D. temporada para las fiestas patronales D.  San Juan, además comprará golosinas y demás bebidas gaseosas.

DesD. que esta con ManueL. Ramos, siente que hay un apoyo cercano y está conforme con los préstamos que ha recibido, y por ello elL. no se atrasa en el pago D. sus cuotas, por el contrario hace todo lo posible para estar al día.
texts.en:
Jessica Ketty V. D. L. C. is a partner of "Banco Comunal "Las Dalilas", located in Jr. Sucre No. 1014 of the District of Callería. She is 24 years old.

She administers her own business selling pops and candy, and she sells clothes, sheets, shoes, etc., according to the season, as well. Her first loan was 3 years ago and the amount was S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she started her small enterprise.

With this loan of S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles she will invest in buying garments for the season of the patron saint, San Juan's festivities. She will also buy candy and pops.

Since she has been with ManueL. Ramos she feels close support and she is satisfied with the loans she has received and therefore she is not late with her payments, on the contrary she does whatever it takes to be punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of garments, candy and pops.

loans.name: Reina De

texts.es: La sra. Reina L., cuenta con 37 años, casada con el sr. Moisés, contando con una hija de 15 años y viven casa propia, también señalar que su negocio se encuentra en su propio inmueble, contando con computadoras, mas puntos de llamadas, los cuales tiene funcionando hace 55 meses, también percibe renta diaria fija de su taxi y el esposo trabaja de maestro albañil mas un salario de indemnización por la vitalicia de su ojo derecho. Su competencia es mínima en el Internet- punto de llamada ya que no hay muchos en su barrio y dentro de la zona---el destino del crédito fue para la ampliación de su inmueble.-- la cliente cuenta con un buen comportamiento en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Ms. Reina L. is 37 years old. She is married to Mr. Moisés. They have a 15-year-old daughter and live in their own home. They also point out that their business is in their own property. They have computers, which have been working for 55 months, and Call Point. They also receive fixed daily rent from their taxi and her husband works as a master bricklayer. They also have severance pay for life for his right eye. They have minimal Internet/Call Point competition since there aren’t many in their neighborhood or in the area. The loan is to make their property bigger. This client has a good history with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ampliación inmueble

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Mayra Damaris se dedica a su negocio de carnicería el cual posee en su propio establecimiento vendiendo todo tipo de carne con el propósito de salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Ha logrado mejorar su negocio a raíz de sus esfuerzos y hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para la compra de la carne y así comercializarla en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mayra Damaris has a butcher shop in the city of Chinandega. Her butcher shop is located in her own establishment, where she sells all types of meat with the goal of progressing in life and supporting her household. She has managed to improve her business thanks to her hard workd and today hopes that Ceprodel will grant her loan to buy meat and sell it from her butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat for resale

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele P., 60, is married with four children. She has three years of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the general public two days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (about $291). SPBD loans are Pele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy goods for the bingo prizes.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, sugar, flour, salt, soaps, detergents and a box of noodles for bingo prizes

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema A., 32, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the taro and banana chips business. She sells to the general public five days per week.

This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (about $150). SPBD loans are Tumema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase taro, bunches of bananas, vegetable cooking oil, fryer and salt

loans.name: Pacajes Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Juan Pablo II, a este pertenece la asociación “Pacajes”, actualmente esta formada por catorce miembros.
Un grupo muy alegre que  con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos, trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.
La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas, Actualmente viven en alquiler en cuartos que con el paso del tiempo y el crecer de sus hijos les han quedado pequeños, tiene el sueño de poder comprar una casa propia para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos,  por lo que trabajan desde muy temprano en sus diferentes negocios.
Diferentes son las actividades de la asociación Pacajes; algunas de ellas se dedican a la costura, otras realizan tejidos a mano de chompas y mantas, también se dedican a la artesanía en  hojalata y otros a la tapicería. 
Solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan comprar materia prima y realizar obras de mejor calidad, con esto mejorarían sus ingresos, con el único de objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Pacajes” group, which is formed by 14 members, meets in the Juan Pablo II focal center in the city of El Alto. It is a very joyful group, that, with the assistance of loans, is able to work with much responsibility.

The majority of group members are married with large families. Currently, they live in rented rooms, that with the passage of time have become crowded due to the growth of their families. They have the dream of being able to buy homes of their own to offer greater comfort to their children, and for this they work from very early in the morning in their different businesses.

The activities of the Pacajes group are diverse: some of the members sew, others create handmade sweaters and blankets, and some also make artistic tapestries and tinplate artwork.

The group members seek this loan with the goal of increasing their sales. For this, they will need to buy raw materials and complete high quality projects with which they will increase their income - the main objective of which is to improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Roca & Coronado Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Roca y Coronado", no presentan nexos consanguíneos entre ellas. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida por las noches y son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras comercian con artículos varios, el presidente del grupo es carpintero. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en lo que se refiere a cada uno D. sus rubros. Efectivamente las socias comentan que trabajan con créditos D. otras instituciones financieras. Lo que respecta a Agrocapital  se encuentran en su 1er ciclo.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Roca y Coronado" are not related by blood. The members of this bank participate in different activities: Some sell food in the evenings and sell cosmetics, others commercialize various items, and the president of the group is a carpenter.

Like with all industries, there is always competition of supply and demand. This loan will be used to diversify the products sold and to invest in each of the businesses. The members of this group comment that they have worked with loans from other financial institutions. This is their first loan with Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Juana C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras como chiltomas, tomates y repollos ofrecidas en su pequeño establecimiento en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Actualmente ha logrado salir adelante y para ello una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las verduras y de esta manera continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Juana C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras como chiltomas, tomates y repollos ofrecidas en su pequeño establecimiento en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente ha logrado salir adelante y para ello una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las verduras y de esta manera continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de verduras

loans.name: La Amistad #2 Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Ana Santiago C. R., Ivonne P. y Simona García.

El grupo solidario La Amistad #2, es originario de la comarca La Reforma perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, ellas compran las cosechas en las comarcas vecinas y sacan el producto al mercado.

Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Ana Santiago C. una  mujer adulta, que su activad económica que es la compra y venta de Frutas y verduras en el mercado, tiene un puesto donde paga un pequeño impuesto durante la mañana y luego recorre todo el mercado ofreciendo sus productos.
Se propone pagar los créditos con mucha puntualidad y animar a las integrantes para salir adelante, ella es la coordinadora del grupo. Su meta es de mejorar su vivienda y dejarla como ella quiere, para cuando sea mayor tenga comodidades y con el crédito ella piensa seguir invirtiendo para tener mas clientes y mayores ventas.
Las integrantes expresan que han tenido buenas ganancias con los créditos obtenidos, estos los invierten en temporadas que saben que hay demanda y buen precio.
Doña Ivonne P.  se dedica a la elaboración de ropa como delantales, gabachas y ropa que personas de la comunidad le encargan, ella entrega a algunas personas que venden ambulante. Vive con sus dos hijos adolescentes, ella es madre soltera y mantiene los gastos del hogar con su trabajo.

Doña Simona se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella compra las frutas en la zona donde vive y algunas en el mercado. Sueña  con mejorar su vivienda para sus hijos y ella, es madre soltera y ha criado a sus hijos sola, son jóvenes y trabajan junto a ella en el mercado.
texts.en:
Photo, from left to right: Ana Santiago C. R., Ivonne P. and Simona García. The group "La Amistad #2 is originally from the La Reforma area of the city of Masaya. In general, the group is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables in the municipal market. The group members buy the crops in the neighboring areas and bring the products to the market. The three group members have a high level of trust among them, as they are neighbors and work together to buy some of the products in order to get better prices. Ana Santiago C. is a grown woman who buys and sells fruit and vegetables in the market. She has a small kiosk where she puts in time in the mornings and later she goes through the entire market offering her products. She intends to repay the loan punctually and to motivate the other group members to keep moving forward, as she is the coordinator of the group. Her goal is to make improvements to her home and to have it just the way she likes it so that when she is older she can be comfortable. She would like to invest this loan in order to get more clients and more sales. The group members state that they have seen good earnings from the loans they've obtained, which they have invested in seasons during which there is good demand and a good price. Ivonne P. makes clothes like aprons, "gabachas" (traditional aprons), and clothes ordered by people in her community and delivers to some people who sell door-to-door. She lives with her two teenage children, and she is a single mother supporting the expenses of her family with her work. Simona sells fruits and vegetables. She buys fruit in the area where she lives and some in the local markets. She dreams of improving her home for her children. She is a single mother and has raised her children alone. They are young and work with her in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetables to offer to clients (oranges, avocados, lemons, etc.)

loans.name: Camino A La Luz Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Rosa del Carmen O. H., Blanca Azucena G., María Auxiliadora Chavez y Elena Patricia Mallorquín G..

 El grupo solidario Camino a la Luz, es originario del municipio de Tisma perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la elaboración y venta de cajetas y sacan el producto al mercado.

Las cuatro miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Rosa del Carmen O. H.,  elabora y vende cajetas y comida en la zona franca cercana, ella ofrece a las personas que trabajan en la empresa, tiene clientes fijos. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabaja como chofer de taxi, ella cuida su hijo pequeño y realiza la actividad.
Doña Blanca Azucena G., tiene una mini pulpería en su casa donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad como : arroz, frijoles, queso, pan, gaseosas, etc., ella es madres soltera con tres hijos pequeños que ella mantiene, van a clase a la escuela mas cercana del barrio.
Doña María Auxiliadora C.  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde ofrece refrescos, helados, hielo, gaseosas, etc. Viva sola con su hijo de 18 años quien ya trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Doña Elena Patricia Mallorquín G., elabora cajetas, arroz con leche, atoles y otros postres, ella los ofrece ambulante en el municipio de Tisma y entrega en el mercado a algunos clientes que le compran al por mayor Tiene un hijo pequeño de un año, ella cuida a su hijo y elabora los dulces y sale a venderlos, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa él trabaja en la agricultura en los sembradíos de tomate.Doña Elena sueña con mejorar su casita que es bien humilde e insegura para el invierno, esto ahora que su hijo es pequeño. Anima a las integrantes del grupo para que los pagos sean puntuales y así tener siempre derecho al crédito.
texts.en:
Photo, from left to right: Rosa del Carmen O. H., Blanca Azucena G., María Auxiliadora Chavez, and Elena Patricia Mallorquín G.. The group "Camino a la Luz" is originally from the Tisma area in the city of Masaya. The group creates and sells sweet caramels called "cajetas" and brings the product to to the market. The four group members have a high level of trust among them. They are neighbors and they have come together to purchase products to get a better price. Rosa del Carmen O. H. makes and sells "cajetas" and food in the "zona franca" (the free port) nearby. She offers her products to the people who work there, and she has regular clients. Her husband helps her with the household expenses and works as a taxi driver. She cares for her small child and works. Blanca Azucena G. has a small general store in her home, where she offers to her customers common products such as: rice, beans, cheese, bread, soft drinks, etc. She is a single mother with three small children whom she cares for. The go to the closest school in the neighborhood. María Auxiliadora C. has a small business in her home where she sells snacks, ice creams, ice, soft drinks, etc. She lives alone with her 18 year-old son who works and helps out with her expenses. Elena Patricia Mallorquín G. makes "cajetas," rice pudding, and atole (a kind of thick drink made with corn flour) and other deserts. She offers these products door-to-door in the Tisma area and delivers them to several wholesale clients in the market. She has one small son, who is one year old. She cares for him, makes her sweets and sells them, while her husband helps with the expenses by working in agriculture planting tomatoes. Elena dreams of improving her small home which is very humble, and securing her home for the winter, all while her son is young. She motivates the members of the group to be punctual with their payments so they can have always have access to these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make cajetas (caramels) and sweets like: rice, sugar, milks, tamarind, cacao, and to be able to offer a variety of sweets to customers

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado por el barrio pampa, son personas que no tenían accedo al sistema financiero y están agradecidas con la institución por apoyo que brindan con créditos con intereses bajos y sobre todo porque les da la oportunidad de crecer económicamente en sus negocios. Menciona la tesorera y la presidenta que si en esta oportunidad les va bien seguirán trabajando con la institución para mejorar su calidad de vida. De la mayoría sus negocios son la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The community bank is located in the barrio pampa; these are people who didn't have access to the financial system, and who are very grateful to the institution for the support they provide in the form of low interest loans, and mostly for the opportunity to grow financially in their businesses. The president and the treasurer have indicated that if they are successful this time around they will continue to work with the institution to improve their quality of life. The bulk of their business is the sale of food.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Juana C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras como chiltomas, tomates y repollos ofrecidas en su pequeño establecimiento en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Actualmente ha logrado salir adelante y para ello una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las verduras y de esta manera continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Juana C. has a business selling vegetables like sweet peppers, tomatoes, and cabbage from her small establishment in the central market in town.

Recently she has been able to advance in her business and she has come to Ceprodel (a Kiva partner) one more time to benefit from a loan for the purchase of vegetables. In this way she will be able to continue her business that requires her support.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Nancy Mercedes Tercian V., Karla de los Angeles S. V. y Mercedes del Carmen H. Orozco.
 El grupo solidario Karla, es originario de la comarca Las Flores perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la elaboración ropa, calzado y salón de belleza.
Son bien conocidas entre ellas y de confianza, son mujeres jóvenes que tienen mucho empeño y trabajar y salir adelante, les gusta trabajar con Adim porque reciben capacitaciones de cómo mejorar su negocio.

Doña Nancy elabora ropa, tiene un pequeño taller en su casa de habitación donde elabora delantales, camisas de uniforme escolar y manteles. Es una mujer joven con un niño pequeño, ella inició su taller para tener más ingresos para ayudar con los gastos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa textil y de ahí ella pensó en tener este tipo de negocio.
Doña Mercedes del Carmen se dedica a la elaboración de calzado femenino, tiene dos trabajadores, en su casa está el taller, con el crédito compró pega, cuero, materiales plásticos para dar diseño a las sandalias. Espera poder mejorar el taller y darle más protección para el invierno y no detenerse de trabajar por la lluvia ya que está descubierto.
Doña Karla de los Angeles tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en su casa, tiene buena clientela, necesita el crédito para comprar cosméticos que usa en los arreglos de cabellos y para ofrecer a los clientes que llegan, ella fue elegida como coordinadora del grupo por ser persona responsable en reunir los abonos y dejarlos en las oficinas de Adim, ella sueña con mejorar la sala de belleza y comprar más espejos para dar un mejor ambiente al lugar. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de pollos y le ayuda a los gastos del hogar, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar primaria, este negocio le ha ayudado mucho a mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In photograph from left to right: Nancy Mercedes Tercian Vasquez, Karla de los Angeles S. Vasquez and Mercedes del Carmen Hernandez Orozco. The solidarity group Karla is from the locality of Las Flores, city of Masaya. Their businesses are the making of clothing, shoes and a beauty salon. They are well known and trusted in the community, they are young women with a lot of drive and the desire to work and improve themselves. They like to work with Adim because they receive training in how to improve their businesses. Mrs. Nancy makes clothes; she has a small workshop in her home where she makes aprons, school shirts and tablecloths. She has a small child, and started her business to generate more income and help with expenses. Her husband works in a textile company, which is what gave her the idea for the business. Mrs. Mercedes del Carmen makes woman's shoes, she has two workers, her workshop is in her home. With credit she purchased glue, leather, and plastic to design her sandals. She hopes to improve her workshop and make it weather-proof, since presently she cannot work when it rains, as it is out in the open. Ms. Karla de los Angeles has a small beauty salon in her home, very good clients, and needs the loan to buy cosmetics for use in her shop. She was selected the group's coordinator, responsible for collecting the payments and dropping them off at the Adim office. She dreams to improve her beauty salon, purchase more mirrors and provide a better atmosphere to the place. Her husband works at a chicken processing factory and helps with the household expenses; she has three school-age children, and this business has helped her provide for her children immensely.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar cosméticos como tintes, cremas para peinar, geltinas para el pelo, colores para peinar, etc. Tambien compra pinturas como : maquillajes, cremas limpiadoras, sombras y lapices labiales, pinturas de uñas, etc., estos tambien se los ofrece a los clientes

loans.name: Señor  De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal denominado  SEÑOR D. MAYO, está emprendiendo su CUARTO CICLO y esta dirigido por su directiva la Sra. Patricia, Lourdes y Rene. La mayoría D. las socias radican en la Zona 1ro D. Mayo; es un barrio donD. viven personas D. la clase media, la caracteristica principal D. sus casas es que son viviendas construidas D. ladrillo y algunas D. adobe, gran parte D. las socias tiene su casa y/o departamento propio con los principales servicios basicos. Todas las socias tienen su negocio: tienen puestos y tiendas D. comida, cosmeticos, ferreteria, celulares, abarrotes y ropa pero principalmente tienen puestos D. CDs.
Como es D. conocimiento general, la actual crisis mundial esta afectando tambien a nuestro pais, generando cada vez mas desempleo y una mayor cantidad D. comerciantes en las calle y consecuentemente una mayor competencia entre ellas.
Ellas necesitan el credito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y están muy animadas para trabajar con Agrocapital, la mayoría D. ellas ya se conocen entre si y tienen experiencia trabajando con la tecnologia "Banca Comunal" puesto que fueron anteriormente clientes D. nuestra institucion y/o trabajaron en otras instituciones similares.
texts.en:
The Community Bank called SEÑOR D. MAYO is beginning its fourth cycle and it is managed by its directors, Mrs. Patricia, Lourdes and Rene. The majority of its members live in the 1ro D. Mayo Zone; the neighborhood is maD. up by people from the middle class; the majority of the homes are brick and some are adobe. A large portion of the members own their own home or apartment, and they all have the main basic services. All members have a business: kiosks or small shops for the sale of food, cosmetics, hardware, cellular phones, groceries and clothing, and mainly CDs. As it is generally known, the current world crisis is also affecting our country, generating more unemployment each day, and pushing many merchants to the streets, with the consequent increase in competition among them. They need the loan to increase their working capital; they are very excited to work with Agrocapital. Most of the ladies know each other and have experience working with the technology "Banca Comunal," since they were customers of our institution in the past and/or have worked with similar institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de operaciones

loans.name: Las Principiantes Group

texts.es: Hace mas de siete años trece mujeres  conforman la asociación “Las Principiantes” que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer, convencidas de que pueden mejorar su calidad de vida. La mayoría de ellas viven en la zona Juan Pablo II,  de la ciudad de el Alto, siendo el comercio informal la  actividad mas común entre ellas, venden; CDS, repuestos para automóviles, verduras, frutas y otros,productos que son comercializados en mercados y calles  del lugar. La asociación Las Principiantes, afirman que el alza de los precios en los alimentos de primera necesidad causo desequilibrio en la economia de sus hogares, lo que les lleva a solicitar créditos para inyectar capital a sus negocios, con el unico fin de mantener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Seven years ago 13 women formed their own collective "Las Principiantes", working with Pro-Mujer, in order to improve their quality of life. They mostly live in the Juan Pablo II area of the city of Alto. They work primarily in informal businesses such as selling CDs, automobile parts, fruits and vegetables, as well as other products, which they sell at markets and on their local streets. They household finances have suffered from the price increases for primary necessities. They are requesting this loan in order to inject some capital into their businesses and stabilize their household incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for their businesses

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es: Todas las mañanas muy temprano comienzan su día las señoras de la asociación caminantes, llevando su mercadería a distintas  ferias de la ciudad, ellas venden ropa, comida, joyas, muebles, pastelitos, dulces y otros. Esta asociación trabaja hace mas de dos años en el centro focal Juan Pablo II, que esta ubicada en la zona Ferropetrol de  la ciudad de El Alto. Necesitan capital para  compra mercadería para ampliar sus ventas, están seguras que generaran mayores ingresos, con lo que podrán responder  a sus créditos
texts.en:
The ladies of the collective "Caminantes" begin their days very early in the morning to take their merchandise to the various city markets. They sell clothing, food, jewelry, furniture, pastries, sweets and other items. This collective has worked at the Juan Pablo II center for the past two years, located in the Ferropetrol zone in the city of El Alto. They need capital to buy merchandise in order to expand their sales. They are certain they will gain greater profits with which to pay their loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing accessories and to pay school fees

loans.name: Cuestion De Fe Group

texts.es:
En la zona Los Andes,  de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Cuestión de Fe” formado por trece socias.
Un grupo muy simpático que  con la ayuda de  su asesora de créditos, trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer con mucho entusiasmo de mejorar en sus negocios.
La mayoría de ellas son casadas y niños de distintas edades nos cuentan  que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares crecen cada vez mas y los ingresos que tienen ya no son suficientes para cubrir necesidades mínimas 
Este grupo tiene diversas actividades; Flora por ejemplo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de yogurt, otras venden estuches para celulares, videos, material escolar, cosméticos. Desean mayor crédito para la adquisición de productos al por mayor,  para ampliar sus ventas, tienen la seguridad que mejoraran sus ganancias y su situación económica para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
In the Los Andes area in the city of El Alto, there exists a center by the same name. It is to this center that “Cuestión de Fe,” an association of thirteen members, belongs. With the help of their loan advisor, this kind group of women work enthusiastically with Pro-Mujer to improve their businesses. The majority of the women are married with children of various ages. The daily household costs increase everyday and the incomes that they earn are insufficient to cover their basic needs.

The group produces a variety of products. Flora, for example, makes and sells yogurt. Others sell cellphone cases, videos, school supplies and makeup. They are hoping for more credit so that they can purchase wholesale products and increase their sales. The members of the group are confident that they can improve their incomes and their economic situation for the benefit of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products

loans.name: Roeung's Group

texts.en:
There are four people requesting this small loan, all residents of the city of Phnom Penh. The members have selected Mrs. Roeung Y., 44, to be the group leader.

Y. earns her daily income by braiding silk out of her home. She can weave one or two sets of the traditional silk skirt per day. Almost all of her customers need to order more than a week in advance. Three of her single children who are students always help her braid silk. To help feed the family, her husband sells a few planks for income. Because Mrs. Y. thinks her husband's investment is profitable for the family, she has decided to seek a loan to order additional planks to sell.

The other three borrower are: P., who owns a karaoke room and requests a loan to expand her service; N., who is a domestic silk-skirt maker seeking a loan to purchase threads for braiding; and Y., who braids silk out of her home for income and is applying for a loan to buy more raw materials. Y. was not available for photographing so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To order additional planks to sell

loans.name: Saua

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Saua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as twisties, lollies, t-shirts, frozen goods, etc.

loans.name: Eni

texts.en: Eni S., 41, is married with no children.  She has many years of experience in the Elei printing business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). loans.use: Purchase printing boards, fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes and roller kit

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo D. is 54 years old and has 6 children. H is a rice grower. Farming is hard work, and it is the family’s only source of income. As a father, he wants to provide for his family’s needs.

Ricardo is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy four sacks of rice seed and fertilizers. This loan will help his whole family achieve: he hopes to grow his rice farm to pay for his children’s tuition, books, and other school fees.

CEVI is reaching out to help farmers grow and sustain their livelihoods. CEVI provides not only loans to their clients, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase rice seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Ionatana

texts.en: Ionatana F., 32, is single with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the villagers 5 days per week. She has  previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Ionatana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase corn seeds, plastic papers, salt and butter

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is 44 years old, married, and blessed with eight children. She is a responsible mother and a loving wife to her husband. Her husband works in "pamiling" (traditional gold mining). They both cooperate in raising their family.

Vivian has a mini grocery store where she sells basic goods, including bananas, to walk in customers. She also buys and sells used clothing, locally called “ukay-ukay.” Her business has been made possible with the help of HSPFI (Kiva Partner).

Vivian is applying for loan amounting to PHP 10,000.00 to further improve her business, and is hoping for a positive response to her request.

loans.use: Business improvement

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria P., 51, is married with 4 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the general public and tourists, 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used for the business and also paying children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase electric chainsaw, chisel set, sand paper and varnish. Also help with children's school fees.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann V. is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children. She farms a small rice field in her village and also runs a sari-sari store. When she is not busy at the farm she tends to her store, waiting for customers to buy her goods. Her husband, Ernesto V., is also a farmer. In addition to rice, the family grows vegetables in their backyard.

Mary Ann is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use this loan to buy three bags of urea fertilizer, rice seeds, and other farm necessities to help her increase her yield. A portion of the loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes to augment her income to better support her family.

CEVI is a non-profit organization, organized to respond the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI helps people start and embrace their own livelihoods, providing not only loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, rice seed, and other farm items

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mr. C., 33, owns a car and provides a taxi service to passengers. He normally makes $8 a day to meet his family's food needs. He is married to Mrs. Thy and they have two teenagers who are students. His wife earns a living as a local grower. C. has been proposing to invest in a grocery store for a long time but he lacks the capital. To make it possible, he would like to borrow $300 to begin selling groceries out of his home. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey, Cambodia.
Mr. C.'s wife is pictured.

loans.use: To run a grocery store

loans.name: Aufata

texts.en: Aufata Sipini, 47, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 3 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US $165).  SPBD loans are Aufata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies such as wheel barrow, spade, knives and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario C. owns a small piggery at the back of her house. She raises pigs and sows to support her family. She also has a rice farm. She is 39-years old and all of her five children are in school. She uses her farm to feed and properly clothe her children. She wants to provide the best for them. She just hopes that her pig business can prosper even more.

Rosario is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. She will also use some of the loan to buy fertilizers to increase the yield of her rice farm.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start their own businesses. CEVI provides not just loan assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well, to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anave

texts.en:
Anave N., 54, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the coffee-shop business. She sells to the villagers and the general public five days per week.

She has had one previous loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208).  SPBD loans are Anave’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase packets of coffee, coffee maker, sacks of sugar, carton of milk and plastic foam cups

loans.name: Dandy

texts.en:
Dandy O. is a sari-sari storeowner. He sells rice, vinegar, salt, canned foods, animal feed and other goods to his neighbors. He is 34 years old, married and has only one child. Aside from the store, he also raises pigs to supplement their income for buying their needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for his store. In that way, he believes he will be able to attract more customers. The loan will also help him improve his piggery. 

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It helps people start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Riem's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four people, all residents of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Riem P. has been selected by the members to be leader of the group. Mrs. P. and her husband currently make a daily profit by selling fresh fish in the local market. Since 2000, they have been investing in their business. The humble couple has five children who are still single; one of them works as a requirement worker. The family's business of selling fish is going well because they have skills to attract the customers to buy their products. Due to the business growing and to fulfill the customer's purpose, P. is applying for a loan to buy more fish to sell. The other borrowers include:
Mrs. K., a local fish supplier who is looking for a loan to increase her business capital.
Mrs. S., a fish seller who seeks a loan to repair a farming machine.
Mrs. A., a fish seller who is applying for a loan to add capital to her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Fua

texts.en: Fua L., 63, is married with 8 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $116).  SPBD loans are Fuao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy garden spray chemicals; tools for planting taro, banana, and taamu; and to improve her home.

loans.use: Farming supplies and home improvement

loans.name: Virgillio

texts.en:
Virgilio G. is working so hard to provide for the needs of his family. He manages a small sari-sari (variety) store and sells a variety of goods like rice, sardines, instant noodles and other goods. He is 33 years old and both of his two children are in school.

He is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for his store. The loan will truly help him win more customers. He thinks that when there are more displays in his store, he will earn more profit to support his family.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to help start and have their own businesses. CEVI helps provide livelihood. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his store

loans.name: Sinaukoko

texts.en: Sinaukoko P., 34, is married with 4 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the area's school children 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about US $132).  SPBD loans are Sinaukoko’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, a tank of oil for donuts, pork buns, and sweet staff for ice cake.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
G. Rustam is 28 years old and a married father of two small children. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 12 years. The income he earns allows him to support not only his children and his wife but also his two baby sisters and two brothers.

To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Rustam would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to support his large family and improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Rustam’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for cars in order to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
A. Said is 26-years old. He is married and has a little daughter. He sells cattle. As a rule, he purchases calves in the central market, feeds them and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. Having been in this business for ten years, he knows very well how to choose the animals and how to breed them. He gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable solid income for his family.

Said is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase cattle. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $500 US to spend on the purchase of two calves. You could become an important player in the life of Said's family! He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta T., 75, is married with 10 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the general store business. She sells to the village people/public 6 days per week. She has had 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US $165).  SPBD loans are Ruta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She use her loan to restock goods in her store, improve her home, and for children's school fees.

loans.use: Store inventory, home improvement, school fees

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
A. Shoira devotes herself to the production of wheat, corn and vegetables on her land. For this reason, she remains as long as possible on her land, dedicating herself to the care and fertilization of her fields. With all this effort, it is possible to obtain a good harvest and sell the products, with the aim of offering her three children an education and personal development appropriate to their age. This hard work also prompts her to think of opening a grocery store in her house, thus providing a larger share of income for the family’s kitty. However, this will require a larger investment, and so with this object in mind Shoira is asking for your help in order to obtain the amount asked for to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of seeds and fertilizer. We hope to count on you, and appeal to your collaborative spirit.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Minovar

texts.ru: Миновар – 34 лет. Она замужем и мать 4-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Миновар было всего лишь 10 овец. Но год назад она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Сейчас у Миновар две дойной коровы. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат. Миновар очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
texts.en:
Minovar is 34 years old. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband went to Russia to work. Here he could not find a good job in order to save money and purchase livestock for himself. Minovar had just 10 sheep. But a year ago she found out about credit from our organization and came to take out a loan to purchase one dairy cow. Today, Minovar has two dairy cows. Until her husband finds a job in Russia and sends her money, her brother will help her. Minovar is very happy that our organization is helping her at a difficult moment in her life.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.en:
Jonibek B. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and parents. Jonibek is an animal farmer. He owns cows and sells their milk with the help of his father and mother. To further develop his business, he wants to take out a loan and buy one or two more cows and fodder for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then Jonibek will be able to use the profits from his business for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and fodder

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nenita T. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 kids. Her husband works abroad.  Having started her sari-sari store business from a mere capital, she is coping well with the challenges of her business.  The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand and venture to rug making business for added income.

She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to additionally capitalize her business.  She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future.  She envisions acquiring an additional market stall. She dreams also of renovating their little house and to start saving now for the education of their children.

loans.use: additional capital for rug making

loans.name: Yuldoshboy

texts.en:
Yuldoshboy B. is a gentleman who dedicates himself to the business of farming and livestock. Yuldoshboy is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. Currently his children are grown up and they always support and help their father with the business. The challenge that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason he is seeking the support of IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase cattle to sell. Yuldoshboy is grateful to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар – 39 лет. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Она занимается продажей женской одежды. Она торгует с Торговом Центре «Нури Хучанд» находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Дилбар закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Дилбар уже 3 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Дилбар расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию женской обуви. Теперь у Дилбар увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Dilbar is 39 years old. She is married and is the mother of 5 children. She sells women’s clothing. Dilbar sells at the shopping center “Nuri Huchand” which is located in the “Panchshanbe” area in Khujand. On Friday she goes to the “Dzhuma-bazar” market and on Sunday she goes to the “Yakshanbe-bazar” market. Dilbar purchases products in Bishkek, Kirgizstan. She travels for products once a month. Her husband is a construction worker. Dilbar has been our borrower for 3 years now. When she started out she had a small quantity of products. But now Dilbar has grown her business and used her last loan to purchase a stock of women’s shoes. Now Dilbar has a wider assortment of products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Jane S. is 24 years old, married, and lives at Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter. Determination and hard work are what Mrs. S. believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative recently, having faith in true service and assistance to needy people. Abject poverty is inevitable for them. It urges her to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. She requested a credit loan from Paglaum MPC after having been a member in order to have additional capital to buy coconuts. The couple’s aspiration is to send their child to school to obtain a degree, and provide a good quality life.

loans.use: Capital for buying coconuts

loans.name: Jasurbek

texts.en:
Jasurbek B. is a 29-year-old businessman. He is married, and he and his wife have two children. Jasurbek is a farmer, like his wife. They started their farm 4 years ago. In the beginning it was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With much effort and the help of his wife he was able to move forward and today has a large plot of land. His vegetables are very good quality, which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive, since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. They sell their products in the fruit and vegetable market of the city. Jasurbek requests a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано Алиёров 1979 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует в магазине конфетами и мороженным.  Кредит получает на расширение  бизнеса и увеличения ассортимента. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2004 года. Кредит получила для расширения бизнеса, а потом за аренду помещения. Теперь она благодарна Микроинвест, потому что улучшила своё положение в жизни. Муж поддерживает ее в бизнесе.
texts.en:
Rano A. was born in 1979. She is married and has 2 children. Rano has a high school education. She sells candy and ice cream in a store. She is taking out a loan to grow her business and increase her product selection. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2004. She took out a loan to grow her business and later for space rental. Now Rano is grateful to MicroInvest because she has improved her living conditions. Her husband supports her business endeavors

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.ru: Хидоят Абдукодирова  1967 года рождения, замужем имеет 4 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Имеет на рынке ларек . где торгует пряниками и другими кондитерскими изделиями. Не смотря на кризис торговля идет  хорошо, так как ее товар только продукты. С Микроинвест начала сотрудничать с 2008 года. Благодарна за кредит так как смогла заплатить за ларек и выкупить его.
texts.en:
Hidoyat A. was born in 1967; she is married and has 4 children. She does not have a college education. Hidoyat has a stall at the market where she sells gingerbread and other sweets. Despite the crisis her sales are going well, because she only sells food products. She started working with MicroInvest in 2008. She is grateful for the loan because she was able to pay for her stall and purchase it.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Ianeta

texts.en: Ianeta F., 37, is married with 4 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $116).  SPBD loans are Ianeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for maintaining her business. The plantation is going but just needs improvement.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Абдумачид молодой человек 25 лет. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Его жена готовится стать матерью их второго ребенка. Абдумачид очень рад и готовится такому событию. У него будет пополнение семьи и он теперь должен  больше зарабатывать. Он живет отдельно от родителей. Он уже 1 год кредитуется у нас. Абдумачид надеется с нашей помощью увеличить свой товарооборот и увеличить свою прибыль.
texts.en:
Abdumajid U. is 25 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife if expecting a second child. Abdumajid is very excited and is getting ready for this event. Because of the addition to his family, he will need to earn more money. He lives separately from his parents. He has been receiving loans with us for one year. Abdumajid hopes with our help to increase his sales and earnings.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow and Sell Livestock

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en: Valelia E., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 2 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $116).  SPBD loans are Valelia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for maintaining the business. She is new and she needs some funding to maintain her business.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Ms. Alice C. a single mom with one daughter. She is 58 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her business is a beauty salon which she manages with her own ability and creativity. She studied cosmetology in Manila years ago. She is a member in good standing of Paglaum PMC, Kiva's partner. She seeks a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy supplies for her salon. She hopes that her business will grow better and be able to support her daughter's education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic materials to use in her parlor

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.en:
E. Khursanoy is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Seven years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business.

Khursanoy is engaged in this business together with her adult children. Slowly the number of cows increased and at the same time, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Khursanoy’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
H. Sherali is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his two children and wife and owns a cattle-breeding business. Sherali has nine years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Sherali has become a very successful businessman. Sherali has a friendly family who are always try to help each other. Thus with the cattle-raising business, his wife and son help him.

He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Sherali wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So Sherali applied for a loan of $1,000. He promises to repay the loan within nine months and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help Sherali can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Keleta

texts.en: Keleta K., 38, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the Elei business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about US $132).  SPBD loans are Keleta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for maintaining the business. She is new and she needs some funding to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing materials

loans.name: Cerilla

texts.en:
Cerilla L. is a 45-year-old resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. She is married and fortunate enough to have seven children. All of her children go to school. Cerilla works hard for the needs and education of her children. Everyday, she aims to have income from her mini grocery store. Cerilla is aiming for an expansion of her mini grocery to cater to all the primary needs of her customers.

To be able to realize her plans, Cerilla wants a loan amounting to PHP 10,000.00 from HSPFI (a Kiva partner). She wants to purchase additional stock for her mini grocery store so she can generate more income. Cerilla is looking forward to the great support the organization will extend to her.

loans.use: For the procurement of stock for her mini grocery store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Раджабова Назира  1962  года рождения, замужем имеет одного ребенка. Она получила средне специальное  образование делопроизводителя. Но по специальности устроиться на работу не смогла. Сейчас она работает специалистом в макаронном цеху.  С ней работают несколько инвалидов, им платят  заработную плату и обеспечивают жильём. Назира получила кредит на покупку муки, для изготовления макарон. Первый кредит получила в прошлом году. На ремонт оборудования для изготовления макарон.
texts.en:
Nazira R. was born in 1962, she is married and has one child. She received a degree in business management, but she was unable to find a job in this profession. Currently, she is working as a specialist in a pasta producing plant. She works with several disabled people and receives a salary and housing. Last year, Nazira received a loan to purchase flour for pasta production. She requires a loan to repair equipment for pasta production.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
H. Rahim is 62 years old. He is married with four children. Rahim is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. Rahim has dedicated himself to the cattle-breeding business for the past 20 years. He purchases calves to raise and fatten them, and then sells them or butchers them to sell the meat. His younger son who lives with him helps Rahim with his business. Today, his major need is acquiring a calf for his business. For this reason Rahim looks for support with IMON International, to buy more of the cattle that make his family’s sustenance possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон – молодой человек 26 лет, женат и отец 1-го ребенка. У Абдурахмона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 25 овец и 15 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, она нянчит своего младенца. Абдурахмон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Абдурахмона пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Абдурахмон за этот новый займ купил одного среднего бычка, который вы можете увидеть на фотографии. Откормив 6-8 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Абдурахмон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon H. is 26 years old, and he has one child. Abdurahmon owns livestock, which consists of 25 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a home-maker, she takes care of the baby. Every morning Abdurahmon takes his livestock to the mountains for grazing, and in the evening he takes the animals back. Abdurahmon does not yet own cattle. With his first loan Abdurahmon is buying a medium-size bull, which you can see in the photo. After rearing the animal for 6-8 months, he can sell it for a good price. Abdurahmon is very happy to work with us, because the credit helps him a lot.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing and Sale of Cattle

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en:
I. Abdurashid is 52 years old and was born in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is the father of three children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family.

A very ambitious man, Abdurashid would like to buy a greater number of cattle, and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $700 for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Abdurashid will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
K. Zafar is married and the father of three children. He has a large and friendly family including his wife, children, mother and brother. For 15 years he has been engaged in the farming business. The love of his children is the motor that keeps him working hard for their future. He works fast together with the help of his wife to achieve quality products.

The high prices of fertilizer have caused his production to slow down. He wishes to do better, have more production and increase the number of hectares with crops. To do it, Zafar needs capital, which he requests through a loan and hopes that you can help him. This way he can look forward to a profitable production to increase his income and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри Исобоева  1962 года рождения, замужем имеет 4 детей. Торгует на рынке более 7 лет. Раньше торговала не далеко от своего дома мелочами. После получения займа поменяла свой бизнес на торговли обувью. она торгует тапочками и сланцами. Самый ходовой  товар у нее это тапочки, в основном покупают женщины. Зимой она продает зимнюю обувь, сейчас сезон весенней-летней обуви. Планирует расширить сезонный товар на лето.
texts.en:
Mehri I. was born in 1962, she is married with 4 children. She has been trading at a market for over 7 years. Previously, she was selling small items near her home. After receiving a loan, she changed her business and now sells shoes. She sells house shoes and flip-flops. Her best-selling products are house shoes, which are mostly purchased by women. In winter Mehri sells winter shoes. Currently, it is the season for spring and summer shoes. With the loan she plans to expand her product offering for the summer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо  Хусейнова  1952 года рождения имеет  5 детей. Имеет среднее образование.  У нее есть не большой цех  для переработки хлопка. Ее клиенты, это люди, которые берут на  приданное своих детей, национальные матрасы из хлопка.  Она перерабатывает хлопок и сбивает по несколько раз что бы хлопок стал пышный и легкий, для матрасов.  Первый кредит получила в 2008 году, на покупки хлопка , так как у нее был большой заказ. Она благодарна Микроинвест и за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en:
Zebiniso H. was born in 1952 and has 5 children. She graduated from high school. She has a small workshop for cotton processing. Her clients are people who purchase Tajik national mattresses for their children's dowry. She processes cotton and shakes it several times to make it full and light for the mattresses. She received her first loan to purchase cotton in 2008, because she had a large order. She thanks MicroInvest and Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
K. Sobirjon is 30 years old and married. During the last eight years Sobirjon has been providing the services of transportation. As a rule, he is working in his region only. At the same time, together with the help of his wife, he is raising cattle, which gives additional income to his family.

Currently, Sobirjon’s truck needs repairing. So he requests $900 for the term of nine months. Sobirjon promises to pay the loan on time and would like to thank everyone for their support.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: Purchasing spare parts necessary for the maintenance of his truck

loans.name: Faatoina

texts.en: Faatoina K., 35, is married with 7 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the pig farm business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (about US $231).  SPBD loans are Faafouina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase of farming materials

loans.name: Solijon

texts.ru: Соличону 51 год. Он женат и имеет 4-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Жена занимается переработкой молока. Сыновья помогают отцу. Гонят скот на пастбище. Возят на рынок. Дочки помогают маме. Они разносят молоко по селу и продают их. Соличон кредитуется у нас уже три года. С начала кредитования у него не было дойных коров и быков. Сейчас у Соличона две дойные коровы и два быка. Соличон очень рад что сотрудничает с нами и благодарит нас.
texts.en:
Solijon is 51 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He graduated from a university. His wife works with milk products. Solijon's sons help him to take cattle to the pasture and take products to the market. Solijon's daughters help their mother to sell milk all around the village. Solijon has been receiving loans with us for 3 years. In the beginning, he had two milking cows and bulls. Now, he has two milking cows and two bulls. Solijon is very happy to work with us, and he thanks us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Tulkunjon

texts.en:
K. Tulkunjon is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has three children and a wife whom he has to support. Tulkunjon wishes to develop his business. This business consists of cattle-raising in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns. Tulkunjon is helped by his wife.

Tulkunjon is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing and, accordingly, their expenses are growing too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities and services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en:
N. Inomjon is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Inomjon has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Inomjon comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.
