loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Mavluda and her husband can give to their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances.

This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband and children (one of whom is pictured), she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their production. Mavluda and her family are waiting for your quick response.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Kodirkul

texts.ru: Кодиркул - мужчина 47 лет. Женат и отец 5-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей скота, а также сдает мясо мясникам. Жена занимается переработкой молока, а также переработкой пряжи. Сыновья помогают отцу. Невестки помогают по хозяйству. А в свободное время продают молоко. Кодиркул покупает скот и откормив его, продает мясникам. Кодиркул уже три года берет у нас кредит. Он регулярно покупает скот, и до этого времени у него накопилось большое количество скота. За очередной займ он опять собирается пополнить свое стадо.
texts.en:
Kodirkul is a 47 year-old man. He is married and has 5 children. He has a university diploma. Kodirkul has a cattle rearing business, and he also sells meat to butchers. His wife processes milk and yarn. The sons help their father. The daughters-in-law help Kodirkul's wife around the house. They sell milk in their free time. Kodirkul purchases cattle, and after rearing it sells it to butchers. Kodirkul has been receiving our loans for 3 years. He buys cattle regularly and has a large number of animals. He plans to buy more cattle with his next loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle Rearing and Sales

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
S. Marhabo is 40 years old. She is divorced and the mother of two children. After the divorce from her husband, Marhabo had to find ways to provide for herself and her children. For 7 years she has had a business baking and selling the national bread “lepeshka”. It has now become the family business as the children of Marhabo are grown-up and they are helping their mother (pictured). Marhabo is a cheerful, hard-worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid four loans from IMON which have helped create stability for her business. Today Marhabo is requesting for a loan of $1200 USD with the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase flour and coal required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more so she can provide her children with good education.

loans.use: Purchasing of the flour and coal required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
S. Mukhtor lives in Khujand, a town in Northern Tajikistan. He is 44 years old and married with four children. Mukhtor is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising then selling cows and sheep at the local market. His wife (pictured) helps him with the business.

Once every two or three months he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over an eight- or nine-month period and later sells the adult cows and sheep to local butchers. Today Mukhtor is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of $1,000 for the term of nine months. Extend your solidarity to Mukhtor so that he can move forward successfully and accomplish all his goals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.en:
S. Sharafniso is 48 years old. She and her husband have two children. To improve her family position and support her husband with family expenses, Sharafniso started her business six years ago. She bakes “lepeshka,” the national bread, at home. Her son helps her with the business.

Sharafniso sells the majority of her products from her place. However, her mother (pictured) is also running a trading place in the central local market for selling the lepeshka. Sharafniso is doing all the best to ensure her children with the best future. Now she requests $1,000 for the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase flour on a wholesale basis. Sharafniso is grateful for all supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Azizbibi

texts.ru: Азизбиби Ахмедова 1949 года рождения , замужем имеет 4 детей. Торгует на вещевом рынке детской одеждой.  На рынке  торгует более 10 лет. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2003 года. Кредит получила на расширение ассортимента и сезонного товара. Дочь помогает в бизнесе , заменяет ее когда Азизбиби заболеет или по другим делам отсутствует. Благодарна КИВА за предоставления кредита, они позволили расширить ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Azizbibi A. is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her main occupation is selling children's clothing at a market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2003. She plans to use the loan to increase the assortment of the seasonal inventory. Her daughter helps her whenever Azizibibi is ill or absent. She is very thankful to Kiva for presenting an opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business/ purchase more inventory

loans.name: Marifjon

texts.en:
T. Marifjon, 34, is married and has three children. He lives in Spitamen town and works in the agricultural industry. Twelve years ago he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family.

Marifjon grows wheat, corn and vegetables, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy inputs that will enable him to improve production yield. Marifjon has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans in order to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shuhradjon

texts.en:
The business activity from which Y. Shuhradjon makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business eight years ago with a small number of livestock, but as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives.

According to Shuhradjon, he works very hard so that he can maintain his children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve the lives of his family. Currently Shuhradjon needs a loan of $800 in order to purchase more cattle and later resell them after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate all of his three children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion E. is a rice grower. She is 40 years old, married and has four children. Ever since she was a kid, she farmed rice to help her parents provide for all their family needs. Now that she has her own family, she would like to give her children a better future by sending all of them to school.

In addition to growing rice, she manages a small sari-sari (variety) store business. Her husband, Euvir E., is very supportive of her running a business.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's parner. She will buy fertilizers and other farming necessities. The loan will greatly benefit her whole family because it will give them a better harvest.

CEVI is a non-profit organization organized to respond the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to help them start and have their own livelihoods. It provides not just credit but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Y. Suhrob is 21 years old. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market in Khujand town. Suhrob sells an assortment of good quality flour. Because he buys the flour wholesale, his prices are cheaper than his competitors. Thus he has many customers who will even make a purchase of his flour straight from his house.

His mother (pictured) helps him with the business. Today he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take out an individual loan. Suhrob has requested a loan of $1,200 to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He promises to repay the loan within nine months.

Suhrob is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and, in the near future, to make his own family. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchasing flour

loans.name: Leua

texts.en: Leua A., 36, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience in business. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about US $132).  SPBD loans are Leua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase freezer, sack of sugar, pack of Chinese lolly

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.ru: Мукадам Ёкубова 1982 года рождения , замужем имеет одного ребенка.  Имеет высшее образование. Работает швей в военном ателье. Там шьет камуфляжную форму и  мундиры для военных. Недалеко от их цеха расположена крепость- военная часть, где находятся солдаты. Для них и шьют  эту форму Мукадам и ее  сотрудницы. Кредит получила в 2008 году, на покупку материалов  для шитья  военной формы.
texts.en:
Makadam Y. is 27 years old, married, and has a child. She holds a bachelor degree. She works as a tailor in a military tailoring establishment. There, she sews army uniforms. Army soldiers are stationed a short distance away from her factory. It is for them that Mukadam and her co-workers are tailoring the uniforms. She obtained her loan in 2008 to purchase textiles for the army uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase textiles

loans.name: Ulugoy

texts.en:
A. Ulugoy is 40 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and her best friends.

Ulugoy asks for a $1,000 loan with the term of nine months in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
