loans.use: Purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
Susitina V., 43, is married with seven children. She has two years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately $120).

Susitina has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Susitina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, chemicals and a hose

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying animals for his land and some seeds

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en: Logotaeao B., 20, is married with 1 child.  She has 1 year(s) of experience in the Canteen business. She sells to the School 5 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Logotaeao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase gas stove,sack of flour, sack of sugar, box of mutton flaps

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Ашурова Лола  1953 года рождения, замужем, имеет  3 детей. Заведует кондитерским цехом. Она имеет высшее образование. Печет торты. На рисунке она посередине,а с двух сторон ее молодые ученицы.  10 лет назад начала работать председателем, потом после распада союза занялась печь торты. Сейчас имеет большой цех. Все покупатели оптом у нее покупают торты.  Благодарна Микроинвест и КИВА за поддержку. С помощью кредита  расширила помещение в цеху.
texts.en:
Lola A. was born in 1953, is married and has 3 children. Lola is in charge of a pastry manufacturing facility. She has a college degree. She makes cake. On the photo she is pictured in the middle. Two of her students stand next to her. 10 years ago she worked as chairman, but after the fall of the Soviet Union began making cakes. Now she has a large manufacturing facility. Her clients purchase cakes in bulk. She is very thankful to Kiva for all the support. Thanks to the loan she was able to increase the size of her manufacturing facility.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Rafoatniso

texts.ru: Рафоатнисо 37 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Муж занимается частным предпринимательством. Дети учатся в школе. Рафоатнисо занимается продажей кондитерских изделий на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Все ее импортные товары поставляют фирмы Nestle, СладкО, Марс и др. Рафоатнисо берет кредит у нас уже 2 года. Сейчас у нее  большой ассортимент товаров. Она продает разные импортные конфеты, печенья, вафли, пирожное. Сейчас ее поставщики предложили хорошую сделку. Если она закупит большое количество товара за наличные деньги, то поставщики дадут за очень выгодную, низкую цену. Поэтому Рафоатнисо берет очередной кредит, чтобы закупить товар по низкой цене.
texts.en:
Rafoatniso is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband has his own business, and the children are in school. Rafoatniso sells candy at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. The candy is all imported, and includes brand names such as Nestlé, SladKo (a Russian brand), and Mars, et cetera. Rafoatniso has been a client of MicroInvest for two years. At present she carries a wide selection of items. She sells various imported candies, cookies, wafers and pastries. Her suppliers are now offering her a good deal. If she places a large order and pays cash, the suppliers will give her a very advantageous, low price. So, Rafoatniso is taking out another loan in order to purchase goods at a low price.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweets, candy and confectionary products

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete F., 38, is married with three children. She has recently started working in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week.

This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $250). SPBD loans are Pelenatete’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and bush knives

loans.name: Faima Group

texts.en: Faima is the group leader of the Faima group. There are five members in this group. Each of them wants a loan for expanding their business. Faima wants a loan for a bead working business. Farzan wants a loan for a carpet weaving business. Norui wants a loan for her brother who has a car part shop. Leda wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Shkaba wants a loan for a beauty salon business. They want a loan of 50000 afghani for the term of 8 months. They are very happy that this loan process is in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand a beadworking business

loans.name: Faava

texts.en:
Faava T., 31, is married with three children. She has one year of experience in the vegetables garden business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (approximately $240).

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Faava’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase barbed wire, seeds and chemical spray

loans.name: Shir

texts.en:
Shir is a young man. He is uneducated but he has lots of experience. He has a retail shop and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years in Jalalabad.  Before this he worked in Agriculture in his home town. For the last 10 years he has responsibility for his family. He tried many times to enlarge his shop but he couldn't. When he found AFKJ in Jalalabad he was really very happy and then decided to apply for a loan.

Now he requests an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis. He will use the loan to enlarge his shop and further his business. This will give him more success and help him become strong in his business and make a good monthly income for his family.

Shir wants to thank all lenders around the world and thank Kiva and AFKJ too for this fantastic loan process. He would like to say that he never saw such a good program. In Afghanistan people are faced with lots of difficulty and he woud love to see more success in this program in the future.

loans.use: To increase his store's stock

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie S. has been a farmer since she was just a small child. Her parents are farmers and everything she knows about farming is a credit to her parents. She is 39 years old and has four children. She told CEVI about her life as a family woman and she said, "I will be the best farmer to win food for my children."

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. Fertilizers are a critical factor for a good harvest. She needs to buy more fertilizers to increase her yield.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to help them sustain their livelihood. It helps people, especially the poor, to start and have their own livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ambaroi

texts.ru: Юлбарсова Амбарой - женщина 55 лет. Замужем мать 4-х детей. Амбарой занимается продажей женской обуви на рынке Нури Хучанд города Худжанда. Амбарой закупает товары из оптового рынка «Гули сурх» города Истаравшана.. Муж Амбароя водитель маршрутного такси. Амбарой имеет 5-х летний стаж в сфере торговли. Амбарой хочет расширить бизнес, получив займ хочет, увеличит товарооборот. Старший сын Амбароя находится, в Российской Федерации  на заработках он помогает своей семье высылая им деньги.
texts.en:
Ambaroi Ulbarsova is 55 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Ambaroi herself is in the business of selling women's clothing and shoes at the market "Nuri Huchand" in the Hujanda town. She purchases her inventory at wholesale prices from warehouse "Guli Surh" in the Istaravshon town. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She would like to use the loan to increase her inventory and expand her business. Her oldest son currently works in Russia and helps his family by sending them money.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K., 38, is married with three children. She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $135).

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Mary’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of sugar, plastic bags and a freezer to make ice cakes

loans.name: Reygie

texts.en:
Reygie A. is 30 years old. She is married and the happy mother of three children. Her husband is a hardworking farmer. They both work hard for the future of their children. Reygie lives with her family in Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, Philippines.

Reygie buys and sells fruits and vegetables in their village. She peddles her products every day. Sometimes, she just has her stall standing by their residence and entertains walk-in customers. Reygie works with determination on her business because she considers herself the breadwinner of the family. All of her children go to school and all are still dependents of Reygie.

For now, Reygie is planning to rent a stall in the market. According to her, this is much better than peddling. In order for Reygie to reach her plans, she wants to take advantage of the loan opportunity given by HSPFI (a Kiva partner). She is now applying for loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00. This amount would cover her rent expenses and additional stocks of fruits and vegetables. She is aiming for a higher income, and she plans to have savings for future use.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Autalavou

texts.en:
Autalavou A., 45, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the Sewing business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~235USD).
She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Autalavou’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cotton material for lava-lavas, threads and needles

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en: Tauatala H., 50, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience and sells fish to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (approximately 291 USD).  SPBD loans are Tauatala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear such as fishing net

loans.name: Luaipou

texts.en: Luaipou L., 49, is married with 7 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the Samoan coco business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (approximately 333 USD).  SPBD loans are Luaipou’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase bard wire, sack of cocoa, sack of cements etc

loans.name: Talamoi

texts.en: Talamoi F., 36, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pig farming business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (approximately 250 USD).  SPBD loans are Talamoi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase barbed wire and nails

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena P., 43, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (~416 USD).  SPBD loans are Elena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals,fertilizer,bushknives,wheelbarrow, and weed killing spray.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Арипов Алишер проживает в городе Вахдат в возрасте 24-ёх лет, женат имеет одиного сына.Образование среднее, клиен занимается бизнесом уже более 5 лет, он имеет арендуюмую торговую точку, которая находится на центральном рынке города Вахдат.Клиент занимается изготовлением и продажей деревянных изделий. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет закупить древесину.От полученного дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Alisher A. lives in Vahdat. He is 24 years old, is married and has one son. He has a high school education. The client has had a business for more than 5 years; he has a rented sales location at the central market in the city of Vahdat. The client makes and sells wooden products. He wants to use the money that he receives to purchase wood. He supports his family using the profits that he receives.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Muaimalae

texts.en: Muaimalae A., 39, is married with five children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~$265 US).  SPBD loans are Muaimalae’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer, a gallon of Gramoxone, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Mrs. Johna D. is a 32-year-old from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. She started a business with a minimal amount only. Being a member of Paglaum MPC she is able to acquire additional capital for her business. She sells snacks to neighbors, friends and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business. Determination in life is what she has. Her heart’s desire is to have a small stall for a sari-sari (variety) store and to send their children to school and witness them be successful in the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for snacks vending

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi N., 63, is married with ten children.  She has two years of experience in the bakery business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$200 US).  SPBD loans are Aliitasi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour and sugar, a stove and pots

loans.name: Taino

texts.en: Taino M., 37, is married with one child.  She has one year of experience in the food production business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$135 US).  SPBD loans are Taino’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour and sugar, a stove and pots

loans.name: Amindjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Аминджон проживает в городе Вахдат в возрасте 36-ёх лет, женат имеет четырёх детей.Образование среднее, клиен занимается бизнесом уже более 10 лет, он имеет арендуюмую торговую точку, которая находится на центральном рынке города Вахдат.Клиент занимается изготовлением и продажей деревянных изделий. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет закупить древесину.От полученного дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Amindjon M. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 36 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary education and has been an entrepreneur for over 10 years. Amindjon leases a retail store located at the central market in the city of Vahdat. He makes and sells wood craft products. He wants to use this loan in order to purchase wood supplies. The resulting profits will help him support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Finao

texts.en:
Finao L., 40, is married with seven children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (approximately $240).

She has three previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Finao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy weedkiller, a gallon of gramoxone (herbicide), bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying seeds

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Саиджон проживает в городе Вахдат в возрасте 40-а лет, женат имеет пятерых днтей.Образование среднее, клиен занимается бизнесом уже более 5 лет, он имеет арендуюмую торговую точку, которая находится на центральном рынке города Вахдат.Клиент занимается изготовлением и продажей деревянных изделий. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет закупить древесину.От полученного дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Saidjon M. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 40 years old, married and has five children. He has a secondary education and has been an entrepreneur for over 5 years. He leases a retail store located at the central market in the city of Vahdat. Saidjon makes and sells wood craft products. He wants to use this loan in order to purchase wood supplies. The resulting profits will help him support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Wastara Group

texts.en:
Mpenami is 26 years old, married, and has four children aged 12, 10, 8 and 6. Mpenami has been a bites (bread-like rolls) and porridge seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar since the past two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US $70. She works at her business for seven hours daily.
 
She requests her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more items to expand her business. She hopes that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. Mpenami will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya and Maryam, who also have their own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy flour and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Çhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 28, was chosen to be the group leader by the fellow borrowers of the loan. C. currently earns $4 a day by selling vegetables in the market. She also owns rooms that she rents out to customers for alternate income. She is married to Mr. Ny, an internal staff member of a mobile phone company. The couple lives with their two teenage children who are attending school. The family had built their house a long time back. However, the house still requires more furniture. C. is therefore applying for a loan to purchase additional equipment to decorate her house. The other three borrowers are V., V. and S..

V. owns a room that she rents out to customers. She needs a loan to buy a trailer for her husband's service. V. too owns and rents out rooms, and she seeks a loan to build a hedge around her house. S. is a grocery seller who is requesting a loan to increase her grocery inventory size. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment to decorate her house

loans.name: Subira Huvuta Kheri Group

texts.en:
Time is 24 years old, married, and has two children aged 5 and 1. She has been a coconut and cassava seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar since past one year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business for 7 hours everyday. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more coconuts and cassava to improve her business. She hopes that the loan will help increase her profit and grow her business. 

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aziza and Mwanaaha, who also have their own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and cassava to improve her business.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 56-year-old married woman with two children living in Tyr, Southern Lebanon. She has been working as a private tutor since 1994. Today, Samia is requesting to borrow $800 to purchase a computer for teaching purposes.

loans.use: purchase a computer

loans.name: Pirmahmad

texts.ru: Шарипов Пирмахмад проживает в районе Рудаки в возрасте 57 лет, женат имеет пятерых детей. Образование среднее. Клиент имеет сабственную автомашину марки КАМАЗ, клиент занимается перевозом груза, этим видом деятельности клиент занимается 15 лет. На полученные деньги, клиент хочет заменить шины. На полученный доход, от занимаемым видом деятельности клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Pirmahmad S. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 57 years old, married and has five children. He has a secondary education. Pirmahmad owns a heavy-duty Kamaz truck. He is involved in freight transportation and has been in this business for 15 years. He wants to use this loan to purchase new truck tires. The profit from this business allows Pirmahmad to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tires

loans.name: Madlene

texts.en: Madlene is a 34-year-old woman living in Al Mansourieh in Mount Lebanon. She has been working as a beauty adviser since 2005 and she services the surrounding areas. Today, Madlene is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a laser machine in order to increase her income.

loans.use: buy a laser machine

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly is a 38-year-old woman living in Kfarshima in Mount Lebanon. She has been working in handicrafts since 2003. Today, Dolly is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase inventory in order to increase her production.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa has been a fish and khanga (a brightly colored piece of cloth that many East African women wear) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to Hakika group loan (Group code 2029). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. She works at her business for 8 hours every day.

Mauwa is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mauwa is 24 years old, divorced, and has three children: ages 4, 2 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more fish and khanga to sell

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in Al Shwaifat in Mount Lebanon. He has been working as a van driver since 2007 where he services the surrounding areas. Today, Abbas wants to borrow $800 to repair and maintain his van.

loans.use: repair and maintain his van

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en: Abdel Rahman is 60-year-old man married with one son living in Ouzai in Mount Lebanon. He has been a fisherman for 25 years. Today he is requesting to borrow $1,000 in order to repair his boat.

loans.use: repair his boat

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is 52-year-old married woman with six children living in Borj El Barajneh in Mount Lebanon. She started her tailoring business in 1990. Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a new sewing machine to increase her sales.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 27 years old and married with two children, ages eleven and five. She is been a chips, juice, and porridge seller in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Mshikamano loan group (group code 2008). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Khadija is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can improve her business by buying more items to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her current stock.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Ren S. works as a dessert seller at home. She has a daily income of $3.30 and lives in Kompong Chnang province. She is 29 years old and married. Her husband, Nhhel Chan Thol, pictured here, is a fisherman who tries to work hard at fishing the nearby lakes and ponds by using fishing nets and fish traps, then he sells the fish he catches at the local market. Nowadays, both of them live with their sister, a garment worker who gives them $70 a month for household expenses. They have a young child who is a student and an old mother in the family as an extra burden. Her husband hopes that the loan, with which he intends to buy a motorbike, will be able to help him with his living standard. He will use his motorbike as a taxi to take workers to the garment factory. He thinks that being a moto-taxi driver will help his family to earn more income than being a fisherman.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells clothing and sack bags.

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sack bags to sell.

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama is 37-year-old woman living in Ghobeiry in Mount Lebanon. She has owned a mini market since 2000. Today, she would like to borrow $800 in order to increase her purchases to improve her inventory.

loans.use: improve inventory

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A. is a rice grower. She is 39 years old and a mother of three kids. She ended up farming because she was not happy about her previous job. Her husband, Deny A., manages their small rice field. They have been together for 18 years already.

Juvy wants to grow her business. She would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her rice farm. Fertilizers will improve the soil condition of her land. It will lead to increased yield for her and her family.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to sustain and grow more of their livelihood. CEVI does not just provides loans to all its clients. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
A. Albertine est née vers 1957. Albertine est mère de cinq (5) enfants dont trois scolarisés et à sa charge. Albertine est mariée à CODO TOSSOU Pierre employé comme mécanicien à l’université d’Abomey Calavi. Albertine vit avec sa famille au quartier Akpakpa Dodomè à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Albertine vend des divers et des produits cosmétiques dans sa boutique à Akpakpa Dodomè. Albertine achète ses produits chez les détaillants à Cotonou au grand marché international du Bénin. Pour accroître son capital et pouvoir faire ses achats chez les grossistes Albertine s'est adressée à ALIDé. Albertine a eu déjà quatoze (14) prêts avec ALIDé; prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu hisser son activité au niveau où elle est aujourd'hui. Albertine a pour projet de diversifier son activité à la vente de céréales. C'est pour réaliser ce projet que Albertine sollicite un quinzième prêt à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Albertine was born around 1957. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are in school and in her care. She is married to CODO TOSSOU Pierre, who is employed as a mechanic at the University of Abomey Calavi. Albertine lives with her family in the Akpakpa Dodomè district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells various goods and cosmetics in her shop in Akpakpa Dodomè. She buys her merchandise from retailers in Cotonou at the grand international market of Benin.

To grow her capital and to be able to make purchases from wholesalers, she turned toward Alidé. She has had fourteen loans with Alidé that she has repaid. These loans were used to raise her business to a level at which it is today. Her plan is to diversify her business by selling grains. To realize this plan, she's requesting a fifteen loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and sacks of corn, millet, sorghum, and beans

loans.name: Theara

texts.en: N. Theara is a 52-year-old married woman whose currently living in Kompong Chnang province. She works as a driving teacher with a daily income of $18. Her husband, a militia officer since 1979 has a daily income of $1.14, and is working hard together with her to support their three children two of whom are university students and another one is a driving teacher of his mother’s car. Their monthly expenses are over $200 including the school fees, food, electricity and water supplies, and rent. Changing the job from a grocery seller (she used to sell grocery at home) to a teacher of driving car, she earns more income to support her family, so she decided to make a second loan to buy another car and to enlarge her business to the other provinces.

loans.use: buying car

loans.name: Rahma's Group

texts.en:
Rahma has been a juice and groundnut seller and has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $325. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, juice items, and groundnuts to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, and save money for future use.

Rahma is 39 years old, married, and has five children: ages 15, 12, 10, 8, and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Rukia, Zawadi, and Amina. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, juice items and groundnuts to add her current stock.

loans.name: Nasabu

texts.en:
Nasabu has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She belongs to the Jitahidi loan group (group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and shoes for resale in order to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Nasabu is 26 years old and married.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 36 years old and married with 3 children.She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She sells touch lights. She started this business in 2006. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more touch lights to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more touch lights to sell

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: A Kompong Chnang Resident, K. Sina is 29 years old and lives with her 40-year-old husband, Khem Phat, who is a teacher at Soramrith high school. She works hard as a grocery seller and earns a daily income of $3.50 while her husband earns $4 a day. They have two kids and have monthly expenses that are a bit high comparing to their current income. K. Sina is optimistic that if she takes the second loan before the Khmer New Year, it will be possible to buy more goods such as rice, orange juice, beer, and gasoline for her store and to sell it well because the store is conveniently located in the center of the village, and it has been open for 3-4 years already.  As a result, her income will increase due to the plentiful amount of the goods sold. Moreover, she is now trying to save more money and pay everything in order to newly build a house. (K. Sina pictured with her daughter)

loans.use: buy more inventory

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 27 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bol Chhun

texts.en: Bol Chhun N., a 44-year-old housewife, has lived in Kompong ChhN. province since 1997, in a house in which most of the people are professional blacksmiths, including her two sons and husband, Hoa Seng Hout, pictured here. Seeing that she can make use of her family’s profession, she decided to take a second loan from KIVA to buy more metal in order to produce windows and doors to sell. With the hope that their business of producing household materials from blacksmithing will positively succeed, they plan to conduct a much bigger business with the skills they have.

loans.use: To buy more metal

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She sells baby things like soap, cream, flasks, diapers, and clothes. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Eucharia

texts.en: Eucharia is 24 years old and married without a child. She sells provisions and foodstuffs to make a living. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is widower with one son, who is 5 years old. He sells construction materials and supplies. His business is located at Troyan Market in Ivano-Frankovsk city. His profit is 4,000 UAH per month.

Sergei has been in this business for 12 years. He's got a good location that brings many customers his way. His wise pricing and good customer service attracts many clients. This business is the only source of income for Sergei and his son. Being a single father, Sergei's goal is to provide his son with everything he needs in order to grow.

Sergei would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase 200 bottles of paint coloring and 400 kg. of lime. He will sell these items in retail and generate more income for his family needs.

loans.use: To purchase paint coloring and lime to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for three borrowers, all of whom live in Sala Komreuk Commune, Siem Reap Province. The group's leader, Mrs. C., 41, makes a living selling snack foods. She sells products like Khmer noodles, boiled eggs, and some sweet for kids. She can generate an income of $ 4 each day, and she reinvests the income in her business activities.

Mrs. C. has four children; they are students and they all always help her in her business. She married to Dy, age 45, who is a motor taxi driver. Mrs. C.'s business is improving and her customers are requesting more goods. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan in order to enlarge her business.

The other two borrowers are:

Mrs. P., a Khmer cake seller who requesting a loan to purchase a motor for family riding.

Mrs. V., a good homemaker. Her family's expenses are met by her husband, who works as a local teacher. She is applying for a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To enlarge her snack-food business

loans.name: Zabirov

texts.ru: Забиров Насрулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 36 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает фельдшером -посменно. В нерабочие дни занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет магазин , где торгует хозяйственными товарами. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это даст возможность увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
N. Zabirov lives in the Gissar region. He is 36 years old, married and has five children. He works as a paramedic part time. He has a retail business on the days when he doesn't work. He has a store where he sells household products. He has been in this business for ten years now. He plans to get a loan to increase commodity circulation. This will give an opportunity to increase the variety of the merchandise and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Hawawu

texts.en: Hawawu is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuufs to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana B. D. L. C. vive en el puerto D. L. Libertad, junto a su madre. Juana tiene dos hijas que se han ido del país en L. búsqueda D.  superación económica, Ahora Juana junto a su madre, que es D. un gran  un apoyo se dedican  al negocio, un pequeño comedor donD. tienen muchos, Juana ya a obtenido créditos anteriormente donD. su record crediticio es excelente, ahora elL. solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio, así aumentara su producción al igual que sus ingresos económicos.-
texts.en:
Juana B. D. L. C. lives in the L. Libertad port with her mother. Juana has two daughters who have left the country looking for a better economic situation. Now Juana and her mother, who is of great support, have a business, a small dining hall where they have many customers, Juana has already obtained loans in the past, and her record is excellent. Now she needs a new loan to invest in her business and increase her production as well as her income.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos para su negocio

location.town: Puerto de La Libertad, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Fasilat

texts.en:
Fasilat is 25 years old and married with three children. She sells engine oil in retail to her customers.

Fasilat hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
A. Célestine est née vers les années 1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Célestine est mariée à AHINAZAN Delphin agent de bureau au port de douane de Cotonou. Célestine est mère de quatre (04) enfants tous scolarisés, excepté Charles, l’aîné, âgé de vingt (20) ans et apprenti soudeur. Célestine et sa famille réside au quartier Cité Ville Nouvelle, une banlieue de Cotonou. Célestine vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). C'est de ménage en ménage, le plateau de divers sur la tête que Célestine passe vendre ses articles. Pour élever le niveau de son activité et avoir plus de revenu pour mieux satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Célestine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Célestine A. was born about 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Célestine is married to Delphin Ahinazan, an agent at the port in Cotonou. She is the mother of four (4) children who are all in school, with the exception of Charles, the eldest, aged 20, who is an apprentice welder. Célestine and her family live in Cite Ville Nouvelle, a suburb of Cotonou. She sells various items including candies, biscuits, milk cartons, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, basic meat spreads, washing soaps, dishes, toiletries etc. With a basin of these work items piled on her head, Célestine make the rounds, hawking her goods. She is requesting this loan from ALIDe to increase her business and have more operating revenue to meet her customers needs and those of her family. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of candies, biscuits, milk cartons, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, basic meat spreads, washing soaps, dishes, toiletries etc. for resale

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana Francisca H., vive en Cojutepeque ubicado en el Oriente del país, ella vive junto a su esposo y  tres hijos, Ana en búsqueda de una superación personal y económica aprendió cosmetología, mismo oficio que hoy la hace dueña de su propio salón de belleza, Ana no solo ofrece sus servicios de corte de cabello  y tintes, también ofrece productos a sus clientes como shampoo, cremas para cabello entre otros, Ana aprovecha sus conocimientos en el oficio y le recomienda a sus clientes sus mejores productos, ahora Ana solicita un crédito por que quiere surtir mas su negocio con variedad de marcas y productos.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca H. lives in Cojutepeque, located in the eastern part of the country. She lives with her husband and 3 children. In her quest to better herself and her economic situation, Ana learned cosmetology, which has allowed her to own her own beauty salon today. She not only offers services of haircut and hair coloring, but she also offers products like shampoo, hair lotions, and others to her clients, as well as useing her knowledge to recommend better products to them. Ana now needs a loan to supply her store with a wider variety of products and brands.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos para su negocio

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en: Glen S. is a 40-year-old man from Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. He is married and blessed with 8 children. Glenn is a meat vendor. His wife assists him in running the business. He wakes up early in the morning and prepares for his routine. He also has a helper for going to the slaughterhouse to butcher pigs or cows. Glenn and his helper personally dress the meat for the market, where  he has a stall where he displays and sells his meat products. He is doing this for the future of his family. Through this business, Glenn is able to send his children to school and provide their daily needs.  Glenn is in need of additional capital to purchase livestock intended for his business. He is  applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00 from HSPFI (a Kiva Partner). Glenn would be glad if there would be an immediate response to his application.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his meat vending business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jaquelin Yessenia

texts.es: Jaquelin Yessenia S. P., vive en Ilopango junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad que estudian. Jaquelin cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien es empleado, pero a pesar de ello Jaquelin se ve en la necesidad de buscar otra fuente de ingreso para la familia, Jaquelin se dedica a sus dos negocios; uno de ellos la tienda y otro una tortillería, todo esto  ubicado en su casa, porque también es una madre muy responsable y prefiere ella cuidar de sus hijos todos los días cuando regresan del colegio. Jaquelin solicita un crédito para surtir mas su tienda y tortillería.
texts.en:
Jaquelin Yessenia S. P. lives in Ilopango with her husband and two small school-age children. Jaquelin has the financial support of her husband who is employed, but in spite of that, she has seen the need to look for an additional source of income for the family. Jaquelin has two businesses: one is a store and one is the tortilla stand, both in her home; she is a very responsible mother and prefers to care for her children and to be home when they get home from school. Jaquelin is requesting a loan to better supply her store and tortilla stand.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para surtir su tienda

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She sells second-hand clothes in her shop. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena G. vive en Zacatecoluca departamento La Paz.  Juana tiene 6 hijos pero solo cuatro viven con ella ; ya que estos aun son menores( 15 anos , 13 años, 8 años y 4 años de edad); Juana se dedica a la venta de sopa en el mercado municipal de Zacatecoluca donde tiene muchos clientes,  ya que la sopa que ella hace no la vende nadie más en todo el mercado; el sueño de Juana, es crece en su negocio y producir más variedad de comida, es por ello que solita este crédito para la compra de insumos en la producción de otro tipo de platillos para vender en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria Elena G. lives in Zacatecoluca, La Paz. Juana has 6 children but only 4 live with her, since they are minors (15, 13, 8, and 4 years of age). Juana sells soup at the Zacatecoluca municipal market where she has many customers, since nobody else sells the kind of soup she makes anywhere else in the market. Juana's dream is to grow her business and to produce a wider variety of food. This is why she is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for the production of different types of dishes to sell at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para comida

loans.name: Tai Group

texts.en:
Saada Kasim, age 40, is married with seven children. She started her business in 2004. She sells clothes and weaving. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $170

This will be Saada’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two to increase her stock by buying more clothes to sell and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her business and to pay school fees for her children.

Saada will share this loan with subgroup A of the Tai group. The subgroup has six members who are selling food, have salon shops, or sell charcoal. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Saada is second from the left in a pink dress.

loans.use: To increase her business and to pay school fees

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel L. O., vive en Lourdes departamento La Libertad junto a su hijo y la esposa del mismo. Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa para bebes, su negocio se encuentra en un puesto muy informal a la orillas de la calle de Santa Tecla. Maria solicita un crédito para instalación de servicios básicos  en su vivienda como el agua. Cabe mencionar que Maria ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente donde ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas asignadas.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel L. O. lives in Lourdes, La Libertad region, with her son and husband. She sells baby clothes from an informal locale along Santa Tecia Street. Maria is requesting a loan in order to turn on basic services in her home such as water. Maria has managed loans previously and has been punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To turn on basic services in her home.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza A. Z., vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador. Maria es una mujer con 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo de 60 años. Esta pareja se dedica a la elaboración de especies que son utilizadas para dar sabor, olor y color a una gran variedad de alimentos .El negocio consiste en la elaboración de cada una de las especies y también en la venta de las mismas;  el esposo de Maria sale de casa y la vende de manera ambulante por las calles. Maria solicita un crédito para compra de insumos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza A. Z. lives in the San Salvador region. She is 59 years old and lives with her husband of 60 years. The couple sells spices, which are used in cooking to add flavor, aroma, and color to a variety of foods. The business consists of making and selling the spices; Maria's husband sells the spices door-to-door. Maria is requesting the loan to buy supplies for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Саидов Абдурауф житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 34 года, женат и имеет троих детей. Имеетвысшее образование. Работает экономистом. Кроме этого имеет столовую. Работает там вместе со своей женой. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить продукты питания длительного хранения. это поможет ему увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых блюд , а так же сохранить цены на них. Таким образом он сможет привлечь новых клиентов , которые дадут дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Abdurauf S. lives in the Gissar region. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He has higher education. He works as an economist. Besides that he owns a cafe where he works together with his wife. He plans to get a loan and use it to buy food stuffs for long term storage. This will help him increase the variety of the dishes on the menu and also keep the prices the same. He can also attract new customers this way which will bring additional profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio S. vive en la Capital de El Salvador, Pedro es hombre casado y padre de tres hijas menores de edad que son estudiantes, La esposa de Pedro se dedica a la costura, confecciona ropa a la medida;  y Pedro se dedica a la venta de cachorros en una de las calles muy transitadas del país , donde las personas  se detienen en sus carros a preguntar cuánto vale algún perrito. Pedro solicita un crédito para mejoras de su vivienda, ya que precisa cambiar el techo cuanto antes, por el deterioro del mismo,  y lo quiere hacer lo antes posible; ya que estamos a pocos días del invierno.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio S. lives in El Salador's captial. He is married and the father of three daughters who are students. His wife works as a seamstress, making custom tailored clothing. Pedro sells puppies on one of the busiest streets in the country, where people stop their cars to ask him how much a puppy costs. Pedro is requesting a loan for home improvements, as he needs to replace the roof quickly. The roof is very deteriorated and he wants to replace it as soon as possible since winter is a few days away.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvements

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Эшонкулов Абдурахмон житель района Гисаар. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование . По специальности агроном.Кроме того работает в сфере бизнеса. Торгует сундуками. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы включить их в товарооборот. Таким образом он сможет увеличить товарооборот и улучшить положение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon E. lives in the Gissar region. He is married and has four children. He has higher education and is an agronomist by profession. He has own business as well, he sells drawer chests. He plans to use the loan to include them into circulation. This way he can increase commodity turnover and improve his business condition.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by five borrowers, all of whom live in the Slo Kram Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. S., age 36, has been buying and selling charcoal from her home for more than eight years. Her husband works as a staff member for the Cambodia company. The couple is very responsible to their two children, who are going to the local public school. S.'s business of selling charcoal is the main source of income for the family's daily expenses. S. needs capital from Kiva's partner HKL to purchase more charcoal to store for resale.

The other four members of loan include N., who is requesting a loan to increase capital in her charcoal-selling business; R., a homemaker who is seeking a loan to buy a motor for her family's needs and to use as capital for her husband's carpentry business; K., a perfume seller who is applying for a loan to purchase more perfume for sale; and S., who works as a staff member for a company and requests a loan to buy a motorbike for riding to work.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to store for resale

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз Темуров  1960 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Его жена сидит дома на  пенсии и нянчит внуков. Сам он вышел на пенсию и решился заняться бизнесом, устроился в чайхану. В торговле почти 3 года. Торгует продуктами питания в чайхане. В чайхане много людей, поэтому он открыл там небольшой ларек. Из-за небольшого оборотного капитала он обратился в Микроинвест за кредитом.
texts.en:
Abduaziz T. is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has secondary education. His wife is retired and stays at home with their grandchildren. He also decided to retire and start a business. He began working at a tea house. Because of good traffic, he was able to open a small shop, where he sells various food products. He has been in this business for 3 years. Since he has limited capital, he decided to obtain a loan through MicroInvest so he could expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира Вахобова  1981 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Замира закончила университет , вышла замуж. После замужества  муж не пустил на работу. Она три года назад начала  печь блинчики и торты. Не далеко от ее дома есть кафе - бистро, она туда сдает  свои блинчики и торты. Она договорилась с ними на счет цены и условиями поставки. Почти три года она печет дома и из дому забирают ее товар. В 2004 году обратилась за кредитом на покупки муки и других необходимых продуктов для выпечки, и до сих пор получает кредит. Она благодарна что ее поддержали  и ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Zamira was born in 1981. She is married and has 2 children. After Zamira graduated college, she got married, and her husband forbade her to go to work. Three years ago, Zamira began to bake pies and cakes. Zamira sells her products to a nearby cafe. The cafe has been Zamira's client for all three years. In 2004, Zamira applied for her first loan to purchase flour and other baking products. She has been a good borrower ever since. She thanks her lenders for supporting her business!

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baking products

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Азамджон Нозими житель города Душанбе. Возраст 26 лет, женат , но детей не имеет. Работает электриком в компании "Babilon- mobail". Обратился к нам за кредитом. Деньги планирует использовать для проведения свадебного мероприятия своей семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Azamjon N. is a Dushanbe resident. He is 26, married, but has no children. Azamjon works as an electrician for "Babilon-mobail" company. Azamjon asks for this loan to pay for his sister's wedding ceremony. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for sister's wedding

loans.name: Tujumuike Group

texts.en:
Amosi M., 27, is married with three children ages, 12, 10 and 4. He has a clothes business where they print and make different fashions to sell. He started this business about ten years ago. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $177.

This will be Amosi’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his businesses and also bought a zigzag machine and has paid back his loans successfully. He wants to use the new loan to increase his capital and to buy more material.

Amosi will share this loan with his group Tujumwike, which totals 16 members. The members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Amosi is the only man.

loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy more material

loans.name: Ambroisine

texts.fr:
A. Ambroisine est née vers les années 1975 à Grand-Popo, une ville touristique du Bénin. Ambroisine est Célibataire sans enfants et couturière de formation. Mais Ambroisine est dans la restauration. Ambroisine vend aussi des chaussures, des sacs de sortie et des tissus. Ambroisine réside au quartier Godomey un banlieue de la Commune d’Abomey-Calavi. Ambroisine sollicite de crédit auprès de AALIDé pour développer son restaurant afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Ambroisine was born around 1975 in Grand-Popo, a tourist town of Bénin. She has no children and is a seamstress by training. But she works in the restaurant business. She also sells shoes, handbags, and cloth. Ambroisine resides in Godomey, a suburb of the town of Abomey-Calavi. She’s requesting a loan from Alidé to develop her restaurant in order to serve her customers better.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pub items, pasta, canned milk and sardines, mayonnaise, butter, coffee, and cloth

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget P. (the second from the left) was selected to be a group leader by members of a group loan from Maxima, a KiV. partner. In the group there are three families, including hers. All group members live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Nget P., 52, and her husband, Mr. Sreng Ry, 69, were married in 1973 and have ten children: three sons and seven daughters. Seven of children are married and live outside the family home, one child is a garment-factory worker and the other two attend school.

Nget and her husband sell roasted fish and chicken. They buy it from the Takmao market for resale in her village. She is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase cows for raising.

Mrs. Sarim Sreng, 24, and her husband, Mr. Dan T., 22, have been married for three years and have one young daughter. Dan has been a construction worker for more than two years. Sarim has been a garment-factory worker for four months. She is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase cows for raising.

Mrs. Saroeun Sreng, 29, and her husband, Mr. Chheang V., 30, have been married for two years and have two young children: one son and one daughter. Chheang is a truck driver. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Chheng’s truck broke in some parts so he is asking for a loan of $150 to make the repairs.

loans.use: To purchase cows for raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business and buy more tools required for farming

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells medicines. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.ru: Маруфчон - молодой человек 28 лет. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Его жена домохозяйка. Делает домашние дела, нянчит за ребенком. Днем дома скота нет, потому, что Маруфчон отгоняет их на пастбище. И только вечером пригоняет их обратно. Недавно домашнее хозяйство у Маруфчона стало отдельным. Отец отделил его домашнее хозяйство и передал ему небольшое количество скота. Прежде Маруфчон брал займ для увеличения количества скота общей семьи. Но теперь за этот новый займ он хочет пополнить свой скот.
texts.en:
Marufjon, 28, is married and has 2 children. He is a cattle farmer. Marufjon's wife is a house maker taking care of the house and the children. During the day, the cattle is out in the fields. Recently, Marufjon separated from his father's household. Marufjon's father provided him with a house and some cattle. In the past, Marufjon took loans to purchase cattle for his whole family, but now he will be buying cattle for himself.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta G. is an ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) member in the City of Hamtic, Province of Antique, Philippines. She is married and the 52-year-old mother to three sons. Her husband is Rodrigo G. a jeepney (small bus) driver and also a hired laborer. Two of her sons already graduated from high school and the youngest is in elementary school.

Loreta was given the opportunity to buy a pedicab when she received her first loan from ASHI. She was privileged enough since, as a means of transportation for people in the city, the use of a pedicab is in demand. As her business is growing fast, her next loan will be used to purchase a second pedicab, and some of the loan will be used as capital in buying 50 chicks and the vitamins and feed for them.

Loreta dreams that someday she and her family will get out of poverty. She hopes to send her children to school so that they are able to find stable jobs and will not suffer the same life that she has had.

loans.use: To purchase a pedicab and 50 chicks plus feed and vitamins for them

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr:
G. Irène est née le 18/08/1974 à Cotonou. Irène est célibataire et mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés. Depuis plus de trois (3) ans que son mari la abandonnée par Irène à la charge de ses trois enfants. Irène réside à Aglangandan un quartier populaire de la Commune de Sème-Kpodji. Irène est couturière et confectionne des tenues pour dame et enfant. Irène vend également de tissus, de sacs de riz et des pâtes alimentaires. Irène a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a élevé le niveau de son activité. Pour mieux développer son activité afin de faire plus de profit, Irène sollicite de ALIDé un troisième crédit.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Irène was born on August 18, 1974 in Cotonou. She is unmarried and the mother of three children, all schooled. For over three years since her husband abandoned her, she has had to support her three children. Irène resides in Aglangandan, a working-class district of the town of Sème-Kpodji. She is a seamstress and makes clothing for women and children. She also sells fabrics, sacks of rice, and pasta. She has had two Alidé loans that she repaid. She used those loans to elevate her level of business. To develop her business better in order to make more profit, she’s requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, sacks of rice, cloth, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Mafia Group

texts.en:
Fatuma M., age 40, is married with children.  She has a tailoring business which she started some years ago.  She works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $274. 

This will be Fatuma’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants to increase her tailoring business by buying two more sewing machines.
	
Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Mafia, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is third from left, second row, in white dress and white head covering.

loans.use: To purchase two more sewing machines

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals and seeds for his land

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
H. Jeanne est née le 27/01/1966 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Jeanne est mariée à HOUNGUEVOU Bernard et est mère de cinq (5) enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeanne vend des céréales et autres produits alimentaires. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement, Jeanne a eu à solliciter l'appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne a donc déjà eu cinq crédits de la part de ALIDé. Mais Jeanne veut continuer de développer son activité pour pouvoir élever son revenu. C'est pourquoi Jeanne sollicite un sixième crédit à ALIDé.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Jeanne was born on January 27, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to HOUNGUEVOU Bernard and is the mother of five children, all schooled. She sells grain and other foodstuff. To boost her working capital, Jeanne had requested the financial support of Alidé before. She has thus had five loans from Alidé. But she wants to continue to develop her business in order to increase her revenues. This is why she's requesting a sixth loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain:  corn, millet, sorghum, and beans

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en: Since 1998, Sampson A. has worked as a trader in Siwdu selling goods such as cell phones, shoes and belts. He is married with one child and received an education through Senior High School. Sampson’s wife also makes a living as a trader in the Siwdu area. Sampson is responsible for various family expenses such as school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy additional items like cell phones, shoes and belts, which he will then resell. Sampson hopes to use his newly gained profits to reinvest back into his business.

loans.use: To buy additional items like cell phones, shoes and belts which he will then resell.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita D. is a 44-year-old mother of two daughters who lives in Culasi, Antique Province on the island of Panay.  Culasi is a beautiful coastal town, with the sea to the west and mountains to the east; it is home to Madia-as, the tallest mountain on the island.  Bernardita's husband Bertito is a farmer.
Bernardita grows rice with her husband, and intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy materials for rice farming.  Besides rice farming, Bernardita earns extra income from working as a housemaid.
Bernardita's 18-year-old daughter is attending college, and her younger daughter, a nine year old, is in elementary school.  Bernardita hopes to earn enough to help both of her daughters attain a college education.  She would also like to be able to afford to build a more secure and durable house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To buy materials for her rice farm.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Since 1999, Isaac A. has worked as a trader at Moree, near Siwdu, selling goods such as rice, sugar, and paint and other building materials. He is married with 3 children and his wife is employed as a trader. He is responsible for paying various family expenses such as school fees and utilities. Isaac’s loan will be used to buy more stock and building materials for selling and he hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more stock and building materials for selling

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She has two businesses selling clothing and food at the central market in Parvograd city. These two businesses are independent but run at the same time.

Irina has been in these businesses for two years. Actually, her whole family is in small business. Her husband sells trees, while her son has his own business and sells various home products. Irina's business goal is to improve her business conditions and build her own kiosk.

Irina would like to borrow 10,900 UAH to increase inventory. She would purchase more inventory and offer her clients a larger variety of goods. Irina believes this would help her to reach her business goal.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.ru: Шавкатчон, молодой человек 29 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. С раннего утра до поздней ночи пасет стадо на пастбище. Жена нигде не работает. Помогает по хозяйству своей свекрови. Шавкатчон пока живет с родителями. В этом году его младший брат женится, и потом Шавкатчон отделит свое домохозяйство от отца. Но уже Шавкатчон старается прикупить для себя скот, чтоб когда его отделит отец у него было на что жить.
texts.en:
Shavkatjon, 29, is married and has 3 children. Shavkatjon is a cattle farmer. From dawn till dusk, Shavkatjon is herding cattle. His wife is a house maker. She helps he mother-in-law with household chores, as Shavkatjon and his family lives with his parents. This year, Shavkatjon's younger brother will get married. Then, Shavkatjon will separate his household from that of his father. To prepare for the separation, Shavkatjon is looking to purchase cattle for himself.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Benjamin repairs electrical items in cars like batteries, radiators, etc. He also sells car batteries and key starters. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more car batteries and key starters to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more car batteries and key starters

loans.name: Owolabi

texts.en: Owolabi is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He sells planks that are used in the making of furniture and roofs. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Adekunle

texts.en: Adekunle A. sells planks. He is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide V. is engaged in an ice cream-making business. She peddles ice cream in her village and nearby towns. She sells it for 3.00 pesos per cup and, by the end of the day, she earns 800 pesos. She has time at the end of the day if her ice cream is already sold out. During the weekends, Haide goes to the city downtown to buy ingredients for the upcoming week. Haide is requesting a loan to purchase additional ingredients for making ice cream.

Haide is 34-years old, married and blessed with six children. Her husband supports her by working in simple traditional mining locally known as pamiling. They are happily living in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. Haide is responsible for the education of her four oldest children and cares for the other two who are still young.

Haide wants to avail herself of an 11,000 pesos loan from HSPFI, Kiva's partner. If granted, Haide would also like to buy a motorcycle so it would be easy for her to peddle her product.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making ice cream

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Femi

texts.en: Femi is 35 years old and married with 2 children. Femi is a vulcanizer and he also sells tyres and tubes. He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more tyres and tubes to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tyres and tubes to sell

loans.name: Djamoliddin

texts.en:
K. Djamoliddin is 31 years old. He is married with two children. Djamoliddin has a small restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade. When Djamoliddin first started his business he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business.

Djamoliddin wants the loan so he may invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for $3,000 with the term of 10 months. With this money, Djamoliddin will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit and in turn help his children move forward to complete their school studies and further continue studying at the university. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing tables, chairs and utensils for expanding his cafe business

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Since 2005, Ben S. Naa has worked as a trader at Kotokraba in Siwdu, selling Fan Milk, which is the most popular ice cream in the country. He has a stationery shop, but also travels on a bicycle to sell his goods. He is married with 2 children and received an education through Senior High School. His wife is a librarian. He is responsible for paying his family’s various expenses and will use the loan to purchase additional varieties of the ice creams made by the Fan Milk company to expand his business. Ben hopes to use his newly gained profits to reinvest and improve his enterprise

loans.use: To purchase additional varieties of the ice creams made by the Fan Milk company to expand his business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia K. is married with 5 dependants and received an education through Junior High School. Since 1996, Cynthia has worked as a trader at Kotokraba in Siwdu, selling ladies clothing and footwear. Cynthia’s husband is also employed as a trader in the Kotokraba area. She uses her income to pay for various family expenses, including school fees. Cynthia will use the loan to purchase additional clothing and footwear for selling, and with her newly gained profits, she plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing and footwear for selling

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.en:
S. Ahliddin is 38 years old. He is married with six children. Ahliddin is selling foodstuffs like macaroni, wheat, buckwheat, cottonseed oil and other products. When Ahliddin started the business two years ago it was only retail sales. Gradually expanding the business, he purchased the goods as a wholesaler and distributed them among the stores. The business became successful and stable.

Currently Ahliddin requests $2,000 US for the term of 12 months. The loan will be spent for purchasing foodstuff to increase the range of goods for selling. Ahliddin thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.
