loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Hussana

texts.en: Since 1996, Hussana S. has worked as a trader in Siwdu selling eggs. She is married with 3 children and received education through primary school. While Hussana works as a trader, her husband is employed as a tailor. Hussana is responsible for paying utility bills and also caring for her children. The loan will be used to buy additional goods which will increase her productivity and improve her business in the selling of the eggs. She hopes to use her newly gained profits to reinvest back into her enterprise and improve her capital.

loans.use: To buy additional goods which will increase her productivity and improve her business in the selling of the eggs.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia I. is 55 years old and married with 4 children. She sells bags of garri. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 48 years old and married with 5 children. Elizabeth sells garri in small quantities to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Husnidinkhon

texts.en:
A. Husnidinkhon has been in the photography business for three years. He is married and has two children. He has a secondary technical education and was trained as an engineer. Since the local factories are closed, Husnidinkhon started a photography business in order to support his family. Now he has many clients, but in order to stay abreast of the competition, he needs to keep his photo equipment up to date. Husnidinkhon wants a loan to buy new equipment, which will improve the quality of the photo services he provides. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing new equipment

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma L. is 45-year-old woman living in Hamtic, Antique. She is married and a mother to three daughters and three sons. Since her husband is in prison, she gives more effort in carrying out the obligations both as a mother and a father to her children. Her oldest daughter is an 18-year-old and her youngest daughter is a 3-year-old.

Thelma is so creative and works nonstop just to support the basic needs of her family. Because of her talent in cooking, she cooks and sells foods such as banana cue and cassava cakes. Now, in her next loan she proposes to buy sacks of rice for retail, and ingredients for food vending. The proceeds from her businesses will surely help her and her family reach their dreams.

She is hopeful that as her businesses grow, she can sustain the educational needs of her children in hopes that they find jobs so they will have money to help pay legal fees for her husband to try to free him from prison.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale, and ingredients for banana cue and cassava cake

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria M. A. is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Olubisi

texts.en:
Olubisi O. is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells foodstuffs.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase of more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Khusan

texts.en:
Khusan B., married with three children, is a very hard-working man. Thirty years ago, after having been rejected for various jobs, Khusan decided to start a business from his home providing turner services. His good service has earned him many clients and he now employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs.

Khusan’s desire is to keep growing as a micro businessman, so he is asking for a loan of $1850 to refurbish his shop and to buy some equipment in order to improve the quality of service that he offers. He will repay this amount over a period of 12 months. Your help will be very useful to Khusan and he sincerely thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment to improve the quality of service.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam H., a married father of six children, grows wheat, rice, and peas which he plants once a year, aided by his eldest child. His wife is a teacher at a local school. Rice growing is the main source of income sustaining the family, and Uktam is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. This money will ensure the economic prosperity of this friendly family.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mukaramakhon

texts.en:
Mukaramakhon K. is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Mukaramakhon's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist did not leave enough money to meet family expenses. For this reason, 10 years ago, Mukaramakhon decided to start her own business, selling fabrics for local cultural dresses. Little by little she made her business grow and by offering her clients a way to pay in installments greatly increased her revenue. Now her business is running smoothly. However, she would like to continue increasing her business so that her situation would be more stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $ 800 USD that she will pay back in 6 months. With this money, Mukaramakhon will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the local cultural dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fabrics for local cultural dresses.

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar D. est un homme qui a une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans  et habite au quartier Gouye Sombel de Thiès derrière la voix ferrée. Il est marié et est commerçant depuis 2003. Son commerce consiste à vendre des pièces détachées pour les véhicules et aussi il exporte des voitures détachées depuis l’Europe pour ensuite faire le montage et les revendre. Il maîtrise bien le système et est à son deuxième prêt dont le premier a été bien remboursé. Avec ce prêt il veut renforcer son activité dont les revenues lui permettent de bien rembourser et aussi d’entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Momar D. is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Gouye Sombel district of Thiès and behind the railroad tracks. He is married and has been a merchant since 2003. His commerce involves selling spare parts for vehicles and also importing car parts from Europe and then assembling them for resale. He has a good command of the system and is on his second loan; the first loan was repaid. With the loan, he wants to bolster his business, including his revenues, which enable him to make his payments and also to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his business

loans.name: Safarali

texts.en:
O. Safarali is a simple farmer with simple dreams – to uplift his family’s economic life and to be able to send his dearest little son to school in future. Farming has been his major source of income. Safarali produces wheat, rice and onion. Because of the expensive farm inputs, traders buy their rice products at a lower price. Hence, he requests a loan of US $850 to support his farming business and to avoid asking credits from traders who charge higher interest. He is grateful that he is able to borrow from Kiva lenders who offer lesser interest and create better opportunities for him, thus helping his family to become poverty free. Safarali believes that through prayers and hard work he can achieve his dreams someday. Educating his son is one of his priorities.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers to improve business

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is 49 years old and married with six children. She sells provisions and sachet water. She is requesting a loan of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Marguba

texts.en:
Marguba is a lovely 32-year-old woman who lives with her two children. She runs a small fabric-selling business at the local market, where she offers a variety of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Marguba is asking for a loan to buy more goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise, thus improve her business and increase her profits. She dreams of having her own large store someday; but, most importantly, she envisages a better future for her children, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. Marguba thanks you for your support!

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for increasing range of goods

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Married with five children, Rano sells nice quality fabrics for national dresses in a large local market. Her family is actively helping her with the business which she started about 15 years ago. Rano is requesting a loan of $800 to increase her inventory which will help supply her until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Rano’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Rashidat

texts.en:
Rashidat O. is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells plastics and slippers.

She is requesting for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more plastics and slippers to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics and slippers to sell

loans.name: Mumin

texts.en:
N. Mumin is 45 years old and is married with two children. From the time he was young, Mumin has been learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical, and hardworking people. For this reason, he is asking a loan of $1400 for the term of 12 months. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Mumin’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to expand his business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa M. is married and has two children. She has received an education through junior high school. Theresa is a trader who sells videos, cassettes, and CDs at Akotokyin in Abura, which she has done for five years. While Theresa works as a trader, her husband is employed as a carpenter. Theresa uses her income as housekeeping money for her family.

Theresa will use the loan to purchase additional cassettes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase additonal cassettes for sale

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
N. Naim is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Naim has been around people raising animals and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Naim harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. By this, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work.

Naim requests $1400 for the term of 12 months. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Monsieur Balla G.  est un homme marié qui a l’âge de 35 ans. Il est marié et a un enfant, il habite au quartier Randoulène Nord de Thiès. Il fait le commerce de pièces détachées et est aussi réparateur de motos, il a son propre atelier  prés de la Lonase de Thiès  et réalise un bon chiffre d’affaire. Il a déjà bénéficié un prêt de 100 000 qu’il  a normalement remboursé et est son renouvellement  pour renforcer son activité. Il vend des croix, des bobines et des bugnons pour moto. Il réalise un bénéfice de 77 500f. Ce bénéfice lui permet de rembourser  son prêt et aussi  d’investir le reste dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Balla G. is a married man who is 35 years old. He has one child and lives in the Randoulène Nord district of Thiès. He does commerce in spare parts and also in repairing motorbikes. He has his own workshop near Lonase de Thiès and has good sales figures. He has had a loan of 100,000 francs that he repaid as expected and is now on his renewal for bolstering his business. He sells Croix parts, coils, and Bugnon parts for motorbikes. He’s earning a profit of 77,500 francs. This profit enables him to repay his loan and also to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his business

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.en:
For the past six years, Nabijon has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle which he cares for greatly since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Nabijon showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock.

For Nabijon, it is very important to work raising his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that in future he will earn more money. The additional income will help his family. We appreciate your support for Nabijon’s projects.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is the mother of two children. She is currently head of the family because her husband has gone abroad for several years, so she has to care for her children. Elena lives in the town of Cahul.

On the territory where she lives she has a garden with an area of 10 hectares (about 25 acres), enough to work in agriculture: namely to grow fruit and vegetables. Victoria wants to grow vegetables and fruit all year around. For this she needs to build three greenhouses. The harvest she will collect, Elena will sell at the wholesale market for the district.

Elena is a loyal customer of Microinvest since she asked for two other loans last year. Now she requires a loan of 30,000 lei to buy building materials needed for construction of the greenhouses. In the future Victoria plans to deal with plant breeding, but only after she has finished the greenhouse construction.

loans.use: To buy building materials for her greenhouses

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Madame Adama B. est une vendeuse des peaux de moutons.  Les peaux sont utilisées pour fabriquer les chaussures, donc elles sont très importantes dans la région.  Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 6 ans et elle est bien expérimentée.  Madame B. est mariée avec des enfants qu’elle va soutenir avec les revenus de son entreprise.  Elle habite à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale située 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale de Sénégal.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama B. is a retailer of sheep hides. The hides are used to make shoes, so these are very important in the region. She started this work six years ago, and she is very experienced. She is married and has children who she will support with the revenues from her enterprise. She lives in Diourbel, a small rural city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep hides

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en:
Yemisi I. is 42 years old and married with two children. She is a hairstylist and she also sells hair extensions. She has been in this business for a long time.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Ademola

texts.en:
Ademola S. is 53 years old and married with five children. He has a machine that he uses to cut cellophane (perhaps polyethylene) into bags.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more cellophane to cut into bags to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cellophane to cut into bags to sell

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували 41 год. Женат и отец пятерых детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Жена домохозяйка. Занимается домашней работой, смотрит за крупно-рогатым скотом дома. Днем у него скот находится на пастбище, и поэтому во время мониторинга не было возможности запечатлеть скот на снимке. Абдували на снимке в день выдачи. Абдували хочет потратить свой займ на покупку двух бычков.
texts.en:
Abduvali, 41, is married and has 5 children. Abduvali has a high school education. He raises and sells cattle. Abduvali's wife is a house maker. She helps Abduvali feed cattle. During the day, Abduvali is herding cattle, but on the photo he is shown at the loan office. He plans to use this loan to purchase two bulls.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena E. is a trader who sells food supplies such as maize and palm oil in Abura. She is married with five dependents and has received no formal schooling. Her husband is a top farmer.

Abena has been selling palm oil for 5 years. She is responsible for paying housekeeping money for her family. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies like maize and palm oil to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies like maize and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Safiat

texts.en:
Safiat is 53 years old and married with two children. He does interior decoration, he is a tailor, and he also fixes rugs.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more decorating materials. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more decorating materials for his business

loans.name: El Hadji Sidy

texts.fr: Monsieur El Hadji Sidy C. est un jeune célibataire qui a l’âge de 35 ans. Il habite au quartier Bountou Dépôt de Thiès. Il fait le commerce qui consiste à vendre des produits cosmétiques, des denrées alimentaires  et divers qu’il achète au Mali pour les revendre dans le marché local. Il a commencé à faire son activité depuis deux ans  et maitrise bien le système. Il est à son premier prêt pour renforcer son activité  et il va utiliser les revenus pour se soutenir.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadji Sidy C. is a young unmarried man who is 35 years old. He lives in the Bountou Dépôt district of Thiès. He has a business selling cosmetics, food items, and various goods that he buys in Mali to resell at the local marketplace. He started doing this work two years ago and has good command of how it works. He is on his first loan for bolstering his work, and he will use the profits to sustain his living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 43-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Hassan has been working as a van driver since 1998. He requested a loan of $1,600 US dollars from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business. His clients can be anybody. Hassan decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: Alhaji A. is 45 years old and married with six children. He prints calendars, stickers, invitation cards, etc. He is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more printing materials. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is married and has five dependents. She has received no formal education. Mary is a trader who sells corn oil, palm oil and other food supplies at the Abura market in Abura, which she has done for five years. Her husband works at the Ameen factory, which produces soap.

Mary uses her income to pay for feeding and clothing her family. Mary will use the loan to purchase corn oil and other food supplies for selling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase corn oil and other food supplies for selling

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.ru: Гайбулло 41 год. Он женат и отец 6-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Гайбулло занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Гайбулло – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Гайбулло экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Гайбулло продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота. На снимке Гайбулло стоит около кассы на время выдачи кредита.
texts.en:
Gaybullo, 41, is married and has 6 children. His spouse is a housewife. She takes care of the house and feeds cattle. Gaybullo raises and sells cattle. In the spring the cattle prices are low and it is the time to buy cattle. When fall comes, Gaybullo will sell the animals he raises. This loan Gaybullo will use to purchase food to feed his cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is a trader who sells hair-do's, creams and drinks. She is also a hairdresser who owns her beauty salon at Akotoyir in Abura. Felicia has received an education through junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver.

Felicia has been working as a trader for six years. She is responsible for paying for the feeding and clothing needs of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase additional, and more variety of, hairdressing creams and materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to start saving at a bank.

loans.use: To purchase additional, and more variety of, hair dressing creams and materials

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru: Орифа женщина 48 лет , бизнесмен ка, которая торгует нитками для шитья, носками, различными мелкими товарами.Она кредитуется в Микроинвест с 2003 года.Пунктуально погашает свои очередные кредиты.Её муж на заработках в России.Следующий займ она хочет использовать для закупа товара с оптового рынка Истсравшана.Орифа благодарна всем инвесторам за предоставившую ей возможность, увеличить свой бизнес при помощи кредитов.
texts.en:
Orifa is a forty-eight years old business woman. She sells sewing threads, socks, and other small goods. Orifa has been a Microinvest customer since 2003, and she has always been prompt with paying off her loans. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. This loan Orifa will use for wholesale purchase of her retail inventory. Orifa is grateful to all of you for helping her to sustain and grow her business!

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. is 61 years old and married with five children. She has a poultry farm where she rears birds and she also sells palm oil. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: Комил клиент в Микроинвест, который кредитуется с 2004 года на расширение своего бизнеса.Он торгует на рыке Худжанда мелким товаром, тапочками, носками, нижним бельём и.т.д.За период кредитования у Комила улучшилось семейное положение и увеличился товарный оборот.За товаром он ездит сам.Следующий кредит хочет использовать для завоза дополнительного товара.
texts.en:
Komil is a MicroInvest client who has been borrowing since 2004 to grow his business. He sells small products (slippers, socks, underwear, etc.) at the Khujand market. During his borrowing period, Komil has improved his family living conditions and grew his turnover. He travels to purchase his products himself. He would like to use his next loan to purchase additional products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for resale

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke A. is 30 years old and married with two children. She has a store where she sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар молодой мужчина 30 лет. Женат и имеет 2-х детей. У него среднее образование. Музаффар занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Музаффар кредитуется 1 год. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Музаффара немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Музаффар планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Muzaffar is a young, 30 year old man. He is married and has 2 children. He has a high school education. Muzaffar fattens and sells livestock, his wife processes and sells milk. Muzaffar has been a borrower for 1 year. When he came to take out a loan for the first time he had a small quantity of livestock. Now Muzaffar’s quantity of small livestock has increased. His wife only has one dairy cow. Muzaffar plans to buy his wife one more cow with a calf and he is grateful to our creditor for their help in bringing his plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow and calf

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en: Iulia has worked in agriculture for almost eight years, growing maize. She has an area of 10 hectares of land and wants to increase her maize crop in the spring. For this she needs fertilizers, fuel for land processing and seed for cultivation. Iulia requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 lei to obtain all these necessary items. Iulia makes flour from grain and after this she sells it to people from the village.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Вохидов Абдугафор мужчина, который занимается бизнесом продажи материалов для пошива национальных платьев.Ему по бизнесу помогает его жена , которая снята во время мониторинга.Сам Абдугафор был в отъезде за товаром.Он хочет получив кредит закупить ассортимент весеннего сезона материй.У него очень разнообразный ассортимент материй.У Абдугафора много постоянных клиентов, которые покупают материи и шьют платья на продажу.Абдугафор благодарен за поддержку и понимание инвесторов KIVA.
texts.en:
Abdugafor V. is a man who sells fabrics for traditional dresses. His wife helps him in his business (she is in the photo taken during monitoring). Abdugafor himself was traveling to purchase products. He would like to use the loan to purchase an assortment of spring season fabrics. He has a wide selection of fabrics. Abdugafor has a lot of regular customers who purchase fabrics and sew dresses for sale. Abdugafor is grateful for the support and understanding of KIVA investors.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina C. is married and has two children. She has received an education through primary school. Sabina is a trader and teacher; she sells material and clothes at Abura, which she has done since 2003. While Sabina is employed as a trader, her husband works as a nurse. Sabina uses her income to support her family by providing housekeeping money.

Sabina will use the loan to purchase silver sets, material and clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabina plans to save for school fees.

loans.use: To purchase silver sets, material and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ergashoy

texts.ru: Эргашой - женщина 56 лет. Замужем и имеет 6-х детей. Они с мужем занимается производством и продажей детских колыбелек. Её муж мастерит колыбельки и поставляет их на рынок а Эргашой сидит на рынке и продаёт колыбельки. Их бизнес очень выгодный и сезонность круглый год. Её муж закупает сырье и мастерит колыбельки дома. Но у него мало денежных средств чтобы закупить достаточное количество сырья. Поэтому Эргашой хочет взять кредит и с мужем закупить нужное сырьё.
texts.en:
Ergashoy is a 56 year old woman. She is married and has 6 children. Together with her husband she manufactures and sells baby cribs. Her husband builds the cribs and transports them to the market where Ergashoy sits and sells the cribs. Their business is very profitable and is in season all year round. Her husband purchases the raw materials and builds the cribs at home, but he does not have enough financial resources to purchase an adequate quantity of raw materials. This is why Ergashoy would like to take out a loan and to purchase raw materials with her husband.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Зокирова Мунавар – женщина, которая при помощи кредитов уже третий год поддерживает свой бизнес по продаже продуктов питания. Она торгует на рынке города Костакоза. Её торговля  всегда кипит, т.к. продукты питания всегда имеют спрос населения. За товаром Мунавар ездит сама, в город Худжанд с оптового рынка. Мунавар хочет на получивший займ закупить ещё дополнительный ассортимент товара( чай, кофе, шоколадные конфеты, карамель) пополнить пустые полки.
texts.en:
Munavar Z. is a woman who has been using loans for three years now to support her business where she sells food products. She sells at the market in Kostakoz. Her sales are always brisk as her products are always in demand among the population. Munavar travels for her products herself to the Khujand wholesale market. Munavar would like to use her loan to purchase more products for her selection (tea, coffee, chocolate candy, caramels) to fill her empty shelves.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 65 years old and married with three children. She has a store where she sells medicines, provisions and drinks. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicines to sell

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon A. is 50 years old and married with five children. Solomon has a cool room where he sells ice and fish. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more fish to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Bikenja

texts.ru: Бисолеха женщина 31 года, имеет двоих детей,  занимается завозом и продажей мужской одежды. Торгует она на рынке «Сомон», проживает в городе Костакоз. За товаром ездит сама, иногда её муж. Двое детей ходят в среднюю школу. Её муж работает мастером по отделке домов. Его заработная плата еле хватает на проживание семьи. Поэтому Бисолеха помогает ему доходами своего бизнеса. Она кредитуется в Микроинвест уже второй год. И с помощью займов увеличивает товарооборот и повышает уровень жизни семьи, за что искренне благодарна.
texts.en:
Bikenja is a 31 year old woman, she has two children and brings and sells men’s clothing. She sells at the “Somon” market and lives in Kostakoz. She travels to purchase products herself and sometimes her husband travels. Her two children attend school. Her husband finishes houses. His salary is barely enough for family survival. This is why Bikenja helps him with the earnings from her business. This is her second year as a MicroInvest borrower. With the help of loans she increases her turnover and improves her family’s standard of living for which she is sincerely grateful.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Men's clothing

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana has a small booth at the market in the town of Cahul, the space for which she just recently purchased at a relatively high cost. She has begun selling clothes for children which she receives from Turkey. Diana works with her daughter at her booth, holding up different clothes and estimating dimensions as customers assess the different options.

She would like to expand the stock of goods which she offers to her buyers. Customers have confidence in Diana as she always gets high-quality clothes.

loans.use: To expand the stock of goods which she offers to her buyers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Mary is a trader who sells corn, groundnuts and millet at Akotokyir in Abura, which she has done since 1992. Her husband works as a sanitation officer.

Mary uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses. She will use the loan to purchase additional bags of millet, corn and groundnut paste for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a house and expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of millet, corn and groundnut paste for resale

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Alima is a trader who sells corn, groundnuts, onions and beans in Abura, which she has done since 2002. Her husband works in the hospital as a ward assistant.

Alima uses her income as housekeeping money and when there is any other need. She will use the loan to purchase bags of groundnuts, corn, and beans for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alima plans to reinvest and further expand her enterprise.

She was out of stock at the time this picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase bags of groundnuts, corn, and beans for resale

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en: Leonid is 37 years old and he is a farmer. He has land with an area of 15 hectares. He has worked on this land since 1999. He has no agricultural technique. The manual work he does with his wife, and for the weeding and harvesting he pays workers. He works with growing vines. He has planted 1 hectare of Moldovan sort vine. Last year he had difficulties in selling grapes, because of low prices on the market and he also received the money with delay. He grows wheat and corn for household needs and the surplus he sells to dealers of wheat. This loan was used to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and to pay for services in agriculture.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita B. is 49 and married to Danilo, a laborer. They have only one son who is a second-year student. She is a new member of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner. She took her first loan cycle last March 25, amounting to PHP 7,000, for additional capitalization of her store and to support the income of her husband. She said that she has to manage it well so that she can repay her loan on time and that she wanted to acquire a record of being a member in good standing.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
At 49 years old, Mrs Pacita L. is married to Alfredo and they are blessed with seven children. They are presently residing in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is labeled as a member in good standing at Paglaum, a Kiva partner, because she has no record of default and never misses coming to center meetings.

The couple are both scrap buyers. Mrs. Pacita sought PHP 15,000 for additional capital for her business. She dreams to own a motorcycle someday. She wants to have a concrete house and to finish the studies of her children and have a stable job someday.

loans.use: To buy scrap and junk materials

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rovelyn A. is 34 years old and married to Jojico A., a private driver. They have three children, who are all in school. She is a new member of Kiva's partner Paglaum MPC under the micro-finance program. She applied for the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store -- a mini grocery store were you can buy assorted goods -- and now she has moderate stocks of groceries.

She has also a small fishing boat for their food consumption. She hopes to improve her business and avail herself of higher amounts of loans for the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for  her store

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada tiene 38 años. Ella esta casada con el Sr. Hilario Cantero, quien es de 46 años. El señor es técnico agropecuario y está trabajando  en el Chaco. Ellos tienen 2 hijas que están estudiando en el colegio.

Ada vivía en el Chaco siendo solamente ama de casa, pero sus hijas querían estudiar por lo que decidieron mudarse a la ciudad de Luque. La señora estudió corte y confección pensando en montar para su taller en su domicilio en el año 1989.

Actualmente cuenta con un pequeño taller de confección y su sueño es que algún día pueda ampliar su taller. Gracias al crédito actual pudo comprar telas y otros accesorios para la confección de ropas.
texts.en:
Ada is 38 years old. She is married to Hilario Cantero, who is 46. He is an agricultural technician and is working in the Chaco. They have two daughters who are in high school. Ada was living in the Chaco as a housewife, but when their daughters wanted to study she decided to move with them to the city of Luque. Ada studied dressmaking with the idea of setting up her own shop at home in 1989. She currently has a small dressmaking studio and her dream is to be able to grow her business one day. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase fabrics and other accessories for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, needles, buttons

loans.name: Faveur Plus Group

texts.fr: Liliane L. habite dans une partie montagneuse à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa capitale de la RDC. C’est là où elle exerce ses activités commerciales.  Elle a commencé le commerce en 1983 quand elle était encore élève. Elle vendait chaque fois pendant les grandes vacances aux mois de juillet et août. Son capital initial était de $60 qui lui avaient permis d’acheter 1 sac de farine de manioc. Au fil des ans, Liliane a acquit une expérience solide pour la vente de la farine jusqu’à son mariage en 1989. Liliane a continué ses activités commerciales dans son foyer qui lui ont apporté un capital de $ 240 en 1993. Ses activités furent detruites par les pillages qui eurent lieu la même année. Après une période d’inactivité, elle relança son affaire de 2002 jusqu’à ce jour avec un capital de $60 toujours dans le secteur alimentaire. En août 2008, Liliane décide d’intégrer un des groupes de l’IMF Hope dans le but de diversifier son affaire en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Elle est une cliente fidèle de Hope qui a déjà reçu 2 crédits qu’elle a régulièrement et totalement remboursé. Le prêt qu’elle a obtenu ce mois d’avril lui a servi d’acheter 2 sacs de farine de manioc, elle a aussi diversifié son activité en y ajoutant des poissons fumés et salés à revendre afin d’augmenter le bénéfice. Liliane a 41 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants âgées de 5 à 19 ans dont l’ainé est indépendant et quatre vont à l’école. Son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $ 15 par semaine et son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour un dépôt de farine de manioc et de maïs.
texts.en:
Liliane L. lives in a mountainous area west of the city of Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. That’s where she does business, which she started in 1983 when she was still a student. She used to sell during all the main vacation periods in July and August. Her $60 in initial capital had enabled her to buy a sack of cassava flour.

Over the years, she acquired solid experience in selling cassava flour until she was married in1989. She continued her commerce in her home, bringing $240 in capital in 1993. Her business was destroyed by pillaging that took place the same year. After a period of inactivity, she started up her business again from 2002 through the present with $60 in capital and in the food sector, still.

In August 2008, Liliane decided to join one of the groups of the micro-finance institution HOPE with the goal of diversifying her business and growing her revenues. She is a loyal customer of HOPE who has already had two loans that she repaid regularly and completely. The loan she obtained this April was used to buy two sacks of cassava flour. She also diversified her business by including smoked and salted fish for resale, so as to augment her profits.

Liliane is 41 years old, married, and the mother of five children, ages 5 to 19; the eldest is on his own, and four go to school. Her business generates for her a profit of $15 a week. Her ambition is to open an outlet one day for cassava flour and for corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of flour and to diversify her business by buying smoked and salted fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. is 46 years old and married with three children. She sells clothes and shoes. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob O. is 55 years old and married with five children. He has a sawmill where he sells wood planks. He is requesting a loan of $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more planks to sell. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood planks to sell.

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
El señor Atilano está casado con la señora Silvia Noguera con quien tiene 5 hijos, Gloria de 33 años, María de 32 años, Norma de 30 años, Juan de 23 años y Marcelo de 20 años.

Cuando Atilano tenia 18 años de edad su madre le pidió para que le repare su radio, entonces don Atilano se puso a experimentar por la citada radio, hasta que pudo solucionar el desperfecto. Fue así que decidió estudiar electrónica que le llevo 3 años de estudio, al terminar el mismo decidió abrir su propio local dedicado a la reparación de televisores y radios.

Desde entonces tiene una buena cantidad de cliente ya que se lo conoce por su buen trabajo.
En un futuro próximo Atilano quiere seguir ampliando su clientela y continuar perfeccionandose con sus 60 años.
texts.en:
Atilano is married to Silvia Noguera and they have 5 children: Gloria, age 33, María, 32, Norma, 30, Juan, 23, and Marcelo, 20. When Atilano was 18 years old, his mother asked him to repair her radio. Atilano began working on the radio, until he was able to fix it. It was then that he decided to study electronics. He spent 3 years studying and when he finished, he decided to open his own TV and radio repair shop. He has a large clientele and is known for his good quality work. In the near future, Atilano wants to continue growing his customer base and improving himself, even at the age of 60.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for televisions and radios

loans.name: Fasilat

texts.en: Fasilat is 40 years old and married with five children. She has a shop where she sells medicines and provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam M. is 55 years old and married with four children. She has a shop where she sells drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca posee 41 años y esta casda con el sr. Vicente de 47 años.  Ellos tienen 3 hijos todos mayores de edad que trabajan en el negocio.

La señora siempre trabajo en ventas. Con mucho esfuerzo lograron abrir un local que actulamente cuenta con mas de 20 empleados y una buena cantidad de cleintes.

Le gustaria para el futuro qu sus hijos estudien y que tengan sus propios negocios. Ademas le gustaria contar con local propio para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca is 41 years old and married to Vicente, age 47. They have 3 adult children who work in their business. Blanca has always worked in sales. With great effort they were able to open a shop that currently has over 20 employees and a large number of customers. In the future they would like for their children to go to school and have their own businesses. They would also like to own their own shop to meet their customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sunglasses, CDs, radios, chargers, batteries, DVDs

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia G. sells brewed alcohol on a wholesale basis at home and requests a loan of 800SDG to facilitate her business by buying utensils for brewing the local alcohol. She is married to a policeman who works at the police headquarters in Juba town. Cicilia has two boys and three girls who all attend school.

In the future, Cicilia intends to pay school fees for kids in order for them to continue with further studies to enhance their future.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy brewing materials

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar se dedicaba anteriormente a ayudarle a su padre en la chacra en el interior del país. Hasta que hace aproximadamente 6 años se decidió venir con sus tíos a la zona central y dedicarse a la macateria. Comenzó siendo ayudante de unos de sus tíos, o sea su labor era subir y bajar las mercaderías que comercializaban. Hace 1 año y medio con la ayuda de sus tíos Edgar decidió comprar para su propia camioneta y comercializar sus productos.

El crédito que retiro de la Fundación Paraguaya fue para la compra de mercaderías.

Más adelante Edgar tiene pensado cambiar su camioneta por otra más nueva.
texts.en:
Edgar used to help his father on a farm in the middle of the country. Around 6 years ago he decided to move with his uncles to the central zone and work as a traveling salesperson. He started off helping one of his uncles, loading and offloading the merchandise that they sold. A year and a half ago, with the help of his uncles, Edgar decided to buy his own truck and sell his own products. The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Paraguaya is for the purchase of merchandise. In the future, Edgar plans to trade in his truck for a newer model.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, tomatoes, garlic, apples, pasta and fruit

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia M., from the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines, is 45 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a private driver.

She has been a bona fide member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) micro-finance program since November 2005 and has maintained excellent loan repayment performance. She is requesting a loan of $225 (10,000 PHP) to purchase additional stock for her “Sari-sari” store, in order to support and retain her neighborhood customers.

She is planning ahead so that her children can finish college and have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Jerard

texts.en:
Jerard C. is 34 years old and a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and has two children. He is very industrious and in high spirits managing the said business while his wife helps out in their household.

He has been a member of Paglaum MPC, Kiva's partner, since September 2007. He availed himself of credit for additional capital for copra (the dried meat of a coconut) buying. His heart’s aspiration is to provide a good education for his children, to have a good future, and to live life to the fullest.

loans.use: Additional capital for copra (dried coconut meat) buying

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose H. currently sells mangoes at the market. She is married to a teacher who has taught Juba day secondary school for almost five years. Rose has three children (two boys and a girl) who all attend school at Austra-Tuna basic primary school.  She requested this loan to buy more fruit to sell.  In the future, she wants to build a rental house.


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy different types of fruits to sell

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Mrs. Estrelita C. is forty-two years old, married and presently living at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. Determination and hard work are what the couple believes in. She joined the Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, in November of 2006, knowing they believe in offering true service and assistance to needy people like her. Abject poverty is inevitable if they don't work hard. Estrelita is motivated to raise hogs in addition to taking care of the household. She asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC in order to purchase pig feed. The couple’s aspiration is to have a fenced area for the pigs, and hope that someday they can send their children to college to earn a degree.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo A. tiene 32 años de edad, el es casado tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, vive en el Milagro de la capital  de Guatemala tiene un año y dos meses de tener su negocio de venta de ropa de caballero a parte de su negocio el trabaja como vendedor de una empresa de ropa  pero el  y su familia necesitan estar mejor económicamente por eso decidieron tener un negocio el cual les generara unos ingresos extras.
Su crédito lo necesita para comprar mas ropa y surtir su negocio para que la gente entre y encuentre lo que esta buscando su deseo es que su negocio prospere y su familia también.
texts.en:
Pablo A. is 32 years old, married, and has a 2 year old daughter. He lives in the Milagro neighborhood of the capital of Guatemala. For a year and 2 months he has had his own business selling men's clothing. He also works in sales for a business that sells clothing. However, he and his family needed to improve their economic situation, so they decided to open a business that could generate some extra income. He needs this loan to purchase more clothes and expand his offerings, so that people come into his shop and find what they are looking for, and so that his business and family prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Tuwisana Plus Group

texts.fr: Marthe M. fabrique et livre aux clients des shikwangues (a kind of bread made of cassava flour) qui sont un aliment principal des congolais habitant à Kinshasa. Elle a commencé son commerce en 1998 en s’associant à une femme qui les fabriquait. Elle les vendait en gagnant des commissions. En octobre 1998, Marthe apprit à les fabriquer, acheta 1 sac de manioc avec l’argent gagné des commissions accumulées et commença à developper son propre commerce. L’activité évolua bien de 1999 jusqu’en 2006 quand elle connut le divorce avec son mari. Avec un capital de $320, Marthe décida de travailler avec détermination et une bonne gestion pour réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une boucherie des chèvres. Avec le crédit obtenu ce mois d’avril, elle a diversifié son activité en achetant 1 carton des cuisses d’oiseaux et 1 carton de viande de dindon à revendre afin d’accroître le revenu de son affaire qui lui génère présentement $60 de bénéfice par semaine. Son capital actuel est de $235. Marthe a 38 ans, divorcée et mère de 9 enfants âgés de 4 à 22 ans dont 5 vivent avec elle et trois vont à école.
texts.en:
Marthe M. makes and delivers to her customers shikwangues (a kind of bread made of cassava flour). It is a principal food for the Congolese in Kinshasa. She started in this business in 1998 while including a woman who used to make it. In October 1998, Marthe learned to make it. She bought a sack of cassava with the money earned from accumulated commissions and started developing her own business. This business improved nicely in 1999 through 2006, when she got divorced. With $320 in capital, Marthe decided to work with determination and good managing in order to realize her dream of opening one day a butcher shop for goats. With the loan she obtained in this month of April, she diversified her business by buying a box of bird thighs and one box of turkey meat to be resold, so as to grow her revenues from her business, which presently generates $60 of profit per week. Her current capital amounts to $235. Marthe is 38 years old, divorced, and the mother of nine children, ages 4 to 22. Five of them live with her, and three attend school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a box of bird thighs and a box of turkey meat to sell for growing her revenues

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sikirat

texts.en: Sikirat Y. is fifty-six years old and married with five children. She has a shop where she sells baking supplies like flour, sugar, and baking powder. She is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more baking supplies to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to sell

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe A. is thirty-five years old and married with five children. Dupe sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nidia Chávez tiene 37 años de edad y esta casada con Don Cristino Espinola de 40 años, con quien posee 2 (dos) hijos, éstos en edad escolar. Su conyuge es funcionario de la Dirección Nacional de Aviación Civil, como bombero, con una antigüedad de 14 (catorce) años.

Hace aproximadamente dos años que la situación económica del País se deterioró en demasía, fue entonces que Nidia decidió apoyar a su esposo y montar su Micro-empresa de elaboración de comestibles para la venta. El proyecto se inició cuando una ensambladora de motocicletas se instaló a metros de su domicilio y la demanda de alimentos para el consumo final rebasaba la oferta existente en la zona. 

El objetivo de este crédito es aprovechar la oferta de una propiedad colindante a su vivienda para ampliar si microempresa.
texts.en:
Nidia Chávez is 37 years old and is married to Cristino Espinola who is 40. They have two school-aged children. Her husband works for the National Civil Aviation Administration as a firefighter, where he has worked for 14 years. About two years ago the ecnomic situation in the country deteriorated too much, and Nidia decided to help out her husband by opening her own small business preparing food for sale. The business started when a motorcycle assembly shop opened a few meters form her home and the demand for prepared food exceeded the available supply in the area. The purpose of this loan is to purchase a property adjacent to her home to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of property to set up her business outside of her home

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Wilma Dávalos de 36 años de edad. Ella vive con Don Lider Cañete de 36 años, con éste tiene dos dos hijos, ambos adolescentes, en edad escolar.

Tiene mas de veinte años de experiencia en el rubro de vender frutas. En base a esos conocimientos, la venta informal tiene una competencia salvaje en estos tiempos de crisis. Por esa razon, ahora, arrienda dos locales (mesas) en el mercado de abasto de la capital, donde comparte el trabajo con su conyuge; la actividad no cesa aun en su domicilio, pues ahi es donde fraccionan y envasan su productos para la venta del día siguiente. 

El objetivo de este crédito es adquirir otro espacio físico mas en el mercado de abasto, para mejorar su venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wilma Dávalos is 36 years old and lives with her husband, Don Lider Cañete (also 36) and their two adolescent children who attend school. She has more than 20 years experience in the fruit selling business. Competition is fierce during these tough economic times, which is why she now has two tables where she sells fruit at the city market in the capitol, where she shares the work with her husband. The business activity continues at home where they separate and package their products for sale the next day. The target of the loan is to acquire a third location in the city market to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, legumes, vegetables and a space from which to sell at the city market.

loans.name: Akeem

texts.en: Akeem is thirty-five years old and married with three children. He sells sarongs of various colors to his customers. He is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Akakpo Jean

texts.fr: Ce monsieur vit avec sa femme et ses quatres enfants dans le quartier d’agoè qui est un quartier au nord de la ville de lomé. L’activité qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est la vente de cartes de recharge. Ce commerce marche bien à Lomé, il vend les cartes de recharges TOGOCEL et MOOV en gros et en  détail. Il veut augmenter son stock de cartes pour augmenter ses recettes. Il s’adresse donc à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit afin d’acheter 03 paquets de cartes TOGOCEL et 04 paquets de cartes MOOV.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives with his wife and four children in Agoè, a district in the north of the city of Lomé. Selling mobile phone recharge cards is the business he’s in. It enables him to provide for his family and is doing well in Lomé. He sells TOGOCEL and MOOV phone cards wholesale and retail. He wants to increase his stock of phone cards to increase his receipts. So he is inquiring with WAGES to obtain a loan, so as to buy three packets of TOGOCEL cards, and four packets of MOOV cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phone cards

loans.name: Sidikat

texts.en: Sidikat, 55 years old and married with four children, has a store where she sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase additional foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”, cuenta con 14 miembros, entre varones y mujeres, este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco, en una D. las oficinas centrales D. la organización Arariwa, en el distrito D. Huanchac.

Los socios D. este banco, se dedican a diferentes actividades, resaltando en un número mayor el D. las jóvenes mujeres que desean el préstamo para cubrir sus estudios superiores, otro porcentaje, lo requiere para poder implementar sus negocios, tales como restaurante y tiendas D. abarrotes, y préstamos personales.

Los socios del banco SEÑOR D. HUANCA, valoran el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a pagar el total D. la deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
The village bank “SEÑOR D. HUANCA" has 14 members, both men and women. The bank is located in the city of Cusco, in one of the central offices of the organization Arariwa, in the Huanchac district. The partners of the bank engage in different activities, highlighted by a large number of young women who want a loan to cover expenses for higher education. The other percentage require a loan to be able to implement their businesses, from restaurants to grocery stores, also personal loans. The partners of bank SEÑOR D. HUANCA value the loan, and agree to pay the total debt in the time scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for studies, to implement businesses.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth J., from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, 35 years old and married to Danilo J., a carpenter, is blessed with three children. Ruth is a hardworking mother who supports her husband's income through her business as both a firewood and  fish vendor. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 for additional capitalization of her business and for the connection of electricity to their house.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for her business.

location.town: Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occidental

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité El Rincon de las Amigas se dio mediante la formación del comité La Familia del barrio San Salvador el cual se encontraba en su segunda reunión de formación y la cantidad de integrantes superó el maximo permitido por lo que se formo dos comités. Actualmente el comité está  conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa. 

La señora Blanca F. se dedica a la venta de carbón e invirtio el dinero en la compra de carbón al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio .

La señora Sara Díaz se dedica a la venta de bijouterie e invirtio el dinero en la compra de mas mercaderias para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Laura L. se dedica a la venta de frutas e invirtio el dinero en la compra de variedades de frutas para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Viviana M. se dedica a la venta de bijouterie e invirtio el dinero en la compra de mas mercaderias para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Yeni Justina V. se dedica a la venta de pañales e invirtio el dinero en la compra de pañales al por mayor para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Hilaria Ramona A. tiene un copetin e invirtio el dinero en la compra de bebidas e insumos para la elaboracion de los comestibles.

La señora Rosa A. se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata y ropa e invirtio el dinero en la compra de mas mercaderias de plata y variedades en ropa para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora María Rossana L. se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumos para la     elaboracion de comestible.

La señora Rocio V. se dedica a la venta de bijouterie e invirtio el dinero en la compra de mas mercaderias para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Ana María E. se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de comestible.
 
La señora Digna Díaz se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de comestible.

La señora Laura Villaba se dedica a la venta de carnes e invirtio su dinero en la compra de carnes al por mayor para el incremento de sus negocio.

La señora Irene O. tiene una despensa e invirtio el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para surtir su negocio.

La señora Francisca F. es modista y tiene un taller de costura en su casa e invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumos para su taller.

La señora Enriqueta C. se dedica a la venta de juguetes e  invirtio el dinero en la compra mercaderias para la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
The collective “El Rincón de las Amigas” was formed through the “La Familia” collective in the San Salvador neighborhood whose numbers had swelled to such an extent that it surpassed the allowable number of members, thereby splitting into two groups. “El Rincón” is made up of 15 members and is in its fourth cycle with Fundación Paraguaya. The members have invested their portions of the loan as follows:

Blanca F. sells coal and bought coal wholesale to build her business;

Sara Díaz, Viviana M., and Rocio V. each sells costume jewelry and purchased merchandise to increase sales;

Laura L. sells fruit and used the money to buy various types for her sales;

Yeni Justina V. sells diapers and bought more at wholesale;

Hilaria Ramona A. has a small bar/coffee shop and she invested in drinks and foodstuffs to prepare food for sale;

Rosa Almirón sells silver jewelry and clothing so she invested in merchandise to supply these items;

María Rossana L., Ana María E., and Digna Díaz each sells food and invested in supplies for food preparation; Laura Villaba sells meats and purchased meat wholesale for her business;

Irene O. has a sundries store and bought various merchandise to fill her shelves;

Francisca F. is a seamstress in her own shop and she invested in supplies for the shop;

Enriqueta C. has a toyshop and she invested in toy merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as (but not limited to) coal, fruits, jewelry, diapers, drinks, meats, vegetables, oil, napkins, clothing, foodstuffs, thread/fabric)

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida C., a 54-year-old widow with two married children, is a pioneering and very good member of Paglaum MPC under its micro finance program, and has the title of MIGS or ‘member in good standing.’  This very hard-working mother, who has a gardening and  sari-sari store business, is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 for fertilizers, seedlings and some chemicals for her garden. She is thankful to Paglaum for the assistance and trust given to her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings for her gardenning.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia vive en el barrio de San jerónimo ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, ella se acaba de mudar.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la docencia, ella es docente de primaria y es soltera tiene 32 años de edad, y solicita el préstamo para terminar los acabados de la construcción de su casa.

La socia valora y agradece el esfuerzo realizado, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Our member lives in the San Jerónimo neighborhood, 40 minutes from the city of Cusco where she just moved. She balances her activities between her household and teaching primary school. She is single and is 32 years old. The loan she is requesting is to finish renovation construction on her home. She appreciates and is grateful for the effort put forth to date and she has committed herself to pay her loan in the required time.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish renovation construction on her home.

loans.name: Am-Maya

texts.fr: Madame K. habite le quartier d’Agoè kagomé à Lomé, elle est mariée et a 01 enfants qui fait l’école primaire. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce son commerce en face du marché d’Adétikopé. Son stock actuel est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 5 bidons d’huile, 6 sacs  de savons et 8 cartons de spaghettis.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. lives in the Agoè Kagomé neighborhood in Lomé; she is married and has one child who is in primary school. She sells groceries to earn a living. Her place of business is opposite the market of Adétikopé. Her present inventory is used up, so she wants to replenish her stock and is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 10 sacks of rice, 5 jerrycans of oil, 6 sacks of bars of soap, and 8 cases of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita C. is 50 years old, married and blessed with six children. She is presently residing at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her business is charcoal vending. She buys coconut shells to produce charcoal, which she delivers to Oroquieta City every week during market day.

She borrowed PHP 7,000 for the labor cost and for the coconuts. She is also supported with her three children who are working already.

loans.use: To buy coconut shells for charcoal and for payment of labor

location.town: Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la Sra. BERTHA, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, vive en el barrio de ttio 2-13 en el distrito de huanchac.

La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de (28, 24) años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar, con el comercio, ella es dueña de un stand ubicado en el centro comercial el molino II, ella solicita el préstamo para poder implementar su mercadería y mejorar su local.

Ella esta muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Our partner is Mrs. BERTHA, she is a native of Cusco, she lives in the neighborhood ttio 2-13 in the huanchac district. She is 51 years old, is married with 2 children (28, 24) years old. She alternates her home and commercial activities, she owns a stand located in the Mill II commercial center. She requests a loan to be able to implement her merchandise and improve her location. She is very grateful and appreciates the loan granted through this method, and agrees to comply with the full debt payment in the time scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement and improve her stand in the commercial center.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Mrs. Melita B. is 51 years old and married to Adelfo, a private employee. They are blessed with three children. Melita is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC under the micro-finance program in Coastal View Center. She already has completed more than 10 loan cycles and is a good leader in the cluster.

Her business is garment- and dress-making, which helps them especially to meet the financial needs of their children in school and in the family. She borrowed the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase more cloth for so she can make more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy bundles of cloth for dress-making

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia M. has enjoyed more than a year of association with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, a partner through thick and thin for her business. Her primary source of income is selling vegetables. It’s a daily challenge for her to meet her loan payments on time but this has now become a habit for Letecia, who is 50 years old and married with five children.

She tells us with pride that she is able to nurture all her children well. She’s happy that she was able to send her children to school. She has applied with Kiva's partner Paglaum MPC for a loan of PHP 14,900. With this loan she will purchase additional vegetables. She wants to expand to own a stall in the public market to increase the number of her customers.

loans.use: To buy additonal vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rodrigo Cristino

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el joven Rodrigo P. se dedica a su negocio de transporte por medio de su triciclo llevando a los clientes de un lugar a otro y cobrando de acuerdo a la distancia recorrida.

El problema que hoy en día el joven P. atraviesa es que el triciclo requiere de reparación y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los repuestos y así continuar con su negocio de transporte.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Rodrigo P. operates a transportation business. On his cycle rickshaw, he brings clients from one place to another, charging according to the distance traveled. The young P.'s present problem is that his cycle needs repair. For this reason, he has turned to Ceprodel to obtain credit to purchase the replacement parts and continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cycle rickshaw

loans.name: Aralama

texts.fr: Aralama T. est une femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est propriétaire d’une boutique dans laquelle elle étale des tissus. Ce commerce est très prometteur à cause de la forte demande. Aralama souhaite avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV alimenter sa boutique afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Aralama T., 45, is married and the mother of 5 children. She owns a shop where she displays fabrics for sale. This business is very promising because of the high demand. Aralama hopes to use this first loan from FECECAV to stock her shop so as to better respond to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabric for re-sale

loans.name: N'maga

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce dans la restauration, sa spécialité est le plat de riz accompagné avec du haricot. Ces clients apprécient beaucoup son plat et elle est très connue, elle fait son activité à proximité d’une école primaire et en récréation les élèves viennent manger chez elle. Les produits de première nécessité qu’elle utilise dans son activité de restauration sont épuisés, elle demande donc à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de riz, 03 sacs d’haricots, 01 sacs de charbon de bois et 1 bidon d’huile et divers produits. Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants. Son mari est un instituteur.
texts.en:
This lady sells cooked food, her specialty being a rice dish served with beans. Her customers like her dish very much and she is well-known. She sells her food near a primary school and during recess, the children come to eat at her booth. Her supply of the staple goods she uses to prepare her food is used up, so she is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy 3 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of dried beans, 1 sack of charcoal, and 1 jerrycan of oil, as well as various items. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a primary school teacher.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sack of rice and of dried beans, jerrycans of oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Las Risueñas Group

texts.es:
El inicio del presente comité fue la señora Marta E.,  quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La sra. Marta E. se dedica a la venta de Plateria, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias en generalpara de esa manbera ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes

La sra. Carmen E.  se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esos productos al por mayor obteniendo asi mayor ganacia y variedad.

La sra. Mercedes E. Macen se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboracion de los comestibles ofreciendo de eso manera mayor calidad a su clientela.

La sra. Ramona E. se dedica a la venta de Prendas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias pudiendo ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La sra. Zully E. se dedica a la ventra de articulos de cosmetologia, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esos productos logrando ofrecer mayo variedad a sus clientes.

La sra. Estelvina A. se dedica a la venta de bebidas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de bebidas en general ofrecie ofreciendo mas variedad a su clientela.

La sra. Patricia O.  se dedica a la venta de prendas,  invirtio el dinero en la compra variada de prendas de vestir  logrando de ese modo captar mayor clientela.
