Clara Báez sells fruit and will spend the money to buy various fruits to sell. Juana Rojas sells fruit and will spend the money to buy various fruits to sell. Maria Elizabeth M. runs a recycling business and will spend the money to buy plastic for subsequent sales. Myrian M. runs a notions store and will spend the money on wholesale merchandise. Francisca R. owns a pantry and will spend the money on merchandise for her business. Gavina U. sells balloons and will spend the money to buy supplies. Maria Alicia F. sells lingerie and will spend the money to buy various wholesale lingerie to sell. Emiliana N. sells lingerie and will spend the money to buy various wholesale lingerie to sell. Palmira G. runs a notions store and will spend the money on wholesale merchandise. Edith L. sells honey and will spend the money on wholesale purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bijouterie, sweets, wheat, rice, noodles, sugar, breads, yerba, milk, meats, shirts, shorts, pants, plastics, fruits, medicinal herbs, knick-knacks, balloons, gas, lingerie, among others.

loans.name: Tereza De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Tereza tiene 48 años de edad, nació en una pequeña comunidad de San Juan Rió Coco, casada, su esposo es conductor y en tiempo libre es albañil, actualmente reside en Managua en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa. La señora Tereza trabaja como docente en un colegio público en el cual tiene cuatro años de experiencia laboral, su trabajo lo empezó como docente comunitaria en San Juan de Rió Coco, cuenta con 17 años de experiencia,  acomunada como docente, ella imparte clases privada en sus tiempo libres, en su matrimonio procreo tres hijos, una 16 años, y un par de gemelos de 13 años, sus meta para su familia es terminar de construir su casa y heredar un buen patrimonio a sus hijos. Su visión es poder seguir transmitiendo sus conocimientos y desarrollando capacidades intelectuales en alumnos preparándolos para un futuro mejor en el cual tengan mejores oportunidades y contribuyan con el desarrollo económico. Con ayuda de su marido y su trabajo ha venido construyendo su hogar poco a poco, este es su sexto crédito el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir un  cuarto de habitación y tener mayor espacio y  comodidad en su hogar. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que ha brindado a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Tereza is 48 years old. She was born in the small community of San Juan Rió Coco. She is married; her husband is a conductor and a laborer in his spare time. She lives in the Hialeah IV neighborhood of Managua and has worked for 14 years as a teacher in a public school. She began as a community teacher in San Juan de Rió Coco for 17 years. She teaches private classes in her spare time. She has three children, a 16-year-old daughter and 13-year old twins. Her goal for her family is to finish building her house and leave a good inheritance for her children. Her vision is to be able to continue imparting her knowledge and developing the intellectual capacity of students to prepare them for a better future, in which they will have better opportunities and contribute to economic development. With her husband's help and her own job she has continued building her house little by little. This is her sixth loan which she will use for construction materials to build a living room so that her home will be more spacious and comfortable. She thanks Afodenic for the support they have provided to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room for her home

loans.name: Fuente De Vida - Group 1

texts.en:
Siliana Y. is this group's coordinator and she sells clothing. Usually the best-selling items are women's and children's clothing. Dominican women care very much about their appearance, and children's appearance speaks to others of their mother's care. Siliana tries to keep her clothes inventory as assorted as possible. This loan will help with that. Siliana wants to build on her clothing sales to become a successful boutique--one that generates enough profit for her to purchase a home for herself.

This group of five entrepreneurs has successfully repaid one loan through Esperanza International; therefore, this is their second loan request. This is the first loan they are requesting for funding through Kiva. Their businesses include a beauty salon and two small cafeterias.

Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase clothing items for resale

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana del Carmen M., reside en un barrio de la Capital de Managua que se llama 380, casada, su esposo se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, tiene 62 años de edad, sus hijos son independientes, ella es pensionada pero aun se desempeña como docente de la secundaria desde hace veinte años el cual le ha permitido transmitir sus conocimientos a muchos pequeños para un futuro mejor. Esta solicitud de crédito quiere hacer un porche el cual va a comprar materiales de construcción, sus planes es poder poner una pulpería en su casa. Da las gracias a Afodenic ya que este es su octavo crédito y ha podido sastifacer sus necesidades y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen M. lives in the 380 neighborhood of Managua. She is 62 years old and and married; her husband works as a security guard. Her children are independent. While she is a pensioner, she has also worked as a high school teacher for 20 years, which has allowed her to impart her knowledge to young people and give them a better future. This loan would allow her to buy construction materials for building a porch; she plans to establish a small general store in her house. She thanks Afodenic as this is her eighth loan with them and as a result she has been able to meet both her own needs and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a porch/store

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La Sra. Delfina T. se encuentra separada de su esposo y vive en la casa de su hijo a quien le paga alquiler, se dedica a la venta de frazadas desde hace 20 años y tambien es albañil pintor en una empresa constructora en la cual tiene clientes a quienes reparte su mercadería.
Ella trabajo con grupo solidario estrella en 7  secuencias, individualizándose el año 2008 solicitando crédito con garante personal, la señora es persona responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delfina T. is separated from her husband. She lives in her son’s house, and she pays him rent. She has been selling blankets for 20 years. She also is painter for a construction company. She has customers in the company who distribute her merchandise. She worked with the Solidario Estrella group for 7 loan cycles. She started working on her own in 2008. She is asking for a loan, which she personally guarantees. She is a very responsible person about her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blankets and quilts

loans.name: Milciades Vera

texts.es: El cliente es un conocido mecanico de motos. Trabaja en local propio en una de las principales avenida de San Ignacio. El esta casado con la Sra. Dora Villasanti y tienen 2 hijos menores.  Su conyuge posee una peluqueria. Destinó el préstamo para comprar materiales a ser utilizados en el taller de motos, de esta forma abarata el costo y consigue mayor margen en su actividad.
texts.en:
This client is a well-known motorcycle repairman. He works in his own business space on one of San Ignacio’s main avenues. He is married to Mrs. Dora Villasanti, and they have 2 young children. His wife owns a hair salon. The loan was used to purchase materials that he will use in his motorcycle repair shop so that he can lower costs and boost profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Aquiles Jose

texts.es: El señor Aquiles M., tiene 54 años de edad, habita en el bario Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado ,le tienen tres hijos de 2,17 y 22 años de edad, dos ellos estudian y ayudan a los quehaceres del hogar, el lleva ocho años de experiencia laborales. Con esta solicitud va  comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un cuarto que con el préstamo anterior dejo a la mitad. Este es su noveno ciclo y en lo personal ha podido hacer mejoras a su casa y se siente motivado por el apoyo que tiene de la institución. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener una casa digna y que de seguridad  a su  familia, a si como poder  ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Mr. Aquiles M. is 54-year-old married man who lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He has three children, ages 2, 17 and 22, two of whom study and help with the household chores. He has eight years of work experience. With this loan, he will purchase construction materials so that he can finish building the second half of a room that he started with a previous loan. This is his ninth loan cycle, and he has personally been able to make home improvements. He feels motivated by the support that he is getting from the institute. His future plans are having a decent house that gives his family safety, as well as being able to help his children obtain an education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building one room

loans.name: Fuente De Vida - Group 2

texts.en:
The members of this group of microentrepreneurs are all engaged in retail activities. Most of them have small shops at their own homes where they offer their merchandise. The products they offer are convenience items for homes, personal care products, clothing and jewelry.

The group coordinator is Filonila H.. She sells clothes. She will use this entire loan to buy more clothes to sell to her faithful clients and those new clients her old ones refer to her. Filonila hopes her hard work will pay off and allow her to have a house for herself and her husband. She has no children.

Thank you for helping us to continue to help! We appreciate your support.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items

loans.name: Daisy Antonia

texts.es: La señora Daisy V. M., tiene 43 años de edad, trabaja en la Policía Nacional desde hace seis años, tiene tres hijos de 22, 18 y 25 años de edad, dos están independiente y el menor estudia. Este es el séptimo crédito en Afodenic el cual se ha beneficiado en lo personal para hacer las mejoras  a su casa, con este crédito lo quiere invertir para construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de la casa para reguardar la seguridad de su familia. A futuro espera poder seguir haciendo las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Daisy V. M. is a 43-year-old woman who has been working for the National Police for six years. She has three children ages 25, 22, and 18, two of whom are independent while the youngest one is in school. This is her first loan with Afodenic, and she has been able to make home improvements with her previous loans. She wants to invest this loan in building a wall in front of her house so that she can safeguard her family. In the future, she hopes to continue making the necessary home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build protective wall

loans.name: Laura Aruquipa

texts.es:
El Sr. E. R. Laura, es esposo de una cliente antigua, la Sra. Diana Quispe, quien por motivos de salud, ya no se dedica a la actividad del tejido, por lo que solicitó el crédito su esposo, quien se dedica al manejo de un micro, sindicato Litoral, que adquirieron hace un año; a la vez, se dedica a la recolección de arena en el río Irpavi, es un joven trabajador, tiene un hijo pequeño, viven en casa propia, cerca del río, una adquisición de los trabajadores en arena, no se encuentra aún urbanizada, ya que no cuenta con servicios básicos, solo tienen luz, ocupan un cuarto que hicieron construir con sus ahorros, la familia de él especialmente les apoyan en esa situación.
Para E. R. Laura, es el primer crédito con Emprender, pero por referencias de su mamá, es una persona responsable y piensa pagar puntualmente y continuar sacando créditos con Emprender.
texts.en:
Mr. E. R. Laura is the husband of an old client, Mrs. Diana Quispe. Motivated by health, he is no longer working in the textile business. That is why her husband requested a loan, he is dedicated to managing a micro union, Litoral, that they acquired a year ago. In turn, he is a young worker devoted to collecting sand in the Irpavi river. They have a small son, and they live in their own house near the river. An acquisition of sand workers, it is not yet built up and they don't have basic services, they only have light, and they occupy a room built with their savings. His family especially helps them in this situation. For E. R. Laura, this is his first credit with Emprender, but he was referenced by his mother, a responsible person who he believes makes payments on time and continues to take out loans with Emprender.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Cliente Pedro F. tiene 58 años de edad y el es casado. El es residente en la ciudad de San Ignacio Mnes y tiene domicilio propio.  Pedro es padre de 3 hijos menores. El Sr. Figuerdo es vendedor de medicamentos naturales, con una antigüedad de mas de 18 años en el ramo. El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías para la temporada de otoño-invierno que esta por llegar y la demanda de sus productos aumentan. De esta manera incrementar sus ingresos ya que de este negocio depende el estudio y la salud de su familia
texts.en:
Pedro F. is 58 years old, married, and has three young children. He lives in San Ignacio Mnes in a house that he owns. Pedro sells natural medicines and has been in this business for more than 18 years. He will use this loan to buy merchandise for the upcoming fall-winter quarter so that he can meet the rising demand for his products. The loan will help him increase his income and provide for his family's needs, healthcare and education.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of natural medicines

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Yessenia del Carmen Solórzano, tiene 32 años de edad, desde joven tiene un negocio que administra desde hace doce años, vende llantas y productos ferreteros. Reside en el barrio Laurees Norte en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo le ayuda en el tramo, y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de productos que sastifagan  las necesidades del cliente como: alambre, candados, y otros y a si vender mas, como captar clientes, sus metas a futuro es poder terminar de hacer su casa, acondicionar el tramo en mejores condiciones  así como apoyar  a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
This young woman, Yessenia del Carmen Solórzano is 32 years old and has three young children. Since she was young, and for the last twelve years, she has managed her business selling wheels and metal products. She lives in the Laurees Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. Her husband helps her with the stand. She wants to invest this loan to purchase merchandise that will meet the needs of her customers, such as wire, padlocks, and other things. In this way she will increase sales and attract customers. Her goals for the future are to be able to finish off her house, to fix up her stand and to support her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (metal products)

loans.name: Dionsel

texts.es: El cliente Diosnel es casado y residente en la compañia de San Antonio, ciudad de San Ignacio Mnes.  Vive en domicilio propio y es padre de 1 hijo menor de edad. El Señor se dedica a la distribución de verduras y frutas para despensas, almacenes o personas particulares, con una antigüedad de mas de 5 años en el ramo. El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías y ademas de la reparación de su vehiculo en el cual realiza sus repartos, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
This client, Dionsel, is married and lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of San Ignacio, Misiones Department, Paraguay. He lives in his own house and is the father of one young son. This gentleman is engaged in distributing vegetables and fruits to supermarkets, warehouses and individuals, and he's been in the business for more than five years. The funds from this loan from Fundación Paraguay are for the purchase of merchandise and also for the repair of his vehicle which he uses to make his deliveries. Thus, he will be able to increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Jehova Suple - Groups 1, 2

texts.en:
Marcia P. and Octavia D. L. C. are two representatives of the ten entrepreneurs applying for this Kiva loan. Both Marcia and Octavia have small cafeterias. They sell mostly juices, sandwiches, and fried pastries filled with either meat or cheese. These make great snacks and are cheap, easy-to-take-on-the-go breakfast options as well. This loan will be used to purchase more juices and pastries in order to serve larger clienteles in the morning when both of them have the largest crowds. Marcia and Octavia want to own the houses they live in so they don't have to pay rent in the future and can take more advantage of what their businesses are generating.

All of the group members live in San Pedro D. Macoris, in southeast Dominican Republic. They have successfully repaid five previous loans to Esperanza International, and are working towards consolidating their businesses. These hardworking women have shown great determination in taking their micro businesses to the next level. Please help us to continue supporting them with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase flour, meat and cheese for fried pastries

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La cliente Ruth F. se dedica a la producción y venta de productos de confiteria, además de varios tipos de comidas.  Es muy conocida y lleva varios años en este ramo. Trabaja en local propio en una de las principales avenida de Santa Rosa.  Además su madre la acompañada en las tareas que realiza.  

Destinó el préstamo para comprar mercaderias a ser utilizados en la mayor producción de sus productos, de esta forma abarata el costo y consigue mayor margen en su utilidad.
texts.en:
Ruth F. makes and sells sweets and other kinds of food. She is well known and has worked in this for many years. She works in her own shop on one of the main streets of Santa Rosa. Her mother accompanies her in her work.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to be used in a bigger production of her products. In this way she can reduce costs and attain a better margin.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de repuestos

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
MARGARITA B. VDA. D. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su local ubicado en el Jr. Crnel. Portillo Nº 286 del Distrito D. Calleria; tiene 73 años y tiene  04 hijos profesionales. Ella es V..

Es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 10 años.  Ella se dedica al alquiler D. habitaciones, su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo empleo para algunos arreglos D. 2 habitaciones, aunque el préstamo fue pequeño pero la ayudo bastante, ya que D. lo contrario no seguiría en el negocio
Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa  comprar calaminas para la reparación del techo D. una D. las habitaciones que alquila ya que se encuentran muy deterioradas.

La ONG Manuela Ramos me ha apoyado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome - comentó.
texts.en:
Margarita B. Vda D. T. is a member of the Mujeres Talentosas Communal Bank, located at 286 Crnel. Jr., in Calleria. She is 73 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are employed and independent. She is a widow. Margarita has been a member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. She rents out rooms for a living. Her first loan was of 300 soles and she used it to make repairs to two of her rooms. Even though the loan was a small one, it was very helpful - without it she would not have been able to continue her business. With this loan of 1,000 soles Margarita will buy corrugated roofing material so that she repair the deteriorated roof of one of the rooms she lets. Margarita is grateful for all the support she has received from Manuela Ramos, saying that it has helped her generate income for her family, helped her build up her business and allowed her to continue growing and developing as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
These fifteen entrepreneurs from San Pedro D. Macoris are applying for this Kiva loan in order to keep their inventories properly stocked and, in some cases, to expand their sales activities to other areas.

There are three representatives appointed for each group of five entrepreneurs: these are Fior A., Lesbia A., and Rafael A..

Fior has two children, ages four and eight. She sells breakfasts and lunches at a small cafeteria and will use the loan to buy the food items she needs in quantities large enough that will allow her to cook more portions per day.

Lesbia has a small repair shop where she sells parts for cars and motorcycles. All her children are grown up: the youngest is 18 years old.

Rafael sells clothing, which he buys in bundles and sells in his home. He will use this loan to start a new sales endeavor: he wishes to buy pork to sell in order to make a daily profit that will balance his more unpredictable clothing sales, which do not happen every day. This is important to Rafael because he needs to make sure his youngest child, now three months old, is well taken care of.

The three are united in wanting to expand their businesses and each of them has the short-term goal of setting up stores for their activities. Their common dream is someday to own a house.

Please help us to support the hard work of these entrepreneurs.

Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase new clothing, pork, cafeteria food, and motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Elena Margarita

texts.es:
Su actividad D. la Sra. Elena es la venta D. desayunos, almuerzos  D. lunes a sábado su actividad diaria empieza a las 6:00 D. la mañana que va hacer compras del mercado espacialmente la carne que tiene que ser fresca así como la verdura, para tener satisfechos a sus clientes; atienD. a empresas que se encuentran ubicados en la zona ya que es céntrica y donD. hay varias empresas. El esposo tiene un ingreso fijo mensual el cual le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ya que cuentan con 5 hijos tres D. los cuales ya se encuentran en la universidad pero al mismo tiempo le ayudan a la mama en el snack atendiendo a sus clientes, uno esta en edad escolar y el último tiene 1 año.
Es una familia muy unida todos trabajan aportando en la familia.
texts.en:
Elena sells breakfasts and lunches Monday-Saturday. Her day starts at 6 a.m. when she goes to the market to make her purchases, particularly the meat that needs to be as fresh as the vegetables to satisfy her customers. She serves to businesses located in her area, which is central and populated with various companies. Her husband earns a fixed monthly income to help her with family expenses. They have five children, three of whom are attending the local university but also help her mother with her stand, tending to customers. Another child is in school, and the youngest is 1 year old. This is a very tightly knit family where everyone supports everyone else.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a chicken fryer and a hot food stand

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El sr Anibal B. tiene 45 años y es casado con la sra Catalina Cardozo con quien tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, de 13 y 6 años respectivamente.

El cliente y su esposa tienen un microcomercio en su domicilio de ventas de ropas, sábanas, edredones, remeras, vaqueros, calzados deportivos, etc. Dicho negocio es atendido por su esposa (Catalina) quien tiene asi la oportunidad de cuidar de sus hijos y también de la microempresa.

Adicionalmente el Sr Anibal, para ayudar con la economía de la canasta familiar, cuenta con otro ingreso ya que  hace ya seis años  se dedica como  chofer de taxi, en la Parada Nº 32 de la  ciudad de Asunción situada en la esquina del Departamento de Identificaciones.

Ambos están esforzándose y ayudándose para  poder  brindar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, y asi poder cumplir sus sueños  que es el de terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Anibal B. is 45 years old and married to Catalina Cardozo. They have two children together who are 6 and 13 years old. The couple runs a small shop out of their home selling clothes, sheets, comforters, sports shoes etc. Catalina is the one who actually works in the shop, because it allows her to be at home for her children. In addition to this business, Anibal earns another income as a taxi driver, thus helping to support the household's needs. He has been driving a taxi for 6 years, operating out of Stop # 32 in Asuncion city, right on the corner near the governmental Department of Records. Both Anibal and Catalina are working hard and supporting each other so that they can offer the children a better quality of life. They also dream of finishing construction on their home.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es:
El  señor Emigdio Cáceres tiene 49 años y esta casado con la señora Victorina Mendoza de 45 años. Ellos tienen 6 hijos, 4 varones  de  23 , 19 , 17 y 13 años y dos hijas de 21 y 15 años. Los tres hijos mayores trabajan actualmente y aportan a la canasta familiar y los  menores están cursando sus estudios secundarios.

El señor Emigdio se dedica desde hace 26 años al fraccionamiento y venta de carbón vegetal. Dichos productos compra de diferentes ciudades del interior del país  y los vende fraccionado en bolsas de papel  de 2 kg. y en bolsas de hule de 1 kg. A comercios de la zona de Villa Elisa y Ñemby.

El préstamo solicitado desea invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de carbón para obtener de esa  manera  menor precio de costo por su producto y mayor ganancia por la venta de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Emigdio Cáceres is 49 years old and married to Victorina Mendoza, who is 45 years old. They have 6 children, 4 boys who are 13, 17, 19 and 23; and two girls who are 15 and 21. The three eldest children work and help contribute to the household's income. The younger children are all still in school. For 26 years Emigdio has been in the business of processing and selling charcoal. He buys it in large quantities from cities in the country's interior, breaks it into smaller pieces, and sells it in 2kg. paper bags and and 1 kg. packages made from oilcloth to the businesses in the Villa Eliza and Nemby areas. This loan will be used to buy larger quantities of charcoal at a time. The benefits of bulk pricing mean that Emigdio will pay less for the same amount of charcoal and thus, be able to earn more when he resells it.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
MARITZA R. P. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”, con domicilio ubicado en Jr. Lobocaño Mz.114 Lt.14 del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, tiene 45 años D. edad, 01 menor hijo y 02 hijos universitarios, su esposo se desempeña actualmente como Trabajador Independiente. Ella se dedica a administrar el local que posee junto a su esposo.

Hace 05 años que es socia D. Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300 Nuevos Soles con el cual remodeló su local para poder hacer grandes eventos, con los años el negocio se afianzo gracias a la perseverancia, carisma y gratos ambientes con los que cuenta el local.
Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra D. artículos diversos para la decoración del local, así como pintura y pago D. mano D. obra que se requiera.

Comenta: “Aunque al principio me fue difícil ingresar al grupo, desD. que estoy en Las Dalilas me siento muy bien, siempre he salido adelante y ahora con el apoyo que me brindan todo se me hace mucho mejor”
texts.en:
Maritza R. P. D. R. is a member of the Las Dalilas Communal bank and lives at Mz.114 Lt.14 Lobocaño Jr. in Yarinacocha. She is 45 years old and has 3 children, 2 who are in university and one who is still school age. Her husband currently works as a contractor and Maritza runs a small bar that she and her husband own. Maritza has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan was of 300 soles, and she used it to remodel her bar so that events could be held there. Over the years the business has done well, thanks to the couple's perseverance and the bar's pleasant, charming atmosphere. This next loan, of 1,500 soles, will be used to hire painters to revitalize the bar's decor. Of working with Las Dalilas, Maritza says: Although it was challenging in the beginning, I fell really good about it now - I have been very successful with all the support that has been offered.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint and decorations

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas S. tiene 57 años y esta casado con la señora Ramona Agüero de 38 años. La misma se encuentra actualmente trabajando en la Argentina.  Tienen tres hijos, dos varones de 11 y 9 años respectivamente y una nena de 7 años, que se encuentran cursando sus estudios primarios.

El señor Tomas posee un taller de carpintería en su domicilio desde hace 34 años y en el mismo fabrica puertas, ventanas, placares, cómodas  y diferentes tipos de muebles para varias mueblerias.

Desea invertir el préstamo en la compra mayorista de distintos tipos de maderas e insumos para la fabricación de muebles.  De esa manera abarataría sus costos y obtendría mayor margen de ganancias por la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Tomas S. is 57 years old and married to Ramona Agüero who is 38. She finds herself currently working in Argentina. They have 3 children, two sons ages 11 and 9 respectively, and one daughter who is 7 years old; they are in primary school. Tomas has had a carpentry shop in his home for the past 34 years, where he makes doors, windows, cabinets, bureaus, and different types of items for various furniture stores. He wants to invest the loan into the wholesale purchase of different types of woods and furniture-making supplies. In this way, he would be able to lower his costs and obtain a greater profit margin from the sale of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Cariñositos Group

texts.es:
Este banco se encuentra conformado por 11 integrantes, cursa por su cuarto ciclo.
MARY C. D. P..- Es la presidenta del banco comunal, vive en el barrio Villa Norte D. la zona del Torno, vive en casa D. alquiler con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. carteras, negocio con el que viene trabajando ya hace muchos años, su esposo el Sr. Telesforo P. se dedica a la agricultura en la misma zona del Torno. El objetivo es seguir trabajando con crédito y acumular un capital con el que se puedan comprar un lote D. terreno.
YENNY R. R..- Es la tesorera del banco comunal, es nacida en la cordillera D. Santa Cruz, pero actualmente vive en la zona del torno Provincia Andrés Ibáñez, vive en casa familiar, con su esposo y su hijo.
Se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. medicamentos naturales mismo con el que viene trabajando hace un poco mas D. 5 años. Su esposo el Sr. Roberto A. es la principal persona encargada para realzar la venta D. este producto.
MARIA LUISA L. C..-  es la secretaria del banco comunal, la Sra. Maria luisa D. igual manera que la anterior integrante es nacida en la cordillera D. Santa Cruz, y actualmente vive en la zona del Torno, en el barrio Villa Norte.  Cuenta con casa Propia, en la cual su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Ella se dedica  a la venta D. cosméticos y la venta D. bijouterias,  su esposo el Sr. Olvis Martines al servicio D. transporte urbano D. pasajeros, actualmente solo trabaja D. chofer pero su objetivo es seguir trabajando con prestamos para logara acumular un capital y comprarse su propio vehiculo.
texts.en:
This community bank consists of 11 members and is on its fourth loan cycle.

Mary C. D. P. is president of the bank and lives in the Villa Norte neighborhood of Torno in a rented home with her husband and their two children. She makes a living making and selling purses and wallets, which she has done for many years. Her husband, Telesforo P., is a farmer in Torno. Mary's goal is to keep working on credit and accumulate capital so she can buy a plot of land.

Yenny R. R. is the treasurer of the community bank. She was born in mountainous Santa Cruz but currently lives in Torno in the Andrés Ibáñez province. She lives in her family's home with her husband and son. She makes a living making and selling natural medicines, which she has been doing for a little more than five years. Her husband, Roberto A., is the main person in charge of selling these products.

Maria Luisa L. C. is the community bank's secretary. Same as the previous member, she was born in Santa Cruz but now resides in the Villa Norte neighborhood of Torno. She lives with her husband and two children in a home they own. She makes a living selling cosmetics and jewelry. Her husband, Olvis Martines, works in public transportation. He currently drives a rented car, but his goal is to keep working on credit and accumulate capital to purchase his own vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise working capital

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 de Diciembre se formó gracias a la unión de vecinas del barrio 8 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité tienen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben o en algunos casos comenzarán su microemprendimiento a partir de la capitalización de este préstamo.  

Varias integrantes del comité son costureras dedicadas a la confección de ropas tradicionales y otros trabajos manuales. También integran el comité varias personas que se dedican a la venta de ropas y otros artículos.

Las integrantes del comité reciben en promedio un crédito de Gs.300.000

Las integrantes son: 

1	Perla Maria R.	Modista
2	Claudia C.	Venta de lencería
3	Maria R.	Venta de Ropas
4	Cira R.	Modista
5	Maximina E.	- Repostería - 
6	Patricia G.	- Venta de Quiniela - 
7	Angela B.	- Venta de cosméticos - 
8	Ramona A.	 - Venta de quiniela - 
9	Dominga C.	- Venta de quiniela  -
10	Myrian S.	-  
11	Gabriela G.	- Cantina  - 
12	Cirila M.	 - Almacén    - 
13	Victoriana Estigarribia	 - Venta de comidas - 
14	Celia B.    - Venta de Ropas - 
15	Silvia T.	- Venta decomidas - 
16	Elida G.	- Almacén - 
17	Julia M.	 - Venta de comidas - 
18	Percida M.	Venta de Frutas - 
19	Mariela C..	- Venta de carteras - 
20	Lucia A.	- Venta de quiniela
texts.en:
The group 8 de Diciembre (“8th of December”) was formed thanks to the joining together of women from the neighborhood of the same name, located in the city of Villa Elisa. All the members of the group have businesses to invest the loan funds into, or will use the funds to start their own micro-enterprises. Several members are seamstresses dedicated to making traditional clothing and other handmade items. Other members of the group sell clothing and other products. The members receive on average an amount of Gs. 300.000. The members are: 1. Perla Maria R. - Dressmaker  2. Claudia C. – Undergarment Sales  3. Maria R. – Clothing Sales  4. Cira R. -- Dressmaker  5. Maximina E. - Bakery  6. Patricia G. – Lottery Ticket Sales  7. Angela B. – Cosmetics Sales  8. Ramona A. - Lottery Ticket Sales 9. Dominga C. - Lottery Ticket Sales 10. Myrian S.   11. Gabriela G. - Café  12. Cirila M. – Grocery Store 13. Victoriana Estigarribia – Food Sales  14. Celia B. – Clothing Sales 15. Silvia T. - Food Sales 16. Elida G. – Grocery Store  17. Julia M. - Food Sales 18. Percida M. – Fruit Sales  19. Mariela C.. – Purse Sales  20. Lucia A. - Lottery Ticket Sales

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan funds granted to members of this group were used, in large part, for the purchase of merchandise such as clothes, fruits, vegetables, dairy products.  Said items were purchased by the women who are merchants.  The seamstresses bought items such as thread, fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
Este banco de emprendimiento se encuentra en su sexto ciclo esta conformado de  10 integrantes,  los cuales viven en la localidad de la Zona de l Torno.,
JORGE E..- Es el presidente del banco comunal, el cual fue elegido por la misma asociación debido al desempeño e interés que ha demostrado en el grupo.
El vive desde hace mas 20 años en la zona del Torno, cuenta con casa alquilada en la cual vive su esposa y sus tres hijos.  Tiene dos actividades la una es la venta de antenas  y la segunda actividad, es la ocupación de periodista, ambas actividades las viene desarrollando hace mas de 6 años. Es una persona muy activa, dinámica y responsable.
MARISOL C. O..-  La Sra. Marisol es la tesorera del banco comunal, la cual vive en el barro naciones unidas del Torno, vive en casa familiar su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza trabaja con la línea de yanbal, y como segunda actividad, trabaja como secretaria en la radio dinámica.  
Su esposo el Sr. Herman Carrillo tiene como oficio el periodismo.
Su objetivo es llagar a crecer en cuanto a capital y ser una promotora mayorista. 
YENNY V. M..-  Es la secretaria del banco, es nacida y vive en la zona del Torno barrio 6 de mayo, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con su esposo y su hijo. 
Se dedica a la venta por mayor de huevos de gallinas de granja, con este negocio ya vive trabajando hace mas de un año, su esposo el Sr. Hugo Maldonado, trabaja de albañil en la zona del torno.
Ambos tienen como objetivo colocar una granja de pollos, para de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This enterprising community bank is in its 6th loan cycle, and is formed by 10 members, who all live in the Torno neighborhood.

JORGE E. is the president of this bank, and was elected due to the performance and interest he has demonstrated in the group. He has lived for more than 20 years in the Torno neighborhood and has a rented house in which he lives with his wife and three children. He has two enterprises: he sells antennas and is a journalist. Both of these activities he has been developing for more than 6 years. He is a very active, dynamic, and responsible person.

MARISOL C. O. is the treasurer of the community bank. She lives in the united nations neighborhood of Torno, in her family's home with her husband and son. She sells beauty products, promoting the Yanbal line of cosmetics. She also works as a secretary for a radio station. Her husband is Herman Carrillo, who works in journalism. Her objective is to grow her capital and to become a wholesale promoter.

YENNY V. M. is the secretary of the bank. She was born in and still lives in the May 6th neighborhood in the Torno area. She has her own home, in which she lives with her husband and son. She sells eggs wholesale, and she has been doing this for more than one year. Her husband, Hugo Maldonado, works as a bricklayer in the Torno area. They both have the goal of investing in a chicken farm so that they can grow their income in this way.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow their capital

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela I. is 58 years old and lives in the town of Tecpan, Guatemala, in the department of Chimaltenango. She is a widow and for the past two years has helped support her two unmarried daughters.

Manuela’s business is raising pigs, which she has done for nearly 30 years. In addition to this business, she also buys and sells hand-made “guipiles” (traditional Guatemalan blouses).

Manuela is requesting a loan in order grow her business. She says that in the coming season she needs more pigs and will use her loan to breed and care for them. Her dream is that her daughters have their own homes, and that she can continue to take advantage of her good health and keep working hard and moving forward.


*****************************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
*****************************************************

Manuela I. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Tecpan Guatemala departamento de Chimaltenango. Ella es viuda, y desde hace 2 años tiene bajo se responsabilidad dos hijas solteras mayores de edad. Su negocio de crianza y destace de marranos lo inicio hace 30 años, también compra y venta de tejido de guipiles a mano. Ella necesita de un préstamo para mantener su negocio, ya que en temporada necesita más marranos. Su sueño es que sus hijas tengan casas propias, aprovechando que ella esta bien de salud puede trabajar y salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and more pig food

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza se formó gracias a la unión de vecinas de Fernando de la Mora Zona Sur.  Todas las integrantes del comité tienen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben o en algunos casos comenzarán su microemprendimiento a partir de la capitalización de este préstamo.   Varias integrantes del comité son artesanas, dedicadas a la confección de ropas tradicionales y otros trabajos manuales. También integran el comité varias personas que se dedican a la venta de ropas y otros artículos.

Las integrantes del comité reciben en promedio un crédito de Gs.468.750

Los otros integrantes son: 

1	Virginia L. - 	Modista - 
2	Ramona L. - 	Venta de Ropas - 
3	Antonia Silva R. - 	Venta de Ropas - 
4	Juana A. Suarez - 	Costurera - 
5	Maria C. Velazquez	- Venta de frutas - 
6	Segunda Delagracia B. - 	Venta de Comidas - 
7	Mirta C.	Venta de Ropas - 
8	Gabriela R.	- Venta de Comidas - 
9	Mirtha F. -	Peluquera - 
10	Juana Denis P. - 	Venta de leche - 
11	Limpia C. A.	- Despensa - Cabinas Telefónicas - 
12	Gladys Emilce P. - 	Recepcionista - 
13	Gladys Nelly M. - 	Artesana - 
14	Perla A. - 	Venta de Ropas - 
15	Mónica P.	- Cabinas telefónicas - 
16	Patricia R. - 	Venta de Ropas
texts.en:
The group La Esperanza (“Hope”) was formed thanks to the joining together of women from the Fernando de la Mona Zone South. All the members have businesses into which they invest the funds they receive or, in some cases, will start their micro-enterprises thanks to the capital from this loan. Several of the members of the group are artisans, dedicated to making traditional clothing and other handcrafted items. Also, some members sell clothing and other articles. The members will receive an average credit of Gs. 468.750. The members are: 1. Virginia L. – Dressmaker 2. Ramona L. – Clothing Sales 3. Antonia Silva R. – Clothing Sales 4. Juana A. Suarez – Seamstress 5. Maria C. Velazquez – Fruit Sales 6. Segunda Delagracia B. – Food Sales 7. Mirta C. – Clothing Sales 8. Gabriela R. – Food Sales 9. Mirtha F. – Hairdresser 10. Juana Denis P. – Milk Sales 11. Limpia C. A. – General Store, Phone Cubicles 12. Gladys Emilce P. – Receptionist 13. Gladys Nelly M. – Crafts 14. Perla A. – Clothing Sales 15. Mónica P. – Phone Cubicles 16. Patricia R. – Clothing Sales

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The credit granted to members of group was used, for the most part, to purchase merchandise such as clothing, fruits, vegetables, and dairy products.  Said items were bought by the women who are merchants.  The ones who make craft, bought supplies such as threads, fabrics, needles, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria Isabel P. es una mujer que desde muy  joven se ha dedicado ayudar a su mama, y con deseos de superación opto por poner su propio negocio de venta de tortilla. Tiene 47 años de edad y reside en el barrio Comarca la Hoyada de la Iglesia Católica  2 kilómetros al Sur. Su esposo trabaja como jardinero en una casa particular, tiene cuatro hijos  los cuales tres trabajan y la menor estudia contabilidad, lleva doce años palmeando tortillas ricas para los nicaragüenses, con este crédito quiere comprar maíz, leña y frijoles ya que también vende frijoles cosidos que se venden bastante. A futuro espera crecer mas, captar clientes y poder ofertar sus productos a más restaurante para obtener mejores ingresos, a si como ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel P. is a woman who, from a very young age, dedicated herself to helping her mother. From her desire to succeed, she opted to start her own business selling tortillas. She is 47 years old and lives in the La Hoyada region of the Iglesia Católica, 2 kilometers to the South. Her husband works as a gardener at a private home and she has four children, three of whom work and the youngest one is studying accounting. She has been making delicious tortillas for Nicaraguans for twelve years. With this credit, she would like to purchase corn, wood, and beans, given she also sells baked beans that sell very well. In the future, she hopes to grow her business, capture more customers, and be able to offer her products to more restaurants to augment her income, as well as to help her daughter with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, wood, and beans.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Sonia del Carmen R. tiene 30 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ajo, el cual lleva catorce años en las ventas, pues un productos que se vende mucho por su exquisito gusto en la comida. Ella tiene 30 años y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, con tres hijos de 2,6 y 8 años de edad, este crédito lo quiere para comprar 36 cajas de ajo para incrementar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias, este es su décimo ciclo el cual se ha beneficiado para mantener su negocio y apoyar a su familia, es por eso da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios adquirido y espera poder seguir trabajando. Sus planes  es poder vender en los departamentos y crecer.
texts.en:
Sonia del Carmen R. is 30 years old and her business, which she has been in for fourteen years, is the sale of garlic. This is a product that sells very well given the delicious flavor it adds to food. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, and has three children ages 2, 6 and 8. She would like this loan to purchase 36 boxes of garlic to increase her business and augment her income. This is her tenth loan cycle; these have greatly helped her to maintain her enterprise and support her family. She is grateful to Afodenic for the benefits provided, and she hopes to continue working. Her plans are to be able to sell her product in other areas and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 36 boxes of garlic to increase sales.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es: El señor cesar tiene 40 años de edad, el tiene una pulpería que administra con su esposa, también vende fritanga para generar mas ingresos, cuando inicio lo hizo con ahorros y prestamos que Afodenic otorgo, reside en el barrio Sabana grande en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad, este crédito lo quiere para comprar un freezer y sillas y mesas plásticas parar dar un servicio mejor a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder seguir invirtiendo en la venta de fritanga ya que se vende mucho y desea poder poner un comedor, a si como mejorar su  vivienda y poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cesar, 40, has a small grocery store that he and his wife operate. They also sell fried food to generate more income. He started with savings and loans from Afodenic. He lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood in Managua city. They have two children, 2 and 10. The loan is to buy a freezer and plastic tables and chairs in order to give better service to his customers. He plans to be able to continue investing in the sale of fried food because he sells a lot of it. He wants to be able to put in a dining room to improve his home. He also wants to be able to give his children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer and plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Mujeres Renovadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Renovadoras se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio Las Garzas de la ciudad de San Antonio. Todas las integrantes del comité tienen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben.  Varias integrantes del comité se dedican a la venta de ropas y otros artículos.

Las integrantes del comité reciben en promedio un crédito de Gs. 906.250

Lina González de Rodas	 - Venta de Cosméticos - 
Mónica Gómez - 	Venta de Cosméticos - 
Victoria B. - 	Venta de lencería - 
Damaris Gómez - 	Venta de cosméticos - 
Mirtha E. - 	Librería - Mercería - 
Olga C. - 	Venta de Ropas - 
Idalia C.. - 	Venta de cosméticos - 
Luciana A. - 	Venta de comidas - 
Mónica Valdéz - 	Fabricación de productos de limpieza - 
Gregoria R. - 	Costurera - 
Lilían Gómez - 	Kiosco - 
Rafaela M.	 - Peluquera. - 
Teresa R.	 - Venta de Bebidas - 
Juana R. - 	Venta de frutas - 
Nicolasa Yani G. - 	Venta de Frutas - 
Lilia A. F.. - 	Costurera. -
texts.en:
The Mujeres Renovadoras (Transforming Women's) Committee originated when these women came together, all neighbors from the Las Garzas neighborhood in the city of San Antonio. They all have work in which they will be investing the money that they receive. Many of the committee members are engaged in selling clothing and other articles. The average loan amount per committee member will be 906,250 Guaranís. Lina González de Rodas - Cosmetics Sales Mónica Gómez - Cosmetics Sales Victoria B. - Lingerie Sales Damaris Gómez - Cosmetics Sales Mirtha E. - Bookstore and Notions Olga C. - Clothing Sales Idalia C.. - Cosmetics Sales Luciana A. - Selling Meals Mónica Valdéz - Production of Cleaning Products Gregoria R. - Seamstress Lilían Gómez - Kiosk Rafaela M. - Hairdresser Teresa R. - Selling Beverages Juana R. - Selling Fruit Nicolasa Yani G. - Selling Fruit Lilia A. F.. - Seamstress

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Concepción P., tienen la edad de 43 años,  habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla en Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos, la mayor trabaja y estudia; para apoyarle a don Concepción, ya que su esposa sufre de una enfermedad en la piel y le impide laborar. El señor concepción trabaja como técnico en servicio en rotulación, desde hace 14 años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar la condición de vida , sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su vivienda . Con el financiamiento obtenido lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para poder tener  una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Concepcion P. is 43 years old, lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla area of Ticuantepe with his wife, who helps him with the home expenses. They have three children. His oldest goes to school and works, helping Mr. Concepcion, since his wife has a skin disease which does not allow her to work. Mr. Concepcion has worked as a technician in a labeling service for the last 14 years. His plans are to improve the living conditions of his family and he dreams of being able to finish building his house. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy construction materials so that he can provide a proper home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for improvements to his house.

loans.name: Silvia Mery

texts.es:
La Sra. SILVIA MERY R. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”  con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Sucre N° 1013 del Distrito de Callería; tiene 38 años y 2 hijos menores.  Su esposo labora en “Comercial Huanta” como vendedor.

El primer préstamo fue hace 02 años de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  con él mejoró el local comprando algunas mesas y sillas para que la clientela pueda disfrutar de sus bebidas cómodamente.

Con este préstamo es de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes (leche, azúcar, arroz, etc.) y demás productos que le ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única institución  con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene y la facilidad que les da para obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Mery R. C. is a member of the community bank "Las Dalilas". She lives at the Jr. Sucre No. 1013 address of the District of Calleria. She is 38 years old and has 2 minor children. Her husband works as a salesman at the "Comercial Huanta". Her first loan was 2 years ago for 300 new soles. With this she improved her space, buying some tables and chairs so that her customers could enjoy her beverages in comfort. With this loan of 1000 new soles, she will buy groceries (milk, sugar, rice, etc.) and other products that will help her make more money for her home. She says that Manuela Ramos is the only institution that she deals with because of the low interest rates that she obtains and the ease of getting the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as milk, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mayra De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Mayra de Jesús Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos tienen, tres hijos a su cargo, doña Mayra es comerciante desde hace cinco años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de sus hijos, ya que todos duermen en un mismo cuarto, con el financiamiento va a invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de ropa, chinelas para que su inventario incremente al igual que sus ventas  y poder ir ahorrando para hacer las mejoras a su casa para poder gozar de una casa digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra de Jesus R. is 39 years old, lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband, who works to help with the home expenses. They have three children to care for. Mrs. Mayra has been a businesswoman for the last five years. Her major difficulty is the lack of financial resources. Her plans are to improve living conditions for their children. They now all sleep in one room. She will invest the proceeds of the loan in inventory for her business, clothing, slippers, this will increase her sales. She will save her earnings to improve her residence and thus can enjoy living in a proper house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, slippers and other products to increase her sales.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó mediante otro comité de la misma Zona a la cual pertenece este, San Lorenzo. Todas son vendedoras de las ollas Essen que la estan vendiendo desde hace ya 3 años. 

Por mas que vendan el mismo producto todas poseen clientela formada y cada una tiene una zona especifica que explotar. Poseen buen relacionamiento entre todas.  

En la foto falta una integrante la cual se retiro antes por motivo que debia retirar las ollas para hacer entrega a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee grew from another committee in the same Zone, San Lorenzo, to which this one belongs. They are all sales women of Essen pots, which they have been selling for the last 3 years. Even though they sell the same product, the each have an established customer base and have a specific area that they cover. There is a good relationship among them all. The picture is missing a member because she had to leave to deliver pots to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans have been used to increase their capital and purchase of the products that they sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
NELLY N. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su local ubicado en el Jr. Atahualpa Nº 1030 del Distrito de Calleria; tiene 37 año, su esposo es comerciante independiente, tiene  04 hijos maravillosos.
Su negocio es de venta de cancamos y barretas (material para construcción); la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 08 años, con este dinero compró fierros de diferentes medidas para la fabricación de sus productos, de esta manera logró afianzar su negocio; con el transcurrir de los años se compro una maquina que le permite fabricar mas y con un menor costo sus productos. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más materia prima (fierros de diferentes medidas y espesores) para la fabricación de las berretas y cancamos que ella ofrece.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, los 4 años que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una ayuda interesante que me ha permitido seguir adelante remarcó.
texts.en:
Nelly Navoaro C. belongs to the Mujeres Talentosas (Talented Women) Communal Bank. Her business is located on Jr. Atahualpa in the Calleria District. She is 37 years old and has four marvelous children. Her husband is an independent businessman. Her business is selling cancamos (very large steel staples) and barretas (steel bars and rods) which are use in construction. Eight years ago, she obtained her first loan of 300 Sols with which she bought raw metal in different sizes for the fabrication of her products. In this way she was able to finance her business. Since that time she has bought a machine that allows her to produce more of her products at lower cost. With this loan of 2,000 Sols she will buy the raw materials, metal of different dimensions and thicknesses, to fabricate the rods and staples which she offers. Thanks to Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER, over the four years they have been working together, she has been able to set up her business. This assistance is interesting, she remarks, and it has permitted me to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw metal in various sizes.

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Renee es  casada tiene 49 años, cuatro hijos de 26,25,18 y él ultima de 15 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Renne se dedica a dar servicio de cosmetología corte de cabello, tinte, cepillado a domicilio, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo, y tiene su bazar-librería- perfumería. 
Renee necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de una secadora de cabello, cortadora de cabello para hombre, y una planchadora de cabello.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a tener cuidado con el dinero, a invertir en algo que él va a producir, que  pueda recuperar su  inversión. 
El sueño de Renee es tener un spac de belleza.
texts.en:
Renee is a member of the community bank La Fortaleza. Renee is married, is 49 years old, has four children of 26, 25, 18 and 15 years of age, the youngest is attending the state school. Renee makes a living providing beauty services, hair cuts, color, combing, at the customers' homes. She also sell beauty products from catalogs and also has a shop-bookstore-perfume shop. Renee needs a loan of 800 soles to buy a hair dryer, hair clippers for men and a flat iron. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to take care of her money, to invest it in something that will generate income and be able to recover her investment. Renee dreams of having a beauty spa.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renee needs a loan of 800 soles to buy a hair dryer, hair clippers for men and a flat iron.

loans.name: Judy

texts.es:
Judy  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Judy es conviviente  tiene 49 años, tres hijos de 15, 14 y 12 años que están en la escuela estatal. 
Judy trabajaba en el en un kiosco un colegio vendiendo  menú por dos años, salio del colegio y alquilo un puesto, se puso a vender menú, hace cuatro meses decidió  cerrar su puesto y abrir su casa para vender  menú. Ya tiene clientes y le esta le yendo bien. 
Judy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería, pescado, cerveza.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió  a ser responsable, para avanzar en el negocio, con las charlas a prendió a como debe de atender a las clientas de manera especial para poder conservarlas, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio.  
El sueño de Judy es juntar sus ahorros para poner una polleria.
texts.en:
Judy is a member of La Fortaleza community bank. Judy, 49, is in a common law marriage. She has three children, 15, 14, and 12. The children attend public school. For two years Judy worked in a kiosk by the school selling meals. She left the school and rented a place to sell meals. After four months she decided to close that place and open her house to sell meals. She now has customers and is doing well. Judy needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy merchandise, fish, and beer. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to be responsible in order to advance in business. The talks have taught her how to wait on customers in a special way to be able to keep them. Her children help her with the business. Judy’s dream is to gather enough savings to open a place to sell chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, fish, and beer.

loans.name: Roxana Nilsa

texts.es:
ROXANA NILSA A. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano LAS BRISAS Mz.F Lt.20 del Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 34 años de edad, 02 menores hijos y su esposo se desempeña actualmente como chofer de motocar (transportista)

Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo usó para incrementar su pequeño negocio, compró artículos de pasamanería y de primera necesidad, con un local acondicionado en su casa, el negocio siguió progresando.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra artículos de primera nesecidad (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.) así como también bebidas gaseosas de todas las marcas y tamaños pues con la buena atención y el optimismo que tiene está segura que seguirá progresando.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
ROXANA NILSA A. A., belongs to the communal bank "Las Dalilias", which is located in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 34 years old and she is the mother of two minor children. Her husband is currently working as a taxi driver. She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos group for the past 2 years now. With the first loan that she recieved for 300 Soles (About $100), she used the money to increase the inventory of her small business. She bought ornamental trimmings for clothing and also basic food items to sell. She has the store set up in part of her house and her business continues to grow. With this loan for $325 (1,000 Soles) she will invest in buying basic food items like rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc. She will also buy a variety of kinds of soft drinks to sell in different sizes. With the good service that she gives to her customers and her optimism she is sure that her business will continue to grow. She is very thankful for Manuela Ramos, since it is an institution that serves the community and it really helps the women in the region that she lives in.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell like milk, sugar, rice, etc.  To purchase soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Esperanza es viuda tiene 50 años, dos hijos de 32 y 31 años que están casados.  
Desde joven siempre trabajo como vendedora, con la experiencia ganada puso su negocio de bazar.  
Esperanza necesita un crédito de 1400 soles, para la compara de cerveza, gaseosas, regalos para su bazar.
Desde que esta en Finca puede comprar más mercadería, con las charlas que ha recibido aprendió como llevar su  negocio, a ser mas ordenada, disciplinada
El sueño de Esperanza es comprarse una congeladora para su bodega.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of The Fortress Community Bank. She is a 50-year-old widow with two children, ages 32 and 31, who are both married. Since she was young she has worked as a saleswoman, and with the experience she gained she started a bazaar business. Esperanza is requesting a loan of 1,400 soles, which she plans to use to purchase beer, soft drinks and gifts for her store. Since joined Kiva partner Finca, she has been able to purchase more supplies and from the talks she has received she learned how to better carry her business and to be more organized and disciplined. Her dream is to buy a freezer for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks and gifts for her store

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Yabel es conviviente tiene 37 años, cuatro hijos de 12, 11, 9 y 3 años que están estudiando en al escuela estatal.  
Ysabel  empezó en el negocio comprando pan a una señora por su casa y los  vendía en una canasta, después se compro un triciclo y  vendió por dos años, hasta que decidió hacer ella misma el pan. Alquilo un horno para  pan, contrato a un maestro panadero y un ayudante de panadería, Ysabel se dedica a la venta de panes, diario vende  mas de 3000 panes por las mañanas.   
Ysabel  necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra para la compra de dos sacos de  azúcar y dos sacos harinas estos los compra diario.   
Desde que esta en Finca gracias a los préstamos puede invertir en su negocio, trabaja tranquila, sin tener que prestarse de sus vecinos que le cobran altos intereses. 
El sueño de Isabel es tener un local propio para  hacer y vender pan.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of La Fortaleza (The Fortress) Community Bank. She is 37-year-old mother of four children, ages 12, 11, 9, and 3, who are studying at a state school, and she lives with her partner. Ysabel started her business buying bread from a woman's home and then selling it out of a basket. Later she bought a moto-tricycle and sold bread from that for two years until she decided to make the bread herself. She rented a bread oven and hired a head baker and an assistant. Ysabel is dedicated to selling the breads, and she sells more than 3,000 each morning. She is requesting a loan of 800 soles, which she plans to use to purchase two sacks of sugar and two sacks of flour, which she buys daily. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, she has been able to invest in her business and work tranquilly without having to borrow money from her neighbors, who charge high interest. Ysabel's dream is to have her own store where she can make and sell bread.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of sugar and flour

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es:
La Sra. RUBI G. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Atahualpa N°  970 del Distrito de Callería; tiene 32 años, 02 hijos menores, y su esposo se desempeña como técnico electricista.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace ya 06 años, con él compró ropa de temporada en la capital y de esta manera empezó con su pequeña empresa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa y zapatos en variados diseños en la ciudad de Lima ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y las fiestas de San Juan.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Rubi belongs to the Talented Women Community Bank. She is 32 years old and lives in the district of Callería with her two small children. Her husband is an electrician. With her first loan she took out 300 soles six year ago and used it to buy seasonal clothing in the capital city of Lima, and in this way she started her small business. With the current loan she is requesting of 1,000 soles, she plans to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes of various styles in Lima, since summertime and the San Juan festivals are nearing. Rubi thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and contributes to the women in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes of various styles

loans.name: Sonia Karina

texts.es:
SONIA KARINA T. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su local ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo Nº 286 del Distrito de Calleria; tiene 39 años, actualmente se encuentra separada de su esposo y tiene  01 hijo que aun depende de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de ropa.  La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles (hace 05 años), con este préstamo compró algunas prendas mas y afianzo su negocio.  Gracias a su carisma, entusiasmo y persistencia su negocio ha incrementado. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa  comprar mas prendas de vestir así como calzado para damas y caballeros debido al pedido de sus clientes.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Sonia Karina T. B. belongs to the Talented Women Community Bank and lives in the district of Callería. She is 39 years old and currently separated from her husband. She has one son who is still dependent on her. She makes a living selling clothes. With her first loan, she took out 300 soles five years ago and used it to purchase some clothing items and finance her business. Thanks to her charisma, enthusiasm and persistence, her business has grown. She is currently requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which she plans to use to purchase more clothing items as well as footwear for men and women as a result of her customers' orders. "(Kiva partner) Manuela Ramos is an organization that supports a large number of families with its small loans that allow women in the area to start or improve their businesses, and I'm content with its help," she said.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dresses and footwear

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
ZOILA A. D. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su local ubicado en el Jr. Piura Nº 191 del Distrito D. Calleria; tiene 61 año, su esposo se desempeña como maestro D. obras, tiene  05 hijos ya mayores. Ella es socia D. Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años.

Inició el negocio D. comidas por las tardes y noches, tales como juanes, tacacho, y pescado asado (platos típicos D. la región).  Con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una cocina e insumos, como vive en una zona bien concurrida el negocio le va muy bien. 

Con este préstamo es D. S/.2,300.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa  comprar materiales D. construcción para mejorar el local y así formalizar mas el negocio.  Gracias al buen trato, aseo y agradable atención el publico asiste mas clientela cada día.

Muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos, ya que cuando su pareja no pueD. trabajar su negocio le ha ayudado a sostener su familia en tiempos difíciles.
texts.en:
Zoila A. D. M. belongs to the Talented Women Community Bank and lives in the district of Callería. She is a 61-year-old mother of five children, all grown up, and her husband makes a living as a laborer. She has been a member of Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years. She starter her business selling typical regional meals (grilled fish, etc.) in the afternoon and evenings. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased a stove and cooking utensils, and because she lives in a well-traveled area the business went very well. With the current loan of 2,300 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase building materials to improve her storefront and to better formalize her business. Thanks to the quality, cleanliness and customer service more clients come every day. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos because when her husband couldn't work her business helped her family sustain through difficult times.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to improve her storefront

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
AIDA H. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Sucre N°  1014 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 37 años de edad, 03 menores hijos y su esposo se desempeña actualmente como chofer de auto colectivo (Transportista).

Desde hace ya 01 año que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles con lo cual compró ropa, ahora amplió el negocio a la venta de peluches

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de peluches y ropa de temporada al por mayor directamente de Lima (ciudad) para estas fiestas patronales de  San Juan donde aumenta la demanda de estos productos.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos y está conforme con el trabajo que viene realizando en la región, es una ayuda para las mujeres que quieren seguir adelante, apoyando al ingreso económico de las familias.
texts.en:
Aida H. P. belongs to the “Las Dalilas” community bank. She lives at Jr. Sucre N° 1014 in the Callería district. She is 37, and she has 3 minor children. Her husband is a collective taxi driver. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought clothes. Now she is expanding her business and selling stuffed animals. With this loan of 1,200 PEN she will buy stuffed animals. She will also buy wholesale seasonal clothes from Lima for the patron saint’s day in San Juan, where there is an increased demand for these products. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, and she is satisfied with their work in the region. It is a help to women who want to get ahead by supporting the economic income of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stuffed animals and articles of clothing

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. ALICIA D. A. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas” con domicilio en el Jr. 7 de Junio N° 749 D. distrito de Callería, tiene 52 años, 05 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo en la Compañía Petrolera.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 05 años, con él, empezó en el rubro de la Ferretería y afianzó su negocio en una zona exclusivamente ferretera.

Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de implementos eléctricos tales como cables mellizos, sokets, interruptores, etc. , así como también en el arreglo de la infraestructura D. local.

En el tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante y de esa manera  ayudar en la economía D. hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia D. Águila Meléndez is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres Talentosas" ("Talented Women"). She lives at Jr. 7 de Junio N° 749 in Callería district. She is 52 years old and has 5 children. Her husband works with Compañía Petrolera.

She received her first loan, of 300 nuevo soles, five years ago. She started working in hardware and built her business in this area.

With this loan of 1000 nuevo soles, she will invest in the purchase of electrical implements, like twin cables, sockets, interruptors, etc, as well as fixing the infrastructure of her store.

In the time she has been with Manuela Ramos she has been happy because of the help that Manuela Ramos gives women to excel and contribute to family income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electrical implements (cables, sockets, interruptors, etc.) and maintenance of store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
MARTHA O. VELAZQUES, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su local ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº 597 del Distrito de Calleria; tiene 47 años, su esposo es instructor de físico culturismo tienen  01 hijo menor y 02 ya profesionales.

Hace ya 05 años que es socia de Manuela Ramos, con su primer préstamo  de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles lo utilizo para mejorar la seguridad del local donde vende licores y bebidas gaseosas.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa  mejorar la infraestructura del local así como también comprara Bebidas de todas las marcas.

Comenta: “Me Agrada la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos, el sistema que tiene, el orden, así como las orientaciones que dan, he puesto en práctica algunos consejos que me ayudaron a mejorar mi empresa.
texts.en:
Martha O. Velásquez belongs to the “Mujeres Talentosas” community bank. Her business is located at Jr. Salaverry Nº 597 in the Calleria district. She is 47; her husband is a body building instructor. They have one minor child; the other two are already professionals. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 5 years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she improved the security on the premises where she sells liquor and soft drinks. With a loan of 3,000 PEN she will improve the infrastructure of her establishment. She will also buy all brands of drinks. She says, “I like the way Manuela Ramos works: the system they have, the order, and the orientations they give. I have put into practice some of the advice; that helped me improve my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and liquor.  Maintenance of infrastructure of her business location.

loans.name: Darly

texts.es:
DARLY B. R. D. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”, con domicilio ubicado en Jr. El Pescador Mz. 116 Lt.11 del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, tiene 36 años D. edad, 02 menores hijos y su esposo se desempeña actualmente como Docente (profesor) en una institución educativa.
Hace 02 años se dedicó a la crianza D. pollos y la primera vez en Manuela Ramos, obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, y afianzo su negocio en crianza D. pollos, logró crecer hasta manejar la crianza D. un millar D. pollos, lamentablemente en el 2008, hubo poca demanda, tanto que la obligó a cerrar ese negocio, entonces se dedicó a la venta D. ropa comprándose una maquina remalladora.
Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra D. ropa nueva  para todo tipo D. personas: Niños, mujeres y varones.  Gracias al apoyo y las capacitaciones que brinda Manuela Ramos está segura que seguirá progresando.
Comenta: “Aunque al principio me fue difícil ingresar al grupo, desD. que estoy en Las Dalilas me siento muy bien, siempre he salido adelante y ahora con el apoyo que me brindan todo se me hace mucho mejor”
texts.en:
