Darly B. R. D. C. belongs to the “Las Dalilas” community bank. She lives at Jr. El Pescador Mz. 116 Lt.11 in the Yarinacocha district. She is 36, and she has 2 minor children. Her husband is a professor at an educational institution. Two years ago she started raising chickens. She received her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 PEN, which financed her raising chickens. She was able to grow the business until she had a thousand chickens. Unfortunately, in 2008 there was not much demand. She had to close her business. Then, she bought a special sewing machine and started selling clothes. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy new clothes for children, women, and men. Thanks to the trainings offered by Manuela Ramos, she is sure that she will keep progressing. She says, “Even though at the beginning it was difficult to join the group, since I have been in Las Dalilas I feel very good. I have always come out ahead, and now, with the help they offer me, everything is much better.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is married to a farmer and they have six children. She is 43 years old and they are living in the village of San Roque Centro, Enrile, Cagayan. Their children are: Harold, 24 years old; Valentino, 22 years old; Nida, 20 years old; Lanie, 17 years old; Oscar, 16 years old; and Veronica, 11 years old. Three of them are still studying and the couple is sacrificing a lot to support their education.

Hog raising is the chosen business of Lilia as their source of income. Aside from hogs, she also raises ducks that she can sell anytime as their alternative source of income. Her husband, Danilo, cultivates their corn field. They help each other in improving their living condition.

Lilia is hoping to expand her business. For her to do it, she would like to borrow PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to sustain her enterprise and to buy a supply of pig feed. Lilia is praying that she will able to obtain the loan from the lenders in order for her to have a chance to not only improve her business but also to support her children.

loans.use: To buy a supply of pig feed

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes P. is 48 years old and happily married to Rosito. They live a simple and happy life in Barangay Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. As a fruit of their patience and sacrifices in farming, two of their children successfully graduated from college in their chosen profession and are now working abroad, while their youngest is still studying in college. She hopes that their farming business will become successful for them to combat life’s difficulties.

She and her husband are working together in cultivating their farm. They plant rice and vegetables. To assist her husband in their farming needs, she is now borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000 for their farm maintenance. The amount will be of big help to purchase their needed agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, hybrid seeds and pesticides. She hopes that, in the coming harvest season, they are able to have a higher yield. She prays for good weather since rain and other calamities are some of the factors that affect their harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, hybrid seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia R. has been a fish vendor in her village for almost one year.  Her goal is to improve and expand her business and to further support the daily needs of her family.  However due to lack of capital, she could not pursue her plans.  Because of this, she would like to request PHP 4,000.00 as additional capital for her vending business.  She is happy that through her vending, she is able to provide her family with food to eat three times a day and also to give her children their school allowance.  

Deliea is 46 years old and married to Nelson.  They have four children: Ivy, 22 years old, college undergraduate; Jonathan, 19 years old; Josua, 17, years old and Jaymar, 15 years old.  The three of them are in high school.  They live in Barangay Alibagu, Ilagan, Isabela.  Her family is trying to surpass the economic crisis they are encountering nowadays.  She hopes that her business will become successful someday.  She always prays that through all her sacrifices, God will give her a way to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a 50 year old widow, who has three children: Gemma is the eldest, 32 years old, a high school graduate. Leonardo, 30 years old, who is also a high school graduate and the youngest is Jeffrey, 27 years old, and a college undergraduate.  According to Alejandra, life has to move on, and whatever problems one encounters must be faced with courage and through the guidance of the Lord. She is happy that her three children are very supportive and have not left her side. 

Alejandra plans to pursue her food selling business.  She is requesting an amount of PHP 3, 000.00 that she will utilize for the improvement of her business.  She also sells snacks in her village.  Alejandra is still hoping that her youngest child will continue his studies and will somehow finish a vocational course.  She is working hard and striving to succeed in life.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
“I must work hard for my family” Miraflor M. said. She is 23 years old and lives at Casusan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. At present, she is pregnant with her first baby. Excited, yet nervous - that’s what she feels right now. She already saves money for her delivery out of the income derived from her “sari-sari” (general) store.

Fortunately, she was granted a loan to start up her business from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in August 2008. She is a member in good standing and has paid the loan in full. Now, she applies for PHP 7,000 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. She hopes that, someday, she will be able to establish a good life with her family around her.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Carmel Joy

texts.en:
Ms. Carmel Joy A., 25 years of age, is single and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for almost two years. She lives with her parents but she has an existing sari-sari store to generate her own income.

Now she has obtained another loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 intended for the purchase of assorted grocery stocks for display. She dreams that someday she can expand her business and have more income to help her parents financially.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gumersinda

texts.en:
Gumersinda M., 65, resides at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. Blessed with four children, they own a stall at the public market which is a big help to them. Through selling fish, Gumersinda was able to own a boarding house and accepts tenants/boarders as her additional source of income.

Being a member of Paglaum is a big opportunity for her family. She hopes to expand her business by owning another stall. Recently, she applied for PHP 7,000 to buy additional fish to sell.

Gumersinda never considers herself too old to strive for a better living. With her children and Paglaum MPC, she dreams of escalating her business and hopes that her children will have individual businesses in the future as well.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma N., 31, is married to Marito N., a van driver. They are blessed with three children and live in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Her business is the buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothes (RTW). She sells to her friends and neighbors. She borrowed 20,000php for additional capitalization of her business. Her income helps with the daily needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy stock of RTW clothes

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Mrs. Merly A. is 29 years of age and married to Mr. Jovenal A., an Overseas Filipino Worker. They have two lovely children to raise and hope to give them a good education.

Merly is a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under its micro-finance program. Her business is dried-fish vending and she sells to her neighbors and friends. She applied for the loan to provide additional capital.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn E. is 20 years old and already married to Marlo. The young couple has three children that are still young and not yet in school. They are living in San Isidro, Isabela. They work very hard and sacrifice a lot to support their family. Providing their children with a good education is one of the things Analyn wanted to achieve for them so that they have a better future.

Analyn sells different kinds of snacks which is very suitable for the summer season. She even sells different street foods in the afternoon like “isaw” (chicken intestine) and barbeque.

Analyn wants to increase her capital to gain more profit. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used in maintaining her snack-vending business which she started three months ago. She hopes that her business will continue to grow.

She is thankful that her family was able to survive with the small income they earn every day. She wants to double her time and effort towards her business which is of great help to her husband who is also doing his best to support their needs.

loans.use: To maintain her snack-vending business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria L. lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband works in the Philippine military.

She is a new member of Paglaum Coop who joined in March. She borrowed PHP 7,000 for her first loan cycle as additional capitalization for her existing business, which is the buying and selling of Ready-To-Wear (RTW) clothing items. She wishes to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy stock of Ready to Wear clothes

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia has been a distributor of Fern-C (vitamin C or ascorbic acid) vitamins for almost three years. Her products prevent different kinds of diseases like asthma, diabetes, hypertension and kidney disorders and it is also an anti-oxidant.

Being involved in this kind of work needs patience and commitment to get the trust and loyalty of her clients. She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.00 as additional capital in purchasing more Fern-C products that she will sell. The stated amount will also assist her in sending her children to school through her business. She wants to become successful in her life. She prays that God will always give her family more blessings.

Olivia C. is 48 years old. She is married to Allan, who is a government employee in their town. They live in the village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela with their three children: Valerie, 28, a nursing graduate; Alma, 18, a college student; and Francy, 6, who is studying in a daycare center.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden L. is a single parent with two children. Playing the role of both mother and father requires great sacrifice according to Eden. She is 45-years old and maintains a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village to sustain her family.

Her eldest child, Denis, is 19-years old, a high school graduate, and now working as a factory worker in Manila. The younger is Maria, 7-years old and now in elementary school. They live peacefully in the rural area of Barangay San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. Eden is eager to give her children a good life. She works hard to earn a living so she can send her daughter to school and meet their needs.

Eden wants to borrow 5, 000 PHP from the lenders so that she can expand her business. She plans to restock the groceries that she offers to her customers, hopefully to increase her income. She hopes and prays that her loan will be granted and she promises to repay in due time and be a good client. She started her business three months ago and she really hopes to have sufficient capital for her business to grow.

loans.use: To buy stock for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Q. is 29 years old and married to Bienvenido, a construction worker. They live in Barangay Alibagu Ilagan, Isabela. They were blessed with two children: Bea Isabel, 3, and Brian Daye, 6 months. She dreams that she and her husband can send them to school and support their education until college.

Elizabeth has been a vegetable vendor in their village for two years. Aside from vending, she is also busy with her poultry business. With their income, they were able to sustain their daily needs and maintain their business. However, Elizabeth wants her business to grow more, which requires her to have additional capital that she can use. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 4,000.00. The loan will be used to buy an additional supply of vegetables in order to increase her income.

“Destiny is not a matter of chance; it is a matter of choice. It is not a thing to be waited for but a thing to be achieved," said Elizabeth. She is doing everything just to achieve her goals in life for the welfare of her family. She knows that hard work is the key to success, that is why she patiently works hard in order to send her children to school and become successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy a supply of vegetables

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma and her husband sell slippers in their village as their source of income. They have four children: Arlene, 24; Nelia, 22; Junnie Francis, a 19-year-old graduating student taking a two-year course in college; and Melowin, a 14-year-old high school student. Their family lives simply in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela.

With her business and the help of God, they were able to send her two children to school. Emma wants to develop her business into a bigger one to sustain the needs of her children, but she lacks the capital to make it grow. She now seeks a loan of PHP 4,000.00 that she can use for business capital.

Emma feels happy in spite of the hardships in life. She remains strong and determined to move on. She just wants to uplift their poor living conditions. She knows that everything will be in good condition as long as they put God in everything they do and accompany it with perseverance and patience.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
“People’s fate is in their own hands, whatever success you may have now, is because you strive to work for it,” says Jacinta B.. She is 56-years old and living with her second husband in Barangay San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. Her daughter, Analiza, from her first husband who passed away, is already married and her son from her second partner is a special child.

Jacinta has been engaged in fish vending for about 30 years but there are times when she does not have anything to sell due to financial difficulties. She wants to sustain her business by having enough capital, thus she hopes to avail herself of a loan of ~ 4000 PHP to increase the productivity of her business. Vending is their only source of income and she relies on it to help with their daily living. With patience, she believes that she will be able to make her business grow and hopefully become sustainable.

loans.use: To invest in fish vending business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita lives in the rural area of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 54 years old and married to Guillermo, a carpenter. They have five children and all of them did not have the chance to continue their studies in high school because of their poor living conditions. Their children are: Randy, a 26-year-old driver; Ricky, 24; Gabriel, 22; Marvel, 20; and Marvelito, 17. Their family works together in order to surpass the hardships of life.

Lolita raises native chickens and ducks in their backyard. She gives them rice grain as their food since she does not have enough capital to provide them with feed for their fast growth. Aside from her business and the work of her husband, the family has no other source of income. Then Lolita learned about the Kiva lenders. She wants to borrow at least PHP 3,000.00 in order to buy feed supply for her chicken and ducks. If she can have excess capital, she is planning to engage in the vending business.

Living away from her children is difficult but she was thankful that they were able to have a job in a textile industry in Mountain Province. She hopes that someday they could also find ways for them to become successful. Lolita believes that “in every hard work you give, there is a reward that awaits.”

loans.use: To buy feed supply

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic C. is a 35-year-old single parent. She and her husband separated two years ago and she was left with their two children: Mark Anthony, 12, and Antonette, 9. Both of them are in the elementary level of education. She promised herself to think in a positive way and to have a positive attitude for her children.

Marivic manages a little store in their village that supports the needs of her family financially. She wants to make her business grow and because of this, she would like to borrow PHP 5,000.00 so that she can buy more stocks of groceries for her store and hopefully be able to sell meat and fish. She is also engaged in selling eggs and ducks in their public market for additional income. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that her two children will finish their studies.

According to Marivic, she is now content with her life. She knows that she and her children can survive with the help of God and with her patience in working.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of groceries

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion and her husband have been ice-cream vendors in their village for four years. They live in Cabisera 5, Centro, San Antonio Ilagan, Isabela. They were blessed with three children: Rochelle, a 19-year-old high school undergraduate due to financial difficulties; Rose-Anne, a 17-year-old high school graduate; and Rhea, who is 10 and in grade school. Consolacion and her children have a good relationship and she is thankful for God for having them.

With the business they have, they were able to generate income that supported the basic needs of their family. However, it was not enough to support the education of their children for she still wishes to send her two eldest children to school to pursue their studies. For them to do that, she and her husband must really work hard and look for opportunities to improve their business. Because of this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 that will serve as additional business capital for making ice cream and hopefully, increase their income. Consolacion also shares that success does not only require capital but also requires hard work, diligence and persevering to the best of our ability in our day-to-day work.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
“The key to success lies in our own hands and that God will always be with us if we seek His guidance,” says Corazon S.. Corazon is a simple seamstress married to Rogelio, a farmer. The couple live in San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela and are blessed with six children: Melia, 36; Lenila, 34; Jovelyn, 30; Clarita, 28; Glory, 26, and Rogelio Jr., 24. Her children were not able to pursue their college education but she is thankful that they became responsible parents and strive hard for their own families.

Corazon is an all-around sewer. She sews curtains, pants and school uniforms and she also accepts repairs and cuttings. Her business is just situated in their house. She is planning to purchase another sewing machine so she can do her work faster. For this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000.00. She wishes that her business will continue to grow more and be able to meet the needs of their family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a resident of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. She is already 55 years old and married to Nelson, a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Janet, a 30-year-old computer-science graduate who is now working as a domestic helper abroad; Jonel, a 27-year-old driver/mechanic graduate; and Joenard, a 23-year-old security guard. Lilia was glad and proud of her children because they learned to combat poverty by looking for a job. She just hopes that they will someday become successful with their chosen careers.

Lilia used to manage a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village. But for some reason it went bankrupt and closed for a time. She is now asking for financial assistance from the lenders so she can be able to reopen her store. Her request of PHP 10,000.00 will be used to buy different groceries that she can display and offer to her customers. She is working hard to uplift their living conditions. According to her, she must be very patient in order to achieve her goals in life.

She is thankful that her children also help them with their needs. Despite this, she still wants to have her own business and not depend too much on her children since they also have their own families. She was very excited to have her store back that used to be her partner in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy different groceries

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married to Antonio, who operates their passenger tricycle. The couple was blessed with three children: Magie, 27; Jun-Jun, 25; and Analyn, 24. They are all high-school graduates; however, due to lack of financial resources, they were not able to pursue their college education.

Edna wants to help her husband earn an income for their daily needs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000.00 for the maintenance of their passenger tricycle. Aside from their tricycle, she is also planning to invest some of the amount in her piggery and poultry-raising business. Her goal is to have a progressive business through the financial assistance that she would like to have.

She is wishing to have a better way of life by working hard. She believes that in every sacrifice, there is a reward ahead waiting, that is why she is doing her best to achieve her simple dreams.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa C. is 40 years old. Her husband, Catalino, is working as a driver and they are living a peaceful life in San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. They were blessed with four children: Crisanto, a 15-year-old high-school student; Christian, a 12-year-old also in high school; and Chrisilyn, 10, and Christine, 8, who are both in the elementary level of school. The family has a good family relationship and she prays that they can sustain their bonding no matter how many difficulties life may bring.

Marissa is a vendor of native snacks like “kakanin” (rice cake) in their village. She sells different snacks and with her diligence, she was able to earn a weekly income of PHP 1,000.00. Her income is being used as rolling capital and buys the necessary ingredients like glutinous rice, coconut and sugar. Her request of PHP 4,000.00 will serve as additional capital for the improvement of her business. She hopes that her request will be granted for it will really help her not only to support her business but also in sending her children to school and to provide the needs of their family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
“A man of perseverance will somehow reach the top,” said Danny B., a hard-working farmer who lives in the rural community of Bangar Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife, Adelena, is a market vendor in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have three children studying in the tertiary and secondary levels of education. Sending them to school is very costly. That is why Danny works hard to support their financial needs.

Danny visits their farmland almost every day. He plants rice and fruit trees. Every harvest, he is able to produce 60 cavans of rice -- half of it is being sold for them to have an income while the other half is being stored for family consumption. Danny wants to borrow PHP23,000 to purchase agricultural supplies to maintain their farming business. He believes that through the loan, he can increase his production and income.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is an industrious farmer. He patiently cultivates his one-hectare farmland by planting rice, corn and vegetables. He can harvest at least 60 cavans of rice and 20 cavans of corn every harvest season and that is equivalent to a gross income of PHP 40,000.00. Since their net income is too small, they still lack in capital for they also need to pay their credit from the traders. So Henry wants to borrow PHP 7,000.00 as additional business capital that he will use to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seed varieties and pesticides. He believes that he can increase his production with the financial support that Kiva lenders will provide to him.

Henry and his family are living in Barangay Bangar Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife is Angelita and they were gifted with five children. Most of them are graduates of vocational courses and have their own families. The couple is doing their best to support their daily living.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Mr. Pepe I., 66 years old, is married and lives at Buenavista, Oroquieta City. He was blessed with three children. His primary source of income comes from the "sari-sari" (general) store. He has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since May 2008. He has already had three loans. Pepe said he is thankful for the cooperative because of the financial assistance given to his family. He applied for PHP 9,000 to buy additional goods for his sari-sari store business. He hopes for a bountiful life ahead.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for his "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a direct seller of AVON products. She is 28 years old and married to Allan, a tricycle operator.  The couple was blessed with two children: Mark Angelo, 7 years old, an elementary student and Emmanuel, one year old.  Marites is happy that through their patience and hard work, her family is able to eat three times a day.  She hopes that they can continue to provide for the needs of their children.  

She would like to assist her husband in maintaining their tricycle. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 that they will use for the maintenance of their tricycle.  By helping one another, they are positive that they can send their children to school.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio cultivates their 1.5-hectare rice and vegetable farm in their village; they harvest it twice a year.  According to him, he can earn a net income of PHP 15,000 every harvest.  He would like to increase his income and for this, he would like to borrow PHP 13,000 to purchase farm inputs they need and to avoid asking for credit from capitalists.  Some of the things he will purchase are fertilizer and a variety of vegetable seeds. He hopes that with his patience and sacrifices, he can increase his yield. "There is a reward ahead if there is patience”, Emilio added. 

Emilio is a simple farmer from Barangay Bangar Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife is Erlinda and they were blessed with two children, both students.  They want to give them a better future by giving them the best education and for this, they have to work hard to achieve their goals.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
“Work hard to have a good harvest”; this is the principle of life of Jocelyn Q., a 40-year-old resident of Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya.  She is married to Joseph and they have three children, all students. The eldest is in his second year of college, the second is a fourth-year high school student and the youngest is already in pre-school. The couple helps each other manage their farming business, which is the source of income for their family.  

Aside from farming, Jocelyn also sells the vegetables that they harvest.  She accompanies her husband in planting rice and vegetables on their farm.  With her desire to increase their harvest, she is applying for loan of PHP 8,000 for maintaining their farm.  She believes that the amount will be very useful for the growth of their business.

loans.use: Farm Maintenance

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy T. aims to become successful in her farming business someday.  She is already a widow but still she has a strong determination to reach her goals with her patience and sacrifices.  She was inspired to move forward by her three children. Two of her children have graduated from a vocational course and the youngest is still studying in high school.  Mercy works very hard to provide a better education for her youngest child. 

She is engaged in farming and the hog-raising business.  She hires farmers to cultivate her farm and plants rice and corn twice a year.  Her income of PHP 10,000 every harvest is wisely budgeted for their daily commodities and the educational needs of her child.  She plans to improve her piggery by acquiring an additional piglet. Mercy is trying her best to improve her faming business since it is their major source of income.  She is now requesting a loan of PHP 23,000. It will be used to purchase fertilizer, a variety of seeds, farm labor and a piglet.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, labor and a piglet.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a native of Cagayan, Province. She is 29 years old, married and has two kids, ages 11 and 3. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business (a community-based variety store) in their village. Her store is made from very simple materials and is quite small. When she has no customers, she does household chores and takes care of their youngest child.

Her store is open from 6 in the morning until 8 in the evening. She hopes to improve her store into a bigger one and to be able to sell different commodities to meet the demands of her customers and also to generate a higher income. Thus, Juliet is requesting a loan from the lenders in the amount of PHP 12,000.00 as additional capital for her business to become productive.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Tulili

texts.en:
Tulili T., 44, is married with three children. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about $49). With this loan, she hopes to purchase knives, an axe, a ranging pole, a wheelbarrow, and other essential tools.

SPBD loans are Tulili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan.

loans.use: To purchase knives, an axe, a ranging pole, a wheelbarrow, and other essential tools.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie G. is already a widow. She was left with two children: Faith Hope, who is 14 years old and in the third year of high school, and Christian, who is 13 and in the first year of high school. They live in a rural community located in Barangay Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Rosemarie doubles her time in her farming business to support the educational needs of the children. She hopes that they may able to finish their studies until college.

Farming is their main source of income. She hired laborers to cultivate her rice field. She harvests her rice and vegetable products twice a year. She used to borrow financial capital from traders to finance her farming needs, however, the interest is too big and most of her income is being used to pay her credit. Learning about Kiva lenders, Rosemarie requested to borrow PHP 12,000.00 that she will use to maintain her farming needs. She is also planning to put up a village store to further generate additional income if she has extra capital. Being a mother and father to her two children is quite hard but she believes that she can do everything with the guidance of the Lord.

loans.use: Farming needs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
She manages a sari-sari store business (community based store) in their village.  She converted a small portion of their house into a small store.  However, due to financial difficulties, she was not able to improve her store for she used some of the capital for the education of her children.  But still, she was thankful because even her store was closed for some time it did not affect her from sending her children to school.  For this reason, Juanita is seeking for financial support for the re-opening of her store.  She is requesting to borrow a loan amount of PHP 13, 000.00 as business capital. She said that she will be very grateful if she will be given the chance to avail a loan because it will really help her family and in reaching their dreams. 

Juanita was born in the province of Cagayan in Barangay San Roque, Centro Enrile. She is 40 years old, married and have three children: Eudato, 19 years old, a college undergraduate but working as a soldier; Jay – Ar, 17 years old, college student and Janice, 15 years old, a sophomore high school student.  Juanita is hoping that they may able to support their studies through her hard work and patience.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a direct seller of Avon and Natasha products. She is 37 and married with two kids. Their eldest child is in elementary school while the youngest is at preschool. They are residing in the village of San Roque Centro, Enrile Cagayan, an agricultural-based community. Her husband manages their little corn and rice field.

Through her business, she was able to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their family. She makes use of Avon and Natasha brochures for her customers to shop for their orders. Some of her products are clothes, makeup, jewelry, footwear and so on. She wants to have more capital for her business and someday be able to have her own Avon and Natasha outlet in their town. However, she knows that it will take a lot of time, effort and patience and enough capital.

She is hoping for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 for her business to grow. She is earning an income on a commission basis of 25 percent for every PHP 100 sales. She hopes to increase her income for the future of her family. Marlyn believes that with her income, she will able to save money for the future of her children and to improve their house.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra B. is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 and married with two children. Her husband is a laborer with no regular income. She accessed a loan from Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, after becoming a member in January 2009.  She asked for a loan credit of P7,000 in order to have additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store business. The couple’s aspirations are to send their children to school, to be able to provide for their daily needs and for their children to have a good life.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: 41 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Thanh N. Thị (281) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of phường Nam Ngạn - thành phố Thanh Hoá. Thanh is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 041 - Nam Ngạn (17.08.041).

Thanh is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Thanh owns and operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving breakfast foods to customers in the local community. Thanh has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Thanh joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Thanh is requesting a loan for the first time from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 1,626,900 VND which will be used to renovate her business. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đỗ Thị Lan (284) is a 59 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. N. Thị Kiệm (282) is a 49 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Ngô Thị Tuyết (285) is a 41 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,901 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

4. N. Thị Cành (283) is a 63 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,902 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


************************************************************

Thanh N. Thị (281) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở phường Nam Ngạn - thành phố Thanh Hoá. Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 041 - Nam Ngạn (17.08.041).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ phục vụ thức ăn sáng cho khách hàng trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2009, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.626.900 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Đỗ Thị Lan (284) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. N. Thị Kiệm (282) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Ngô Thị Tuyết (285) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.901 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4. N. Thị Cành (283) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.902 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: “Cocoa” is made from “cacao” seeds commonly found in the Philippines. This is being processed manually at home by Mrs. Vicenta T., who is 72, married and living in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She started making “tabliya” (native Filipino cocoa) when she was still in her 30s. It is being sold to public markets, carenderias, canteens and community stores. The “tabliya” (cocoa) is a great help to her family, especially in raising her 10 children. Vicenta started the business with an initial capital of PHP 1,000. Her husband is her partner in the business but now, he is already too slow to work due to sickness. In preparation for their daughter’s education, she would like to earn more and thus wants to expand her business. So she asks for a loan of PHP 3,000 as additional capital for their business expansion.

loans.use: To buy additional seeds of "cacao" for native cocoa making

loans.name: Sherozdjon

texts.ru: Шероз и его тетя (на фото)арендуют торговое место и занимаются продажей женской одежды и обуви. Шероз ездит за товаром, а тетя торгует. Ему 28 лет, имеет одного ребенка. Кроме торговли он работает в одной частной фирме. Шероз собирается прикупить весенний ассортимент обуви и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Sheroz and his aunt (in photo) rent a sales location and sell women’s clothing and shoes. Sheroz travels to purchase products and his aunt sells them. He is 28 years old and has one child. In addition to his business he works at one private firm. Sheroz plans to purchase spring shoes and this is why he applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spring shoes

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru: Шохида и ее муж продают женские сумки. Шохиде 29 лет. воспитывает 2 детей. Каждое утро она отводит своих детей в детский сад, а сама отправляется на свое рабочее место торговать. Она арендует небольшое место в новом здании торгового центра. За товаром ездит ее муж на оптовые рынки, а недавно он стал ездить и на оптовый рынок в соседний Кыргызстан. Ассортимент сумок включает в себя как дешевые так и дорогие модели сумок. Шохида собирается включить в ассортимент новые модели и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Shohida and her husband are in the business of selling purses. She is 29 years old and has 2 children. Every morning, she drops her kids off at a kindergarten and then goes to work. She rents a spot in the new building of a trading center. Her husband purchases inventory from wholesale markets. Recently, he began importing goods from neighboring Kirghistan. The assortment of purses includes a wide price range of inventory. Shohida applied with Kiva so they could purchase a new line of purses and expand their inventory.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Ramolin

texts.en:
Ramolin R. is the 43-year-old mother of four. Her husband, Francisco, is a driver. Ramolin raises pigs to help support the needs of the family. She began her business when she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) five years ago.

She applied for this loan to buy piglets for fattening as well as to buy materials such as hollow blocks, cement, and sand to repair the pigpen. She will use some of her loan to finance the overhauling of their tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar) to help her husband to improve his income.

She hopes that she can save enough money to send her third son, Romnick, to college: he is now almost at the age for college enrollment. Her youngest daughter is still a child, and her two eldest sons, no longer in school, are looking for work.

loans.use: To buy piglets for fattening, to finance the repair of the pigpen, and to overhaul the tricycle.

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Розие 44 года, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России., а Розия занимается предпринимательством и продает ткани. Ассортимент тканей включает в себя все ценовые категории: от дешевых до дорогих. За товаром ездит на оптовый китайский рынок раз в неделю. А постоянное место для торговли арендует в центральном универмаге города. Розия собирается закупить оптом ситец и велюровую ткань и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Roziya is 44 years old, she is married and has 2 children. Her husband is working in Russia and Roziya is an entrepreneur and sells fabrics. Her fabric assortment includes all price categories from cheap to expensive. She travels for her products to a wholesale Chinese market once a week. Roziya rents a permanent sales location at the central department store in the city. Roziya plans to purchase chintz and velour fabrics and this is why she has put her application on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chintz and velour fabrics

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед и его жена живут в поселке городского типа Шуроб. Доход жителей данного поселка раньше был за счет угольной шахты расположенной неподалеку, так как все там работали. Сейчас шахта не работает и жители перебиваются различными видами заработков. Чамшед посоветовавшись с родителями решил открыть небольшой магазинчик и стал там торговать с женой. За товаром ездит Чамшед, а жена ему помогает в магазинчике. Чамшеду 24 года, имеет 2 детей. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 1,5 года и сейчас собирается получить новый займ для расширения своего маленького бизнеса.
texts.en:
Chamshed and his wife live in a town-like village called Shurob. The income of the residents of this village previously came from a coal mine located nearby as everyone worked there. Now the mine does not work and the residents get by via different methods of earning money. Chamshed after discussing it with his parents decided to open a small store and started selling there with his wife. He travels to purchase products and his wife helps him at the store. Chamshed is 24 years old and has 2 children. He has worked with MicroInvest for 1.5 years now and now plans to take out a new loan to grow his small business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Richlie

texts.en:
A 31-year-old businesswoman from Talic, Oroquieta City, is battling the odds with her shoe-making business. Richlie T. is married to Ronel, who is her greatest aid in their shoe-making business. The business was started by her husband with only an initial capital of php 300. Her husband was a shoe-shine man before. Because of hard work and the service he rendered, he had already gained regular customers.They decided to open a shoe-making business. Her husband is the shoemaker.

They were able to send their three children to school. To support the needs of the family, they work hard to sustain their business. They also accept shoe repairs for additional income. Richlie holds the belief that by helping each other, the business will prosper. They have taught their children to cooperate and most especially to do well with their studies.

Recently, she applied a loan of PHP 7,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, a Kiva partner. It will be used to purchase additional shoe rubber shoe and materials for shoe-making.

The couple wish to own a stall in the public market. They feel that the Lord has blessed their business. They want to see their business grow, but nothing is more fulfilling than to see their children earn their diplomas.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for shoemaking

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед имеет профессию строителя. Объединившись в бригаду он работает со своими знакомыми строителями на разных частных местах. Кроме этой работы Умед по выходным дням выходит на скотные рынки и занимается там куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота. За счет этих занятий Умед содержит свою семью. Умеду 29 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Для расширения своего бизнеса он подал заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Umed is a construction worker. As part of a brigade, he along with his co-workers work on different construction sites. Besides this work, he uses his weekends to visit animal markets to engage in cattle trade. He is able to support his family using these two sources of income. He is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. He applied for a loan with KIVA to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: На плечах Зебинисо лежит большая ответственность по содержанию своей семьи. Хотя у нее есть муж, но он нигде не работает и при этом не собирается искать работу. Кроме этого он выпивает. Зебинисо приходится находит различные способы заработка. Ей 55 лет, имеет 3 детей. Ее бизнес заключается в купле продаже жаренных семечек. Бизнес небольшой но другого заработка пока нет. Она подала заявку на КИВА и планирует прикупить сырые семечки оптом.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is 55, married, and has 3 children. She has a significant responsibility to support her family, since her husband is unemployed and is not planning to look for a job. Besides that, he drinks. Zebiniso has to find different ways of finding an income source. Her main business is selling toasted sunflower seeds. It does not bring large profit; however, that is her only source of income. She applied for a loan with KIVA so she could purchase additional quantities of raw sunflower seeds.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw seeds at wholesale prices

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат и ее муж работают в колхозе. Ей недавно исполнилось 40 лет, воспитывает 3 детей. Сейчас сезон полевых работ и работы очень много. Но по выходным Мухабат и ее муж выходят на рынки и занимаются куплей продажей скота. Это один из дополнительных видов заработка и супруги планируют немного расширить его и для этого подали заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Muhabat and her husband work on a collective farm. She recently turned 40, and has three children. The field work season has begun and there is a lot of work to do. Still, on weekends Muhabat and her husband go to the market to buy and sell livestock. This is one way that they make extra money, and the couple plans to expand the business a little with the help of a Kiva loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana Gladys M. M. , vive en Ahuachapán junto a su esposo e hijo. Gladys se dedica a la venta de pollo y verduras en el mercado de Ahuachapán, sus ventas son a diario, y sus ingresos muy estables, ya que posee 13 años de experiencia en este negocio, por tal razón ya es reconocida en la zona y maneja una clientela  favorable, pero Ana Gladys solicita un crédito para comprar variedad y cantidad de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Gladys M. M. lives in Ahuachapan with her husband and son. She operates a business selling poultry and vegetables in the Ahuachapan market. Her sales and income are very steady. She has 13 years experience in the business and, as a consequence, she's well known in the neighborhood and has a loyal customer base. Ana Gladys is applying for a loan to buy a wider variety and larger quantities of merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru: Супруги Эназаровы работают в колхозе. На их плечах лежит большая ответственность – они являются охранниками на одном из полевых участков. Кроме работы в колхозе Зумрат занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов. Она покупает сухофрукты и после проведенной сортировки продает и получает хорошую прибыль. Зумрат 45 лет, у нее 3 детей. Она подала заявку на КИВА и собирается закупить чернослив и сушеные яблоки.
texts.en:
The Enazarovs work on a collective farm. As the gatekeepers for one of the field sections they have a large responsibility. In addition to work on the farm Zumrat also buys and sells dried fruit. She buys the dried fruit and earns a good profit from selling it after sorting. Zumrat is 45 years old and has three children. She applied for a loan from Kiva and plans to purchase prunes and dried apples.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dried fruit

loans.name: Umia

texts.ru: Умия продает детскую одежду в центральном универмаге города Исфара. Занимается этим давно,  с тех пор как перестала работать в госучреждении. Теперь торговля для нее постоянное занятие и этим содержит свою семью. Ей 40 лет, имеет 3 детей. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 3 года и показала себя активным и ответственным клиентом. Сейчас подала новую заявку и собирается немного освежить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Umia sells children's clothing in Isfara's central department store. She has been in this business for a long time, since she left work at a state institution. Now sales is her full-time employment and means of supporting her family. She is 40 years old and has three children. She has worked with Microinvest for three years, proving to be an active and responsible client, and has submitted a new application. She plans to bring some new goods into her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel O., 34, is a mother of two. She is already a widow, but trying her best to work very hard to support the needs of her two kids, ages seven and 11.

Her first loan through ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) was used to finance her present business, which is dressmaking. However, her income is not enough to buy enough food and provide for the basic needs of her family, so she wishes to supplement her income by raising pigs. She has applied for the current loan to buy piglets, materials to be used in construction of the pigpen, and feed for the pigs. She will also use part of her loan to buy textiles for her sewing. She plans to buy the sewing materials in bulk in order to get a lesser price in the market.

She hopes that she will be able to send her kids to college so that they will not experience the kinds of hardships she herself experiences.

loans.use: To buy piglets for fattening and to obtain additional capital for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: 01 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Lan H. Thị, a 54-year-old female living in Thanh Hoá, Vietnam, is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01 - Nam Ngạn (17.01.01).

Lan, who is married and has three adult children, owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the selling of dried goods in the local community. Lan has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lan has already repaid a previous loan of 2,442,600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND for additional expansion. This will be Lan’s fourth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Ngô Thị Ân is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 2. P. Thị Mạc is a 63-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 3. M. Thị Hương is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 4. Vũ Thị Hoà is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Mrs. Elsa L. is 46 years old and married. She lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been an active and good member of Paglaum MPC for four years. The couple manages their business of vending vegetables, which is located in their house. Her customers are their neighbors and people in the neighboring barangay. Her business is still in progress. She hopes she can expand her business soon.

loans.use: To buy stocks of vegetables and spices

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha T. has been a member of Paglaum under the micro finance program for six years. She is 54 years of age and is married to Emeliano T.. She is blessed with three children and presently resides at Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. They own a motorcycle, which is driven by her husband. Mrs. Editha wants a loan of 20,000PHP for her Pig Raising project to buy pigs, feed and vitamins. She wants to have more pigs and a pigpen someday and wants to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela V. E., vive en Santa Tecla municipio La Libertad. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, el negocio se encuentra ubicado frente al parque San Martin, donde hay mucha afluencia de personas que pueden ver a simple vista todo lo que Blanca tiene en su puesto, Blanca ya ha sido cliente de otras instituciones financieras y sus pagos han sido muy puntuales, hoy solicita un nuevo crédito por que quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela V. E. lives in Santa Tecla in the city of La Libertad. Her business is selling undergarments for women and men. The business is located in front of San Martin Park, where there are many people pass by and see what she has for sale in her stand. Blanca has been a client of other financial institutions and she has proved that she always makes her loan payments on time. She now wants more money to buy merchandise to stock her business.

(Translated by Elizabeth of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 66-year-old widow with one child. Despite her age, she is always busy in her vegetable garden, which is her major source of income. She plans to expand the gardening area with assorted vegetables. She asked for a loan of 11,000, to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her backyard garden project. Teresita has religiously paid her obligation to the coop since the start of her availment. She truly believes that through the help of Paglaum & KIVA she can access more capital for her project.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her gardening

loans.name: 31-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mai H. Thị (204) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Thàng Phố T. Hoá. Mai is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 31-Nam Ngan (31-Nam Ngan IV).

Mai is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mai owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beef products in the local community. Mai has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mai joined Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mai has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,963,500 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women. Mai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. N. Thị Dậu (113) is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,963.500 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

2. Ngô T. Thuỷ (201) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

3. N. Thị Phương (140) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

4. P. Thị Kim (203) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

5. T. Thị Nguyệt (202) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6. N. Thị Thuỷ (201) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women: The mission of Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


************************************************************

Mai H. Thị (204) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thàng Phố T. Hoá. Mai là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 31-Nam Ngan (31-Nam Ngan IV).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t bò trong cộng đồng địa phương. Mai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Mai kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, Mai đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Mai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.963.500 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. N. Thị Dậu (113) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Ngô T. Thuỷ (201) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

3. N. Thị Phương (140) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4. P. Thị Kim (203) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

5. T. Thị Nguyệt (202) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6. N. Thị Thuỷ (201) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef and noodles to make products for sale and to buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Coronacion

texts.en:
Coronacion G. is 26 and has three children. Her husband, Joey, is a driver. She sells fish - such as milk fish, tilapia, shrimps, and prawns - in the town market of Hamtic, to help support the needs of the family. 

She started her business when she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) in 2000. Her membership has really helped her because she was able to provide a tricycle (a bicycle with a sidecar) for her husband from her income. She also purchased furniture and utensils for the house and has been able to save money toward the education of her children.

She applied for this loan to buy more stock so as to increase her income. She dreams of selling to the vendors in the market from her own stall someday.

loans.use: To buy fish for retail sale.

loans.name: Laura Leticia

texts.es: Laura Leticia R. R., vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, Laura es empleada medio tiempo de un consultorio médico, pero nació de ella una idea que ahora es su principal fuente de ingreso; en vista de la necesidad de muchas madres que trabajan y no hay quienes cuiden de sus hijos, Laura monto una guardería;  de la cual ahora muchas madres están felices  y reconocen lo indispensable que es tener una guardería en la zona. Laura solicita un crédito para la compra de inmuebles, para su guardería.
texts.en:
Laura Leticia R. R. lives in the neighborhood of Soyapango in the city of San Salvador. Laura works part time in a doctor's office and while she was working there she got the idea to start her business, which now is her main source of income. When she was working at the doctor's office she realized that there are many working mothers that did not have anyone to take care of their children. Laura started a daycare center. Now the mothers that she serves are happy and they are so thankful that Laura started a daycare center in their neighborhood. Laura is asking for a loan to be able to buy furniture for her daycare center.

(Translated by Nigel of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture for her daycare center.

loans.name: Bethylyn

texts.en: Mrs. Bethylyn O., 45, is a resident of Brgy. Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Jovenal and they have three children. She earns money through fish vending, supported by her husband who is a fisherman. They started with only one fishing boat and through their hard work and good way of living, they were able to buy another one. The purpose of their loan is to buy additional fishing equipment such as fishing net and a motorboat. They want to have another fishing boat for extra income to enable them to send their children to school. They also wish to renovate their house.

loans.use: additional capital (fish vending)

loans.name: Penita

texts.en:
Penita F., 25, is married with two children. She has three years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (about $50).

SPBD loans are Penita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan. She will use the loan to improve her business by buying chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, and weed killer.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, and weed killer.

loans.name: Lucila Florentina

texts.es: Lucila Florentina H. B. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, Lucila es madre soltera de una hija. Lucila se dedica a su negocio que es una pequeña tienda ubicada dentro de su domicilio, Lucila obtiene buenas ventas ya que su tienda está ubicada en una buena zona;  donde no hay competencia cerca. Lucila quiere invertir más en su tienda, tener mayor cantidad de productos y más variedad, es por ello que está solicitando un crédito para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucila Florentina H. B. lives in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. Lucila is a single mother and has a daughter. Lucila makes a living through her business which is a small store that is located inside of her home. Lucila's sales are good since she lives in a good area and there is not any competition close to her. Lucila wants to invest more money in her store and have a greater quantity of products and more variety. For this reason she is asking for a loan to be able to fill her store with more merchandise.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with more merchandise.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: A lady fisher, that is Mrs. Paulita G., 44 years old, of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married to a fisherman and blessed with two children. Her one child is now in Grade 6. She is a new member of PAGLAUM MPC – Tangub City under the PDP-LP Program. Her usual customers are their neighbors, the fish vendor in the market and sometimes the wholesaler. She joined PAGLAUM MPC because she believes that this institution can help them in crossing the bridge to success. Her future plan is to build a little Sari-sari store someday so that in times of bad weather, still they will earn in other ways by not depending merely on fishing. She also wants all her children to pursue their education until college. Now she is applying for PHP 3,000 as her first availment for the purpose of purchasing additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
A 56-year-old woman from San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental is coping with the challenges of life, especially the existence of a global crisis.  Mrs. Basilisa M., a widow with two kids, started her “sari-sari” business with a little capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She joined for the chance to receive loans. Her husband died due to severe sickness. 
Basilisa is considered a Member in Good Standing. Faced with various challenges, as a single parent, she is assured of Paglaum MPC’s help. She is fond of the cooperative's various programs and services, micro-entrepreneurship training among others. 
Her small business has been doing so well that she confidently decided to expand. She has in mind to maintain a good credit standing, and then, whatever may happen, she can always run to the cooperative. She envisions expanding her business into a mini-grocery someday.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu F., 28, is married with two children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public one day per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 260 Tala (about $110).

SPBD loans are Fetu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan. She wishes to use it to buy bush knives, sacks of fertilizers, chemicals, gloves, and a weed-killer.

loans.use: To buy bush knives, sacks of fertilizers, chemicals, gloves, and a weed-killer.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline A., 37, is married with four children. She and her husband are farmers. She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (about $120).

SPBD loans are Pauline’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan. The loan will be used solely to support the business, specifically by purchasing chemicals, bush knives, spades, an axe, fertilizer, and a new weed-killer.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bush knives, spades, an axe, fertilizer, and a new weed-killer.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan T. Nguyễn was born in 1984. (No: 010105060027 ). She lives with her husband and two children. They have a breeding farm (chicken, pigs, fish) and they grow trees. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND (or 225 USD). She is a group leader. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry. There are four other Fund participants in her group.
 Hồng Thị Đặng was born in 1974. (No: 010105060030). She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND.  She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (or 233 USD) to breed pigs and poultry. 
 Hồng Thị Vương was born in 1975. (no:010105060031). She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 VND (112 USD). She wants to borrow 3.706.000 VND (or 208 USD)  to breed pigs and poultry. 
 Tuyết Thị Ánh Trử was born in 1982. (No:: 010105060028). She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND (169 USD). She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (or 233 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana T., 34, is married with three children.  She has had five years of experience in the ice cakes business. She sells to school children and village people, five days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 tala (~$65 US).  SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, plastic cups, cordial and chinese lollies

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Maria Leticia O. G. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, junto a su mamá. Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa, en la cual también le ayuda su madre; el negocio lo tiene ubicado en la casa donde vive,  pero diariamente sale a ofrecer  y a distribuir mercadería en bazares de la zona, de San Salvador, Maria ya ha obtenido créditos en los cuales ha sido muy responsable en sus cuotas; ahora solicita un nuevo crédito,  porque quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su inventario de productos.
texts.en:
Maria Leticia O. G. lives with her mother in San Salvador's Soyapango neighborhood. She operates a business selling clothing in which, too, her mother helps her. The business is located in the house where she lives but she goes out every day to peddle her wares in markets around San Salvador. Maria has received loans before and has been very responsible in repaying them. Now she's applying for a new loan because she wants to buy merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita S. is 30 years old, married to Bonie, and has three children. They live in the town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has requested a loan amount of PHP 7,000 for the financing of their fishing business, which her husband will manage. Conchita dreams that her husband will catch abundant fish, because she would like to buy a pump boat and fishing accessories. She also has a vision to have a concrete house and for her children to finish their studies someday.

loans.use: For financing of her fishing business

loans.name: Vaofetu

texts.en:
Vaofetu F., 47, is married with five children. She has five years of experience in making elei prints (traditional Samoan fabric printing). She sells in retail in the village and at the main market at Salelologa five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $120).

SPBD loans are Vaofetu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She has one previous loan with SPBD. The current loan will be used to purchase cotton materials, elei board, paintbrushes, and paints for making elei.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, elei board, paintbrushes, and paints for making elei.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Эшматов Одилчон- мужчина 30 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Одилчон занимается. Одилчон после того как  приехал из заработок, с Российский Федерации в майе 2008 года занялся  откормом и продажей мелко рогатого кота. Одилчон имеет достаточный опыт в этой сфере. На полученный займ хочет купит  корм для своих овец. Таким образом, Одилчон ведет свои хозяйства и кормит свою семью. Ему также помогает сын и жена. Жена Одилчона  Гульмира имеет опыт работы в сфере откорма скота
texts.en:
Odiljob E. is thirty years old, married, and has one child. Since he returned in May 2008 from working in Russia he has been raising and selling small livestock, an area in which he has experience. He would like to use a loan to buy feed for his sheep. This business allows him to take care of his property and feed his family. His wife and son also help him. Odiljon's wife Gulmira also has experience in raising livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Zuhriddin
