texts.ru: Назаров Зухриддин- мужчина 27 лет. Женат имеет одного ребенка. Зухриддин имеет 3 летный  стаж в сфере животноводства. Зухриддин является, членом фермерского хозяйства «Сино» Аштского района также дополнительно занимается выращиванием лука и картофеля. На ведение хозяйства ему помогают братья и отец. Откормив, свой скот Зухриддин за 3-4 месяца продает и покупает заново скот. Зухриддин нравятся с нами работать, потому что ему нравятся наши условия.
texts.en:
Zuhriddin N. is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. Zuhriddin has three years of experience in animal husbandry. He is a member of the "Sino" farm enterprise in the Asht district, and also grows onions and potatoes on the side. His brothers and father help with the farming as well. After fattening his livestock over 3-4 months Zuhriddin sells them and buys new animals. Zuhriddin enjoys working with us as he finds our loan conditions favorable.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.ru: Жураев Уктамчон –мужчина 51 лет. Женат отец троих детей. У Уктама есть стадо мелко- рогатого скота, состоящее из 15 овцов и 6 козлов. Ему помогают дети. Старший сын находится, на заработках в Российской Федерации который помогает родителям высылая им деньги. Уктамчон также является членом дехканского хозяйства. Уктамчон получив займ хочет  расширить свою деятельность и увеличит свое стадо. Жена Уктамчона является домохозяйкой, в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи.
texts.en:
Uktamjon J. is 51 years old. He is married and the father of three children. Uktamjon has a herd of small livestock - 15 sheep and 6 goats. His children help him. The eldest son works in Russia and helps his parents by sending home money. Uktamjon is also a member of a small farm enterprise. He would like a loan to expand his activities and increase his livestock herd. His wife is a homemaker and works with wool in her spare time, kniitting various pieces of warm clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Maria Marta R. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador,  junto a su hija. Maria se dedica a su negocio una tortillería ubicada dentro de su vivienda;  la cual es muy demandada en la zona, por los vecinos que prefieren las tortillas de doña Maria; pero Maria no solo hace tortillas, también ha montado una pequeña tienda con productos de primeras de necesidad y otros que sus fieles clientes le exigen, es por ello que Maria esta solicitando un crédito, para invertir en su tienda y tenerla más surtida,  y así sus clientes siempre la preferirán como hasta el día de ahora.
texts.en:
Maria Marta R. lives with her daughter in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. She operates a tortilleria [a tortilla shop] from her house and her tortillas are in great demand in the neighborhood. But Maria doesn't just make tortillas. She has also set up a small general store selling everyday products and other goods requested by her customers. It's for the store that Maria is applying for this loan. She wants to invest in the store and better stock it so that her customers will always be as pleased with it as they are now.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.ru: Сулаймонов Юсуфчон - мужчина 38 лет. Женат отец 4-х детей. Юсуфчон с юности занимался откормом  скота помогая родителям. Из за финансового кризиса  Юсуфчон не давно приехал с Российской Федерации из заработков так как их строительную бригаду сократили и он остался без работы. Так как в селе нет работы Юсуфчон хочет увеличит количество своего домашнего скота. Юсуфчону нравится заниматься скотоводством. Жена Юсуфчона работает доярка в местной ферме и в свободное время помогает мужу.
texts.en:
Yusufjon S. is 38 years old. He is married and the father of 4 children. He recently returned from working in Russia, since his construction team was slashed and he was left without work. Since there is no work in the village Yusufjon wants to expand his herd of livestock. He enjoys animal husbandry. His wife works as a milker at a local farm and helps her husband in her spare time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Gairatchon

texts.ru: Эшматов Гайратчон- мужчина 43 лет. Женат отец 3-х детей. Откорм и продажа домашнего скота является основным видом деятельности Гайратчона. Гайратчон кредитуется уже 2 года. Когда он пришел брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. В данный момент большое количество мелко рогатого скота.  Также Гайратчон помогает своей жене по хозяйству выращиванием помидор и огурцов.
texts.en:
Gairatchon E. is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. His main business is raising and fattening livestock for sale. He has been receiving loans for the last 2 years. At the time of his initial loan he had very few animals. Today he has a lot of small livestock such as sheep. In addition to his business Gairatchon also helps his wife grow tomatoes and cucumbers.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise & feed livestock for sale

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en: Thịnh Thị Nguyễn (no:010105060029)was born in 1985 and she and her husband have 2 children. Her husband works and they have a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. Her family has a fishpond and she wants to borrow 4.142.000 (or 233 USD) to breed duck and fish.

loans.use: to breed duck and fish

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en: Gantuya N. is 27, married and the mother of two sons. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a rented home in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district. In 2006, together with her husband Gansuh, she started running a family tailoring business. They sew many types of clothes for men and women including heavy coats and sell them through the "Mongol baraa" shop. With the profit, she has bought two sewing machines and one cross machine. As her equipment improved, her working income and working capital has increased. Gantuya is a very responsible woman and her hope is to have her own tailoring company in the future. With this loan, she will buy more cotton for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cotton for her tailoring business

loans.name: Abduhamid

texts.ru: Хайитов Абдухамид- мужчина 44 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей. Абдухамид занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Он имеет большой опыт по продажей и откормом скота. Абдухамиду помогает старший сын Абдулло. Абдухамид и его сын каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их и вечером отгоняет их обратно. Абдухамид за этот новый заем хочет купить средних быков. Откормив их 4-5 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену.
texts.en:
Abduhamid H. is 44 years old, married with 3 children. For his living he raises and fattens livestock for sale, while his wife sells milk. Abduhamid has a lot of experience in buying and selling of livestock. He is also helped by his eldest son Abdullo. Every morning they take their herd out into the mountains to graze and return back with the herd in the evening. Abduhamid would like to use this new loan to buy some young bulls, feed them for 4-5 months and then sell them at a very profitable price.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young bulls to feed & sell

loans.name: Turgunboi

texts.ru:
Мадалиев Тургунбой- мужчина 52 лет. Женат имеет 5-х детей и 4-х внуков. У Тургунбоя есть стадо мелко рогатого скота, примерно 25 овец, 12 коз и 2 дойные коровы. Его жена домохозяйка. Она также помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Утром и вечером она доит корову и продаёт молоко. Овцы и козы пасутся в горах на пастбище. Тургунбой очень любить свою работу так как он этим занимается с юношеского возраста. 
Кредит получил для расширения коровника.
texts.en:
Turgunboi M. is 52 years old, married with 5 children and also has 4 grand children. He has a herd of about 25 sheep, 12 goats and 2 dairy cows. His wife is a housewife and also helps him with the livestock. She milks the cows in morning and evening and sells the milk. The sheep and goats are grazed in the mountains. Turgunboi loves his work, he has been doing this since his youth. He wants to use the loan to expand the cattle shed.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the cattle shed

loans.name: Miriam Estela

texts.es: Miriam Estela G. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, Miriam es una mujer viuda que ha aprendido a sostener  a su familia con esfuerzo y mucho trabajo. Miriam se dedica a su negocio que es la venta de ropa y zapatos, diariamente sale de su casa a ofrecer su productos , en el transcurso de la semana viaja a todos los departamentos del país yendo a uno  diferente cada día y  haciendo todas  sus ventas de manera ambulante, Miriam solicita este crédito para poder comprar más mercadería de esta manera lograra un mayor margen de ganancias .
texts.en:
Miriam Estela Garcia lives in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. She is a widow who has learned to support her family with strength and hard work. Miriam operates a business selling clothes and shoes. She goes out every day to sell her goods and, in the course of a week, she travels to every part of the country, working as a street vendor in a different place every day. Miriam is asking for this loan so that she can buy more merchandise and, in this way, increase her earnings margin.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi T., 49, is married with five children.  She has one year of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the village people and school, six days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 tala (~$60 US).  SPBD loans are Naomi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to buy supplies to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable oil, tongs, frying pan, oven etc.

loans.name: Gombodorj

texts.en:
Gombodorj D. lives with his wife in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Gombodorj has two grown-up children who live separately with their own families.

Together with his wife, Oyunchimeg, Gombodorj runs a small retail business selling phone cards and mobile phone accessories. In 2004, he rented a stall in a local market and started selling the phone cards that he bought from wireless phone service operators at wholesale prices and his wife sells them through their stall.

Their business started with 400,000 MNT (approximately $290) of capital. After a few successful years he has become an official distributor of phone cards for all four major domestic operators, and receives exclusive discount wholesale prices. Recently, he added two more domestic operators, G-Mobile and Mongolian Telecom Company. His business capital has increased to 1,500,000 MNT.

Gombodorj hopes to have his own shop to sell his phone cards, instead of renting a small stall at the local market. He requests a loan to purchase more phone cards for his business.

In the photo, Gombodorj's spouse Oyunchimeg is shown at their phone card sales stall.

loans.use: To purchase more phone cards for his business

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina P., 34, is married with two children. She has one year of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the village people six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about $49).

SPBD loans are Sosefina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan. She wishes to use it to purchase corn, an oven, a frying pan, oil, and plastic bags.

loans.use: To purchase corn, an oven, a frying pan, oil, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Mrs. Wendy C., a 21-year-old resident of Maquilao, Tangub City, is a new member of the PDP-LP Program of PMPC- Tangub City. Newly married to a man working as a driver and fisherman and without dependents, Wendy joined this program to enjoy the benefits offered by our co-op and to start a livelihood in partnership with her parents-in-law.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase fishing equipment such as nets and lights. She is hoping that someday they can build a house, own a fishing boat, have children and be totally independent. She believes that KIVA and PAGLAUM will make all of these dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchasing fishing equipment.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya S. lives with her husband and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her two daughters are high school students. Narantuya runs a business selling baked goods. She started her business in 2006 by purchasing baked goods from a wholesale market and selling them at the stall she rented in a local market. She sells six types of baked goods, and the local market where she rents a stall is in an attractive location.

Her current business capital is 930,000 MNT and she sees a great opportunity to expand and increase her profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bakery products from the wholesale market.

loans.use: To purchase more bakery products from the wholesale market.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga T., 38, is married with four children. She has five years of experience in the crop plantation business. She sells to the villagers and the public three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala (about $80).

SPBD loans are Faaiuga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her second SPBD loan. She plans to purchase sacks of fertilizers, chemicals, and weed killer.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, chemicals, and weed killer.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Our featured member, in the person of Mrs. Fe U., is an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PMPC – Tangub City Satellite Office. She is 56 years old and residing in Minsubong, Tangub City. She has four children. Her husband is an electrician and is presently employed at MOELCI II Tangub City – an Electric Cooperative of Misamis Occidental.

Mrs. U. is on her third loan cycle and is applying for the amount of PHP 10,000 to be used for her hog-fattening business, specifically to purchase feed for hog-growing and hog maintenance.

She started this business several years ago by buying just one pig and raising it to become a sow. Mrs. U. is planning to build a piggery building someday. She hopes that her daughter can find better work with support from her financially through the income from her business and hand in hand with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase hog grower and hog maintenance feeds
